Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maartenmathijs
Reviews.Content: We loved the Intercontinental. It is a nice hotel that shows a lot of tradition of Singapore, on the in- and outside. As stated here many times before, the Club Lounge is fantastic and well worth the extra money. Our special thanks go to the ever smiling Nana and funny Raj, two people that contributed much to making our stay unforgettable ;-). We were in the newly renovated shophouse room 327 (no view) and a standard room 1104 (side view to Marina Bay Sands etc.). We would prefer the room with a view.........

Reviews.Title: “Great Club Service”
Reviews.Author: AWJC
Reviews.Content: My second visit to this Hotel and i was impressed by the Club Lounge service on my 1st visit but i must say it has improved in terms of food and beverage offering and is top notch (great cocktails and wines). It also has to be said that the staff are the key ingredient in the lounge as they are fantastic and make you feel welcome and really look after you. As a Platinuim Ambassdor i was upgraded to a junior suite which was very comfortable (great bed) but i must say the room was in need of being modernised as it is now a bit old fashioned but i beleive the hotel is working through a renovation programme at the moment. The swimming pool is quite small so if busy you might struggle to get a bed. Overall great service and a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Quality with a capital "Q"”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times, and it is consistently great. The club lounge is worth paying the extra for, breakfast, Internet, evening cocktails, use of a meeting room are all value added items that bring me back to this hotel. I have tried others in Singapore, but keep coming back. Location is central to the "Bugis St" tourist area and walking distance to electronic superstores.

Reviews.Title: “The power of Tripadvisor ?”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the InterCon. on our way back from Europe to Australia. Knowing Singapore well I was going to book a hotel "blind" but having used Traveladvisor very successfully for many hotels this trip I flicked over to see what was recommended (or not). As a direct result of the advice on TA we booked a "Shophouse Club Room" and whilst it was a bit more expensive than some of the other hotels on offer there were a couple of things that swung the decision: 1. Free wifi 2. A Club room - which we could use after the late check out and before heading off to the evening flight - which includes in the cost breakfast and refreshments during the day. The hotel staff were simply excellent, breakfast in the club room was very good, the room very good and bed just spot on including a great choice of pillows. When next in Singapore I'll put this hotel on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was fine...”
Reviews.Author: GalaxyRacer
Reviews.Content: The location is very strategic. Front Office - Pleasant personnel and were very helpful. Rooms - set up was not complete when we arrived in the room, we have to call for addiitonal amenities as we were in transit hence all our stuff was at the airport. The bed was very comfortable as it has a topper on it. Housekeeping personnel on the floor was very pleasant although the shower room was a bit mouldy and the bath tub have the same signs especially where you put your soap in. The bath tub needs reconditioning. The Operator gave us a call to check on us which was very nice, as we kept on calling after discovering items were not in the room. Food and Beverage - The Lounge personnel were all pleasant and very attentive. The breakfast restaurant was also good. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best service in any hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: chelsey k
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the early evening after a long flight.at the check in desk it was noted that we had booked a club room and we were taken to the club room to check in . It was cocktail hour so we were offered drinks and as my wife and daughter were escorted to a table for cocktails I sat at the check in desk with a beer and nibbles.after check in we sat in the lounge and enjoyed the food and drinks and the quite excellent service. The room was very nice and the bathroom had some nice elemis products.the location of the hotel is perfect as it is located above bugis MRT and next to bugis junction shopping centre . The public areas of the hotel are lovely and the breakfast was very good quality. Special mention to the bar staff in the Victoria lounge who closed the bar at the usual time but allowed me to watch a football match involving a team that I support well into the early hours on the giant screen - unbelievable ! This was the start of our trip around south east Asia and this hotel was a tremendous choice . We arrived back into Singapore 2 weeks later and stayed at raffles and the service in the intercontinental was every bit as good if not better .stay here and book a club room - you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lost potential - needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: divvy_l
Reviews.Content: I feel this could be a very good hotel - but isn't. While I have only stayed here once (and I came wanting to like the place) I have learnt enough to doubt whether I would consider returning. In principle there is quite a bit to like about this hotel. It is in a tasteful building with a pretty lobby (although not immediately at the vehicular entry to the hotel) and is attached to the charismatic Bugis Junction shopping centre (with classical Singaporean shopfronts in airconditioned comfort as well as an MRT station). Sadly the finishing touches are what are lacking. The rooms feel cramped and the views (even on high floors) feel industrial and constraining. Although there are Elemis toiletries in the bathrooms, and a pleasant fruit bowl is provided on arrival, the installations seem tired. Wait staff, although doing their job technically adequately, were tired and disinterested. Service in fact was often brusque. I was interrogated for sitting in the lobby without ordering a drink (I understand there must be problems with flow-over from the shopping centre, but I was reasonably well-dressed and the majority of tables were empty). After late check-out was granted I was called three times in the hour before the agreed time asking whether I was ready to check out yet. The check-in staff were unwelcoming and disconnected - and while I admit bias in that my Priority Club Gold status yielded absolutely no upgrades or concessions (which is their entitlement), my friend (who is Priority Club Platinum and a member of the Ambassador program as well) got an upgrade in name only (his room was exactly the same) and was denied access to the club lounge. If you can't please that kind of customer with what they would consider basics then you have got problems. All in all it certainly does not make a compelling argument to return. While it isn't a four star hotel, frankly in this price range it should be doing much better.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Richard1242
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental on the advice of our travel advisor in Penang ( thanks Gillian at Friendship Travel ) and what good advice. From the moment the taxi door opened until 3 days later we got back in our taxi to the airport,the service with a smile was evident. We were checked in quickly and even taken to the lift by the Receptionist,a first anywhere in the world, and she even pressed the floor button for us! Our Club room on the 12 th floor had a great view over the city and was immaculate in all respects,some of the largest and fluffiest towels we've seen we're much appreciated,also the good quality toiletries. Our room included access to the Club lounge and that is where the service went up to anew level in our experience. The whole staff in the Club Lounge dedicated themselves to giving world class service,professionally but with a great smile. Nothing was too much trouble and each time you finished a drink the next one was at your elbow. Although we hadn't said anything the staff came out with a birthday cake for my wife and sang to her. This was then repeated in the Chinese restaurant which is part of the hotel,wow! After breakfast on our last day we checked out and our luggage was stored for us until our taxi arrived for our early evening flight,we were encouraged to use the Club lounge to relax in until we departed. All in all the best experience at an hotel anywhere in the world and we are planning our next weekend away to the Intercontinental already.

Reviews.Title: “what a place!!”
Reviews.Author: SallyW5
Reviews.Content: great location, stayed in a club room and it was worth the extra money. club room itself was spacious, quiet,and the staff very attentive. bedroom was very quiet, big and well appointed with a beautiful bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial style Intercontinental in a good spot”
Reviews.Author: Travelefes
Reviews.Content: This hotel clearly dates back from the colonial times but has been beautifully maintained. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped, the outside pool area is very nice and the main extractions of Singapore are all within walking distance. Good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “just a perpect holiday”
Reviews.Author: jannarat
Reviews.Content: As from the pick up at the airport until the transport back we had a perfect holiday in a perfect hotel. Staff, service, room, location all excellent.(mentioning for the third time perfect is too much) Did you ever enjoyed having a menu for your pillow?? No?? I had. I stayed with my wife and son in a club room and very day we enjoyed having a breakfast and cocktails in the club lounge. The location is very good, near or better almost in a shopping mall, short taxi ride to Clarke Quai and Orchard Road. MTS is just a block away. For us it was during 6 days our home and we did not like to leave the hotel. We will be back and certainly stay in the Intercontinental again

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Gary L
Reviews.Content: I used to travel to Singapore regularly for work and I have stayed in a lot of the luxury hotels there. This one is by far my favourite hotel. I still travel to Singapore 1-2 times per year and I always stay here. I am a Royal Ambassador member and I am always treated like royalty when i stay here. The location on Middle Road is great, the check in experience is the best I have had- very quick and personal, it really makes me feel at home. The rooms are great, beds are like sleeping on a cloud, the hotel amenities are extensive and there is nothing the staff cannot do for you... Food and bars are good- they have an amazing chinese restaurant in this hotel- Man Fu Yuan- a long standing and popular restaurant in Singapore. The recently redesigned Club lounge is also large and offers many amenities.. I really enjoy the evening cocktails in this lounge. Large pool with outdoor Spa and Jacuzzi and Gym in the Health club. Customer Service in Singapore is on average very good, but I feel it is a cut above here. Overall I rate it 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CazziD
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be faulted. The staff were so polite, helpful and genuinely friendly. The decor was just beautiful and very light and airy. The courtyard was very tastefully decorated. We loved our room and it was very spacious with the softest bed. Sitting downstairs in the bar/lounge area was wonderfully relaxing and the service was speedy and friendly. Breakfast was excellent with an enormous variety of food complete with a chef who cooked omelettes and waffles on demand. This hotel was the best I have ever stayed in and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No connectivity”
Reviews.Author: HKguy
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel; great location, standard big-chain fittings and the usual service. What really ruins the experience though is the whole massive palaver surrounding internet connectivity. It costs S$140 PER DAY for two people sharing a room to use the internet. I do realize this sounds insane, but unfortunately it's true. Rates clearly specify S$30.57 PER DEVICE per day (+ 17% service charges and taxes). Since 95% of people in 2012 traveling on business and staying in hotel chains like this have both laptop and smartphone, that's 4 devices per room or S$140 per day. Does anyone think this is a reasonable policy? Seriously? On top of the S$300 room rate? The backpacker's hostel across the street charges S$18 per night, and somehow they manage to provide free internet. The hotel bar claims free internet but when I sat down and ordered a beer, then got out my laptop, it didn't work. 2 managers, 3 IT guys, and 30 minutes later, it still didn't work. I went outside across the street to a dive bar with grease on the floor and cheap beer, and within 1 minute had a perfect, free connection. I could review the great location, the lovely showerhead and pressure, the nice lack of pretension, plentiful taxis, convenient MRT, and useful pool. I could, but I cannot. Because all I can remember of this visit really is the fact that for 4 full days I was out of touch with my business, and/or spent my mornings roaming the side streets, laptop in hand, looking for a wifi signal. We have just opened a business in Singapore, almost right across the street. We do and will have 3-4 people per month coming and staying 3-4 days per visit. I would give these 16 room nights every month to the Intercon. Would love to. But I can't. Why? Because our company can't afford S$2,240 per month in internet charges. Fun hotel fact: Great place to get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , we like it and will return”
Reviews.Author: Bzh56
Reviews.Content: We go regularly in Singapore and tried several 5* hotels (Sands, Mandarin , Pan Pacific ..) all around the Marina , and were agreeably surprised by the intercontinental We joint the Intercontinental Ambassador program, and after the Ho Chi Minh and were pampered by the staff. Location is perfect close to Shopping and restaurant and very very close enough to the Quays and Chinatown. The only minus is the breakfast restaurant, that is not big enough and we had to wait and be "relocated" in the beautiful lounge area. We will most likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better expereince for an Ambassador member”
Reviews.Author: kaotic363
Reviews.Content: First time stay at the Intercon Singapore and thought I would give this place a shot. I checked in just for a single night's stay and pre-booked a deluxe room. Was given a "business room" as an Ambassador upgrade which is basically the same deluxe room but included breakfast and internet. So technically not a room upgrade in my opinion as compared to much better Ambassador experiences at other Intercontinental Hotels in the region. The room decor also appear a bit dated and the bathroom was not totally cleaned. I didn't try any of the F&B and I noticed that this hotel was generally packed with families and tourists (so quite noisy). All in all, not really impressed with the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Morag M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one evening, best part of 2 days in Singapore and was delighted to be booked into the Intercontinental. One of the best if not the best hotel I have stayed at. Wonderfull location, fabulous and extremely comfortable rooms with pillows designed for individual tastes and my favourite Elemis toiletries. Excellent friendly and attentive staff who go the extra yard to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The concierge in particular needs to be singled out for praise. Food superb and you have to try one of their cocktails to finish a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jhaysom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated right on a subway (MRT) station "Bugis".. while its handy to get about I don't recommend you use it to travel to the hotel from the airport unless you've only got a an overnight bag.. the staff area great, the GM is great, the rooms are spacious (I stay in the shop-house suites usually) The Club lounge is big and the staff are extremely attentive.. if in Singapore.. don't stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy beds, nice shophouse feature”
Reviews.Author: Ms_1226
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 2-5 Feb 2012. Got a free upgrade to the shop house room (lower level and facing Victoria's street). Soundproofing superbly done so you will never feel that it's right next to a busy road. Mrt is just below hotel, very convenient. You walk to face the Bugis Junction Mall (a few streets of shopping all sheltered and in a/c), very good for shopaholics. You can easily find the same big brands as you would along Orchard Road. Bed was comfy and we had extra pillows (6!). Room service was fast and everyone was smiling and warm. Bathroom had separate sinks, standing rain shower and bathtub. Room was not very spacious but everything is new and in working condition. We had 2 free pieces of laundry every day and forgot to retrieve a handkerchief from a pocket on our last day of stay and they did it for us fast and efficient and free of charge. Overall, very enjoyed the stay. Service was good. Breakfast at Olive Tree is commendable. Drinks at lobby lounge quite worth it too. Just a few points to note: 1-Ceiling in bathroom a bit low and there was a huge chandelier dangling from the ceiling. I always bang my hand against the chandelier. Perhaps changing that huge chandelier to something less space-consuming to make the whole bathroom look more spacious. 2-There's a lot of locals wandering and walking around the lobby. As the hotel is connected to the mall, a lot of shoppers step in for tea, food, washroom breaks etc. The lobby can get quite packed during the weekends and majority of them aren't guests. However, the hotel did a good job in keeping things organised. They had staff standing at the corridors guiding and offering to help (and I think perhaps also as a way to step up on security). Would have liked to see more security features since the lobby is too easily accessible by non-guests. 3-The shophouse room is rather unique but unfortunately a long walk from the elevators. We had to scale steps up and down and cross a corridor (that spans across the mall) which is a hassle everytime when we come back from shopping. It won't work well with handicapped or families with strollers but I guess they would be considerate enough to not place families in such rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRoschelleT
Reviews.Content: EVerytime I am in Singapore on business, I stay at the Intercontinental. The service is impeccable, the buffet is amazing (I love their make your own soups!), the location is great and the rooms are luxurious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: genfie
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights at the Intercontinental based on a friend's recommendation and it was well worth it. The room was not cheap - I didn't get much change from $300 a night and that doesn't include breakfast - but it was well worth it. The room I got was quiet despite being on a major road and next to a shopping centre, the bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept on in a long time, it had the usual suspects of robes, toiletries etc but for me the best thing was that the service was excellent but also unobtrusive. The staff were there if you needed them and not when you didn't. The Lobby Lounge is wonderful for a cocktail but I didn't use any of the other restaurants. I prefer to dine at places that are cheaper and obviously a restaurant in a five-star hotel isn't going to be inexpensive. If I have one criticism it's that they charge for internet access in the rooms. Honestly, after paying what I did for the room, I'd like to be able to check my email without paying $30. I don't know how hotels can justify charging for internet access in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Reculvers
Reviews.Content: Loved the clean expansive hotel. Pool was great. Loved how it was in the shopping centre or adjacent to it. Close to MRT, food. Staff were very helpful. Will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Club room small,and unstandar services if youre not a business travel”
Reviews.Author: Tsa_RyszardMom
Reviews.Content: i stay with my kids at 23-25 march at club room 338,was let down by sooo small room. I also had an extrabed.my room dont have any view. upon check inn i was left to find my room without any escort,it was our first time staying there so the long endless tiring searching of the room was NOT appreciated at all. After we got in,the luggage is all in our room,this we appreciate. When check out I was in a hurry,but not very prompt service. Also night before I check out i asked for my bill to print out,but the indian lady said your bill only for extrabed so i dont need to print it,ok?its only SGD 70++,but I asked what the Nett?then she reluctantly print it. So much for the great services,I think if you are non asian bussiness travel THEN maybe they will serviced you greatly. The breakfast at the club was great,at 24 march the services was lacking,waiter not nice at all no smile,but at 25 march VERY good service. This is not a hotel for family,so I somewhat regret bringin my kids for holiday. I will recommed it for business.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderfully”
Reviews.Author: Byron R
Reviews.Content: Staying here from 24 3 till 27. .do the club lounge if you decide to come here it just fantastic . Drinks and canopies from 5 30 till 7 30 just excellant.been and stayed in some nice hotels around the world and this place is definitely up there. Could not go wrong booking this hotel if staying in singapor

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: megphi
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if there's been a a management change at this property but the level of service on my last trip was simply wonderful. I'm a RA and I was asked to check-in in the Club Lounge where I received a wonderful greeting - unfortunately I did not get the name of the young lady who checked me in but oh so pleasant. But most importantly, I left my my iPad and case on the desk after checking-out and the Chief Concierge, Fahan, made arrangements to have Leonard, an IC staff member, hop in a taxi drive the iPad to me at Changi where I had already gone through immigration. Fahan and Leonard should be recognized for their effort because it has made a lasting impression. Things like this are just not done by many hotels anymore. But it has gone a long way to ensuring my loyalty to the Singapore InterContinental. Philip O'Neill

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: maddy456
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. We arrived very late on Thursday night and we were given the corner room on the 11th floor. The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgable of the area. My husband is an Ambassador for Intercontinental so we had access to the club lounge, even if you have to pay for this its probably well worth it. You can have bfast, afternoon tea, appetizers and happy hour from 5:30-7:30. Really we only had to pay for 1 meal per day when we were out doing site seeing. In the lounge go and have Amen (I'm hoping that is how you spell his name), he will make you some mean eggs!!!!! They were delicious every morning!!! My son even asked if he could make him a grill cheese sandwich for bfast, he was so willing, in fact he kinda messed up the first one then brought out another one for him to eat. Every time we walked into the lounge we got a very warm hello from him and were greeted with a friendly handshake, he even brought our omlette's out to our table. If the intercontinental management reads this, Amen really deserves a raise he goes way out of his way to make us feel right at home. We would go back just to have him fix us bfast!!! This is a great location, very close to shopping (actually a mall is connected to the hotel, you can't beat that), taxi rides are easy to find and you are within walking distance to great restaurants. Gym was okay, pool was very quiet, most of all the staff was incredible!!! Also try to see Jurong Park, we went to Universal Studios (not a big deal, would probably skip that), you can see Universal Studios somewhere else besides Singapore. Check out the Marina Bar Sands hotel, okay so here is the deal on that. It costs money to go to the top floor to take pictures, ask if you can go to the lounge on the top floor for a drink. Then you don't have to pay, we actually went to the lounge, it was way too loud and busy, we took some pictures and then left. Best way to see it!!! Also check out the mall, especially the Louis Vitton store, that is just an experience itself!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location good service”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were in singapore for a cruise and were having a pre night stay ,the hotel has a certain old world charm and is located a very short distance from raffels hotel,located about 20 min walk is clarke quay which is worth a visit in the late evening very nice to walk around. Back to the hotel there is an old world charm attached, we were offered an upgrade to the club level and a late checkout for the next day for 1500 which was great,Peter in the reception area was a great help ,the room was large and comfortable ,the pool area was small but served the need,food was of a very high standard and in the club level the food and cocktails were to five star standards.The hotel is part of a complex which includes a large shopping centre with a supermarket ,camera shops,clothes ect loads of choice.During our short stay we were very well looked after and when in Singapore again we would have no problems staying again regards to all the staff well done. alan

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Intercontinental in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LAC63
Reviews.Content: This is a good example of an Intercontinental hotel in a really good location close to Bugis Junction which is a must see when visiting Singapore. The bedrooms are really comfortable, clean and spacious and we rested well. In addition all of the public areas are really well equipped with a really impressive lounge bar area. We had a club room and as a consequence had access to the club lounge which was extremely large with great facilities and service. Breakfast and evening cocktails were served by efficient, friendly staff who made us feel welcome and special. We used the Olive restaurant, the all day offer, and this was excellent - good food served by a great team. Compliments to this hotel for a great 2 day stay which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and central to shopping area”
Reviews.Author: Zury
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel With my kids at the junior suite, which had a sofa and a small dining table, and plenty of room for the kids to play around. We were having a stop-over from Amsterdam and were quite jetlagged, so being left alone without anyone interrupting to make up our room was very appreciated (ofcourse, put up the do not disturb sign.. Which I notice some other hotel room services still ignore when its already past noon) . When we were ready to go out, we just called the instant service and they'll gladly service the room then, no matter what time. Locationwise, it's in the Bugis junction, a shopping mall with a lot of variety, department store is just a 5 minute walk away, food courts, Bugis Village, sim lim square - the electronics mall is 10-15 mins walk away, etc.. Its just so central..! Service was quick, I love the place, very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not too new, but great location”
Reviews.Author: DanielT22
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Singapore located on an easy access location, it offers great range of dining choices, and Surrounded by many different malls, landmarks. Hotel staff are friendly and knowledgeable about hotels facilities, surroundings as well as attractions. Check in and out were as smooth as I expected. Quite close distance to Sentosa, Orchards, Marina sands bay etc by Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy”
Reviews.Author: Marie_Drink
Reviews.Content: Pricy hotel with so-so service. Restaurant staff was slow and the room was small. The bed was not comfortable as well. I will look for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Never lets you down, Intercontinental, Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Hotel Singapore provides the perfect environment in which to relax and or work. The InterContinental is an integral part of the new shopping and business complex at Bugis Junction and another Grand IHG Hotel and provides high standards in sophistication and convenience. I always enjoy my stays in Intercontinental  . The beds are  very comfortable with a wide variety of pillows to chose from as they have a pillow menu. The service was exceptional and is close to the Casino which is worth a look at even if your not a high roller, it's a very exciting and colorful experience. The Location is great being very accessible to the MRT and connected to the Bugis shopping area. As usual I recommend joining the free priority club so you'll reap some of the benefits of staying at an IHG.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: james s
Reviews.Content: It was the first time for us to visit Singapore. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is just next to the Bugis Junction. You can get food, phone card, and most of the stuff out there. Staffs are friendly and helpful. We had reserved a double room with an extra bed, and they upgraded me to a bigger room. Even we had an extra bed, the room space was still good enough. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “They know what they are doing-”
Reviews.Author: Mocha2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Singapore InterCon for the second leg of our trip to Asia. We liked to term this leg of our trip the "Anthony Bourdain" eating-our-way through Singapore. We had a lovely room but more impressive was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. There was a lobby ambassador, Peter, who assisted us way beyond what we expected. When we asked him for some information about a certain location, he would go and googlemap our intended location. In fact, at some point, I dissappeared to the ladies room that when my husband wondered where I was, he was able to tell him where I headed to! The concierge was very helpful, giving us hints on the restaurants we wanted to go to. From the professional and friendly registration staff to the wait staff in the restaurant, they bent over backwards to make our stay memorable. The best congee I had, no disrespect to Anthony Bourdain, was not in any hawker's pavillion but in the InterCon restaurant. It was the right consistency and oh so comforting! Our room was very nice, clean, and we had a nice view. Singapore was celebrating a 12-day Chinese New Year that I was able to watch some fireworks from the window. Singapore is clean, nice, and its citizens are proud of their city state. I do not blame them! The InterContinental was centrally located and we took a taxi all over. We also used the on-off bus to tour the city state. We visited hawker's pavillions, as we saw in Anthony's show :), and my husband delighted on being able to eat most of the recommended food. We ate the famed chili crabe at the Jumbo restaurant and it was worth the travel! We also ate traditional Indian food at the Little India, restaurant called Banana Leaf. All in all, our Singapore experience was positive and I was always happy to "come home" to the Intercontinental Hotel every end of the day. It is nice, clean, upscale, and they treated us nicely.

Reviews.Title: “The way it's done”
Reviews.Author: Knuddys
Reviews.Content: Horrible Flight, horror taxi, arrived at hotel..... From the moment the door was opened the day just got better. Express line to checkin counter, a wonderful free gift, room upgrade, treated like a guest. Fantastic place, I truly love this hotel. Always feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: We were expecting the Hotel to have the wow factor and it did not meet our expectations. The Hotel is looking a bit 'tired' with scruff marks everywhere. Our deluxe room was large but on the plain side. It was furnished with antique furniture but none of it matched, I guess it was a case of being more 'shabby chick'. The bathroom was lovely but the room itself just lacked something, it felt a little bare and unhomely. There was no view of any significance. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were okay and hubby noted how the lady rushed us through our check in, which came across as being sterile. Breakfast was a letdown as we were expecting a better standard here also but was pretty much a typical breakfast that you would find in a four star (Singapore) Hotel. I have to say that my husband appreciated this Hotel much more than I did. He enjoyed the spaciousness and the ground floor areas. Had we booked a club room we may have found that wow factor and would not go there again unless we did. The location is excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Great bur not the best IC-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sepp M
Reviews.Content: Shophouse rooms very smal, not place for luggage for to pers. Pool is not the biggest but large enough.No poolservice, the poolbar is not open. WIFI very disappointing. The check-inn /out in clublounge very nice, but they missing my 50 USD food and beverage credit.The staff in clublounge very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Intercon...”
Reviews.Author: Hongkong P
Reviews.Content: Great beds, great breakfast and a good night's sleep...what more do you need in a hotel? This would be a five-star in my book, except for this: my husband is ambassador platinum. This is the only hotel he has ever stayed in (not just Intercon, he has status at Starwood and Marriott) that makes you choose your upgrade: a larger room OR lounge access and Wifi. Go to Marriott, it's all included, even at Crowne Plaza. So, this makes no sense. If you are the top tier of any frequent traveler program, you should expect to receive ALL the amenities--especially free Wifi in the rooms. Forget the gift on check in, just make the experience an excellent one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: meso2011
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the InterContinental Singapore and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel interior is beautifully done in the peranakan style. The rooms are big and cosy. We upgraded to the Club rooms and took advantage of the extra benefits - afternoon tea and evening cocktails. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent close to transport with Bugis Station next to it. In general, the hotel is very centrally located. Many places are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No wows, just good”
Reviews.Author: KeesE
Reviews.Content: Nothing exiting here. But everything you expect from an InterContinental. Bit old fashioned, but extremely well kept with the fresh smell of wood polish throughout the place. If you know the InterContinental Grand Stanford Hong Kong, you will know what to expect. Larger rooms, but less cozy. As IC-Ambassador we were upgraded from the standard deluxe 38m2 to a 55m2 junior suite. The membership extra's make it a decent loyalty program. In Singapore you will find rooms which are much more hip or luxurious, but these IC rooms just seem to work by intuition. Great beds. And you're here for a good sleep aren't you. And there is a full ironing board in the room. When you arrive by MRT from the airport (it looks like a direct line, but you will have to make a platform change at the second station from the airport), you will find the signposting to the hotel not very clear. And it's not an easy walk through the mall with all that luggage. Next time we will take the taxi like we did on the way back. The location is not the best in town, but it's above the MRT and we did walk most of our destinations like Raffles City, Marina Square and Orchard Road. Two bus lines bring you straight back to the hotel from Orchard or again, take the taxi (SGD 4,00 from Raffles City, SGD 5,00 from Orchard and Sands, evening surcharges excluded). The pool is also not the best in town. But it's large and relaxing enough. No pool service, but pool towels and staff available on call. Good pool beds. The extremely high price for WIFI (over SGD 30,00 a day) is disappointing. Not even complementary for Ambassadors. It would be a reason to choose an other hotel. The hotel says it is concerned with mother nature. Why putting all those lights on after turndown service? Please stop this! At check-out our bill was not accurate. Causing some commotion. I had to prove the right room rate with a print out of my reservation. They missed my 50 USD food and beverage credit. Check your bill carefully. Breakfast is ok but expensive. Egg service is slow and they did forget my order twice and on both days we took breakfast at the hotel. If breakfast is not included, you might want to try the bakery at the National Library opposite the hotel where you can sit outside. The IC is a decent hotel to stay. No wows, just traditional good rooms and service. Hope they will give some more attention to details (like they do in Hong Kong) and I might give it a five star rating again. Right now I also might consider the same price competition like Swissotel, Pan Pacific, Regent, Meritus Marina, Fairmont and Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with perfect staff ....”
Reviews.Author: uk4
Reviews.Content: We have just completed two seperate stays of 6 nights each in a Shophouse Club Suite at the Singapore Intercontinental which we have visited a couple of times a year for the last 4 or 5 years. The hotel has always been excellent but this year with the arrival of Tash Tobias - the new General Manager - the hotel has gone from strength to strength. She has managed to knit the people closer together and the hotel feels as though it's staffed by a family who genuinely work together as a team to welcome guests. The hotel combines the very best of traditional flavours with contemporary service and ambiance. Nothing is too much trouble for each and every member of staff who do all they can to ensure that each customer feels special. I cannot recommend the IC Singapore more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: neese01
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Parco Bugis Junction Shopping mall and Bugis MRT Station. Deluxe room was traditionally furnished, but large, quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet in Olive Restaurant was excellent. The lounge area near reception is a beautiful space - elegant and well-furnished. Would stay again if I got a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cristinachang
Reviews.Content: A fantastic choice for business place, convenient, where just passing through the hotel door you will get to the "bugis junction mall" with shops for mobile phone, clothes, and all the variety of food that you fancy and a beauty salon to make you pretty on the second floor and also a place for your nails. The hotel is clean, staffs friendly, food pretty good but you can just turn out of the hotel and 2 minutes on the street are all the foods you can imagine, form chinese, malay, japanese, and 3 streets down is the bali and arab street for more foods and shopping. Just beside the hotel is also the national library, a white buidling where you can enjoy the exposition available, Raffles hotel just crossing the street and raffles shopping center with basement supermarket and watson if you had forgotten to bring some medications or shaving foam. Enjoy your stay and i recommend the hotel also for meetings where you will find the rooms to fit your needs. Wish it helps. Cristina

Reviews.Title: “Happy to stay at Inter-Continental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineHK
Reviews.Content: It was the first time for us to visit Singapore. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is just next to the Bugis Junction. You can get food, phone card, and most of the stuff out there. Staffs are friendly and helpful. We had reserved a double room with an extra bed, and they upgraded me to a bigger room. Even we had an extra bed, the room space was still good enough. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars from a frequent Traveller's heart”
Reviews.Author: AnupamThakur
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in over 500 hotels till now, and never i thought i would find such a beauty and comfort in singapore. Check in was smooth, less than 4 mins before the receptionist was escorting us to the lift loby. I must say, that was the first time i was smiling after check in. The rooms are awesome ( we had booked premiere room). Well lit, comfy. The mattresses that they have used are like bed for the angels. Damn soft. The aircon, and fittings were superb. The bathroom flaunts Maharaja (King) styled fittings with the fantastic choice of interiors. The room service is quick and well mannered. It was fun staying in INTERCONTINENTAL. I recommend this for all class of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Jacq_Lg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at here for 2 nights in Novemeber 2011 with my daughter. Nothing I can complain about at all, room was amazing, bed was comfortable, both the bedroom and bathroom were spotless. Breakfast was delicious with an abundance of choice. Loved the fresh fruit juice bar. Service from check in to check out was professional and helpful. Location at Bugis is perfect. Just walk out the doors of the Hotel and you are in the shopping centre with everything you need, coffee, food, supermarket, chemist, shops for retail therapy it was all there. After reading some of the reviews about this Hotel before we arrived last year I was uncertain if I had made the best choice in accommodation, however it have no hesitation in reccommending this hotel to family and friends. In fact it was so enjoyable that we are going back again in a few weeks and this time for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: LuxJw
Reviews.Content: My first stay with InterContinental Singapore was great. The Front Office staffs were very helpful and cheerful. They have the initiative - Good start. In the room, it was fully furnished with necessities and iPhone charger was available upon request. The ultra soft-yet-firm bed was really, really comfortable - I enjoyed snugging under the duvet. BUT, it gets too hot after sometime! So, I had to snug and takeoff all night (which was a pleasant hassle, haha) However, the smoke detector right above the bed was extremely annoying - the red light keep flashing and I had a hard time not looking at it. Breakfast at Olive Tree was so busy, we were offered Orange Juice while on the wait list. It did not take long (10mins) before we got ourselves a table. It was an extensive range of food, with nice peranankan touch (the prawns were really tasty). The buffet line was however not centralized; it was all over the restaurant. Internet is still chargeable which never fails to puzzle me, especially in this era. Checking out was a breeze and we enjoyed our 2 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: emandernie
Reviews.Content: In the heart of one of the many shopping areas of Singapore, this older hotel has great character. The staff was very pleasant but who isn't in Singapore? We had a small upgrade and the min-suite was spacious and wonderfully decorated. Although we didn't eat in the restaurant, it looked beautiful and the adjoining lobby sitting area was grand.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MikeBracknell
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the ICH in Singapore having visited 2 years ago. The standards have not slipped. Staff arre very helpful and courteous, the breakfast is first class and the rooms have everything you need for comfort. Our filght home was not till late in the evening but the hotel stored our luggage and we were able to shower and change in the fitness centre after spending the day sight seeing. This hotel is ideally situated in Bugis junction within walking distance of the MRT station through the shopping complex.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: ElCheapoTraveller
Reviews.Content: I really loved everything about this hotel... Great staff, great breakfast, cozy rooms. I felt like home. Only one remark: gym needs some renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gary2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Brought my 2 boys for a vacation and stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore. Got this from Hotwire.com so I did not know what to expect. Decided to get an upgrade and get Club privileges and it was worth every cent. I Recommended it to friends and they were also happy.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel I've found in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: A T
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire and booked the Downtown Singapore 5* and got this hotel. Excellent location and I think I only paid about $200/night. Fun area to explore and it was extremely convenient to have the Bugis shopping area connected to the hotel. Lots of great food in the food court area of that place.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: pixie0427
Reviews.Content: This hotel whispers elegance to you even as you step in. A luxuriously laid out lobby, efficient reception, spacious and comfortable rooms, top-of-the-line courtesy and service and a great location add up to an outstanding experience. The breakfast spread is lavish - and the food options varied and delicious at all times of day. One can walk from here to Suntec, the Harbour, Arab Street and a host of other attractions and facilities. The Bugis MRT is close by and offers access to more distant points across the city-state.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: Real_2010
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just lovely, it has a particular charm and style. Stayed in a Club room with Int Club facilities - a definite recommendation. The Hotels location is good, with easy access to MRT or an easy stroll to the harbour. Rooms are spacious, high standard and very clean. Food quality is very good with many choices available. The staff are professional, attentive and welcoming, Stayed for 6 nights at for start of Chinese New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: wwtravelerRochester
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Interconttinental for the 5th time in 5 years. We always book the club and stay in the club floor. While it is a premium of 90++ for 2 people if you use the benefits it is worth the money. We are always greated as long lost friiends and the servers there after one visit remember what was our drink or choice from the day before. The breakfast are great and the cocktail food is so good we usually never have an appetite to go out for dinner. We love the rooms. Beds are very comfortable and the baths are perfect with a separate shower and bath. Location is very convenient to everything and close the the underground. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel with great character”
Reviews.Author: MCTHUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. A beautiful hotel with classic style. Restaurant, conference rooms and hotel rooms are of a very high standard. Quite pricey but probably typical of the market here. The gym is well equipped and has many treadmills - bonus point for that!

Reviews.Title: “3 strikes and your out......”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: Platinum Priority Club Rewards member, 2 night stay in January. To begin, I would like to echo the statements on here about the hotel being in a great location and the hard product (building / furnishings / fittings) of the property being of a high standard - this is very true. Unfortunately, my stay here was marred by 5 significant service failings. 1. Attempt to extort further payment at check-in On check-in, although holding a confirmed reservation and rate for 3 people in a room (the reservation conformation clearly stated this), we were advised that we would have to pay an extra fee ( from memory appox $150 over the duration of the stay) above and beyond the confirmed amount. The check in staff would not budge on this so I had to ask for the manager. The manager 'waived the charge' upon presentation of the e-mail stating 3 guests. During the second day of our stay, a tray of chocolates, a half bottle of wine and a apology letter were delivered to our room. I considered this adequate service recovery and the issue solved nor would have mentioned it again - BUT: 2 Attitude from Bellboys On checking out - as we were three, I asked the doorman to flag as a larger taxi - like a station wagon (to accommodate luggage). We had taken such a vehicle from the airport so were in full knowledge of their existence. As several of these cars came and went from the rank (with the doorman telling us 'this is not our car' & guests who arrived after us taking them, a small mini bus pulled up. After loading our luggage (3 or so doormen helped) I gave the apparent lead guy an adequate tip for their assistance ($5 each, $15 total). The doorman who closed the door of the van obviously didn't see this - as he stood waiting to close the door he had his hand out in expectation, when we did not give him money directly, he shot a filthy look and slammed the door shut. 3. Car booked (unasked) by Bellman at 5 times the cost of a taxi. At the completion of our journey (from the hotel to the cruise terminal - as somneone who is in singapore a couple of times a month, I know this to be appox a $11 to $15 fare) the driver demanded a $50 payment from us - apparently a standard flat fare for a mini-bus. We questioned the driver about this and he said that the hotel booked it and was in full knowledge of this flat fare - any issues we had, take it up with them. $39 is not a lot of money in any sense - but there is principle at play here. Unfortunately I question the commission taken by the doorman here. 4. Priority Cub Points not given automatically After our stay, weeks later it had not shown up on my PC rewards balance. It took an additional e-mail to PC rewards to have this adjusted. 5. No Reply to e-mail in relation to the above. Over 2 weeks ago I e-mailed customer care at both IHG and the hotel but as of today have had no response. In isolation, each of these issues would be small (or in the case of the check-in, recovered) - but as the sum of their parts they paint a bleak picture of the service standards at this property. On this stay, The Intercontinental Singapore has failed on multiple levels to live up to its service promise and reflected badly on the IHG Brand as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service & location”
Reviews.Author: ggm_hk
Reviews.Content: We chose the InterContinental Singapore for our getaway from Hong Kong during the Chinese New Year, as well as for our personal events. We booked a club room with various privileges, which we realized was of much greater value than expected. Our check-in & check-out were processed by a club lounge staff with utmost efficiency in a very friendly manner. Indeed, every staff at the club lounge offered us a heartwarming service in a professional way. When we asked for a way to some attractions unfamiliar to us such as the Universal Studio & Dempsey Hill, we were given a map with detailed directions. Thanks to their accurate tips and the hotel's location, we were able to get to those spots very easily. Wherever we go to, this hotel is super-conveniently situated in a core of this garden city. We appreciated its location literally every time we went out & came back. We also liked breakfast served in the club lounge. The stewed prunes seasoned with star anise were my favorite. We tried Olive Tree's buffet breakfast too, however, we still preferred a coziness in the club lounge. Our room was always kept clean by hard-working housekeeping staff, and air-con was easy to control according to our preference. Now we are sure not so many hotels in Singapore could compare with the InterContinental in terms of service & location.

Reviews.Title: “Homely atmosphere, everything you would expect a hotel to be”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKen
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days at a Premier Room. Checked in at the club lounge, and was offered a room upgrade to newly renovated shophouse room at level 2 (same floor as the lounge). Viewed both rooms before deciding to decline the offer, as the room which I booked, although not renovated, was a 50+ sq m junior suite, on high floor in main wing, while the shophouse room was a mere 30+ sq m! How could this be an upgrade beats me. Roomwise, I was happy with the space, as there is a dining table and a sofa lounge. The view overlooked Parkview Square from afar, and the air-conditioned Bugis Junction Mall from below. No unpleasant odours from the somewhat tired looking carpets, and the shower and bath produced sufficient jets of water. There was nightly turn-down service, with bottled water placed at the bedside and slippers at the foot of the bed. It would be great if the hotel could place a piece of chocolate or a bookmark too (as in some other hotels like the Conrad). But nevertheless, the daily cleaning and turn-down service were consistent, except pen and note papers were not replenished after the 2nd day. I have misplaced them and was scrambling to find a pen to jot down some telephone numbers of restaurants. The staff at club lounge were very friendly and helpful. No amount of request was too much for them. On the 1st day, I merely said I like the pineapple tarts and almond cookies which I have sampled during teatime, and would like to purchase them if possible. When I next visited the lounge, the receptionist had already packed 2 jars of the tarts and cookies in a presentation box with the receipt from the Chinese restaurant - how's that for efficiency and thoughtfulness! Breakfast in my opinion is better at the club lounge than the Olive Tree Restaurant downstairs, even though the latter has variety. At the club lounge, Mr Amin the chef prepared eggs in whatever way we need, and is always cheerful and chatty, unlike the buffet breakfast downstairs. The bacon at the club is better and crispier than the ones downstairs too. Overall, this is an above average and decent hotel, with staff greeting you at the corridors and holding the lift for you. The concierge was also very helpful and thoughtful. There was a long queue of people waiting for taxis in the afternoon, and I had wanted to go to the airport. The concierge tried booking a taxi to no avail. When a taxi pulled in at the driveway for a passenger to alight, the concierge kindly allowed me to take the taxi first, beating the long line of queue. I was initially embarrassed but very thankful that because of this gesture I would not be missing the flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LizzyK8
Reviews.Content: Good location and the rooms are nice. There is a metro station alongside the hotel which makes transportation even easier . The staff are truly the highlight as they are so friendly and wonderful. They were very helpful and go above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent through and through”
Reviews.Author: Yellabrick
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is an excellent hotel, well located in a central area and attached to a great shopping centre in beautiful Singapore. Most of the highlights have already been mentioned by previous reviewers, so I won't go in to great depth. We stayed in a club room, which was well worth the extra money, we got a good deal booking direct via the priority club website, very reasonable compared to many of the other top hotels given that it was Chinese New Year during our stay too. The service we received was absolutely exemplary, with staff going out of their way to help us on a number of occasions. We did find our room, on the third floor, was quite noisy from functions which were going on in the hotel in the evenings, so I would ask for a room on a higher floor. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Ferals23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after spending 2 nights somewhere else in Singapore, and whilst it is not big and flash like some other modern hotels it is extremely nice and well presented. The rooms are nice, the food is good and the staff are very helpful. The central city location (close to shops, transport and attractions) and many within easy walking distance make it a great place to stay. The pool is also very nice. There are plenty of places to shop and eat around the hotel which are everything from cheap to not very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my first trip to Singapore in an Executive room, with my parents returning for their fourth trip. Wow! They really know how to impress their guests. The staff were always friendly, hospitable and incredibly helpful. The rooms are fantastic, just the right size with great, comfortable beds. The Executive Lounge is also a gem - Free internet (Wireless or they have computers you can use), a staff member always there to help you book restaurants, tours or other accommodation if need be, as well as cocktails, regular refreshments and food - all the time! The Intercontinental Singapore is a fantastic hotel, great value for money, and in a great spot in Singapore as well - a very convenient location. The Olive Garden has a great buffet breakfast as well so try to have it included in your room rate and you will not be disappointed! There is also a shopping centre that leads out from the hotel with a food court, chemist, grocery store...everything you could imagine. Honestly would not stay anywhere else in Singapore. My grandparents stayed at Marina Bay Sands and it was quite awful - they had to line up for breakfast (there are so many rooms and not enough seats) and the buildings are just so enormous. So many people in one place! The Intercontinental is definitely the way to go when staying in Singapore. Absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: Hairypony
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Singapore on our way to Sydney. The hotel was booked for us by husband's company as it was only a five minute walk to their office. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them always smiling. They even got a little upset if you attempted to move your own luggage! Our room was large and comfortable, with a nice comfy bed which was very welcome to get a good night's sleep after a 13 hour flight from Heathrow! Overall we though the room was kept clean and tidy by the housekeeping staff. The public areas of the hotel are clean and spacious with plenty of places to sit and enjoy a cup of tea (although be warned, as with every hotel these items work out quite expensive). Breakfast was an interesting experience, the buffet is the usual fair of cooked meets, cheese, pastries etc. There is also a 'hot' buffet which serves curry! There is also an a la'carte breakfast menu, which did cause some confusion when we ordered from it. Some of my husband's new colleagues met us for breakfast and ordering from this menu caused a lot of confusion and I don't think we got what we ordered. Apparently this is not uncommon! Never mind, the food was still nice. We did not eat in the restaurants so cannot comment on these. There is a shopping mall attached to the back of the hotel and is only about five minutes walk from Raffles. Overall a nice hotel for a stopover in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: ImerovigliNiceview
Reviews.Content: Α wonderful hotel with excellent service and friendly staff. The hotel is very nice area inside shopping malls. Spacious rooms with neoclassical decoration αnd rich breakfast. Do not forget to enjoy the wonderful pool. 10 minutes by taxi will be in the cable-car with which you can go to Sentosa Park in all other sights of Singapore. Αlso suggest you do the tourist bus round the city

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: click11
Reviews.Content: So impressed we joined the Ambassadors club- because we sure do intend to return. After 23 years of regularly visiting Singapore we have discovered this hotel and wish to go no where else. Also the positive comments are soooooo true. 1) the service 2) the happy staff 3) the greetings you always get 3) great rooms 4) efficient check in 5) they go out of there way 6) the way they made us feel valued as a customer without it being false! and more. The location is better that you realise. We explore Kampong Glam/ Arab st etc and it is a real gem- I have been telling everyone about this place. The food at the Bushra cafe was so good I am craving it. The little shops that have been created at the bottom have so much character and appeal ( for those who have been to Melbourne it's kinda like an Asian version) so charming and interesting- go there! We walked to Suntec city in less than 10mins. About 15 mins to Little india, really enjoyed that walk as it was very interesting- local businesses, eateries, shops, old buildings etc. 5 mins to Raffles- Robinson department store and Steve Madden, etc, lots of great shopping and a decent food hall up top. I also noticed a reflexology place there too.( that's the only thing I wish Bugis had) There is a market right across the road from the Intercontinental- a great place to pick up cheap bags/clothes/costume jewellery/gifts. And they sell fresh fruit and have juice shops- perfect for the hot day to drink, and so yummy! As you come out the other side of the market you are just a few meters away from the OG department store. Not as upmarket as Tangs, Metro, Robinsons, Taka, but a good mid priced shop- got some excellent priced shoes from there. BHG is the Department store that is next to the hotel and it is not too bad either. Along the lines of OG but a bit more up scale. The ones on Orchard are still my favourite. But as this hotel has an attached MRT it was never a problem. I have stayed on Orchard many times, but the Intercontinental location offers more variety. Took the new line to the Botanical gardens- very easy and enjoyed a wonderful 1/2 day there. The food junction at Bugis was excellent- discovered chicken wings cooked on an open charcoal grill- had to return to eat it again- a group of us want to try and re create it back home. You have to try! Chicken rice was very good, Chendol dessert was sooo cheap. We couldn't get over the prices- 2 kilo weight gain in 4 days!!! Two other couples stayed at other hotels, after visiting ours they have declared that the next visit this is where they are coming. Their hotels were the Holiday Inn and The Stamford (where I used to stay). Almost forgot to mention the Red wine, Chocolates and fresh fruit on arrival....and the turn down of bed at night and how they leave your slippers on a little mat beside the bed for you- so sweet- so spoilt- so loved it!!!! And we only booked the Standard King room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent break in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ics66
Reviews.Content: We had a family break to get away for a night, do some shopping and comply with Thai visa requirements. We took 3 club rooms for my wife and I, 2 teenage children and my 85 year old (semi disabled) mother in law. The hotel is not the most imposing in singapore but was good value (for singapore) and the club rooms are well worth the extra. The lounge is large, comfortable and has a very good selection of food and drinks. Afternoon tea was particularly good and very british, excellent sandwiches and leaf tea (not bags). I think some hotels dont quite get the idea of what Afternoon tea is really about and put all kinds of food out, so this was really welcome. The wine in the evening is also very good and generous given the cost of wine in Singapore. The hotel is joined onto a small shopping mall with excess to MRT. You will need a taxi or change of line to get to Orchard Road. In the evening we had tried to book (a week in advance) a couple of the recommended restaurants recommended from trip advisor but all were fully booked - Friday night i suppose but something to be aware of. So we tried to chinese restaurant in the hotel Man Fu Yuan and really glad we did. The food was excellent and fairly priced for singapore, and the service reserved but friendly. We were not surprised to notice that the restaurant was nearly full and we were the only westerners in there. It was filled with local families - which is a recommendation in itself. The beds were good (as usual for an IC) and we slept well. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, old charm Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom180
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located in the heart of town, with a shopping mall attached. It has just undergone a renovation and you can see it shining. The employees really aim to please. 2 fantastic Restaurants on premises. 1 Chinese and 1 Japanese. We had a great stay at this beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NY_Traveler008
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Singapore for our niece and nephew's wedding and chose this hotel to be close to Orchard Road (a 15 minute walk or 5 minute cab ride). This hotel is a "jem" and a hidden treasure. The staff never questioned any request and they actually seemed happy to be there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, MRT station is beneath this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: allisonTFremont
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within the Bulgis Shopping Mall which is very convenient on a rainy day. We stayed here during Christmas and two out of four days, it rained heavily. Luckily, the rain did not stop us from shopping. We checked out the Mandarin Orchard on Orchard Road and we prefer this hotel as it offers all the things a family needs. For those Chinese ( Cantonese) who drink soup daily: Within walking distance, in an air condition and covered mall, one can buy all authenic Chinese Homemade non MSG soups at a price of 4.50 Singapore $$. The portion is quite big, enough for two people The mall is quite large, a 5-6 levels with restaurants located on the 5th floor. Make sure you bring tissues and napkins as they do not provide them. One can get pretty much all kinds of food on this level...hundreds of eatery places.. Exchange Money Exchange money is in this mall, on the first floor. Pearl Milk Tea is on the basement next to the MRT station. It is really good. There are lots of Gadgets to buy in this mall. We will stay here again. BTW, make sure you book at the Club level to really enjoy the amenities of this hotel ( breakfast included) We booked five months ahead of time and got a really good deal, 294.00 at Club Level and stayed for 4 nights for the price of 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “New Shop House rooms look great”
Reviews.Author: JohnGMac
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 separate 1 day stays here in Dec 2011 with wife and kids. Normally stay here on business as I a Royal Ambassador. Both stays were great. First one on rewards and got a single room upgrade. Second stay a paid stay and upgraded to a suite with club access. Great hotel and great staff who will sort out any issues promptly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Architecture and Location ...”
Reviews.Author: shahrin_haron
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights last week .. somehow all major hotels increased the price which min SGD500++ .. only this hotel were SGD330++ .. never stay here before and this area .. so read the review at tripadvisor and decided to give a try. arrived midnight after 4 hours drove from KL .. first impression was good and our room were upgraded. the room was nice ... i have nothing to complaint. brrakfast a bit normal ... almost same menu and not many choices .. which i think oK for business guest and not family. but the great thing is it is connected to shopping mall and on top of mrt station ... nice if u want to work and ur family for shopping ... will i come again? why not :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: anntix2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a wonderful atmosphere. Spacious rooms and the club facilities is worth the upgrade. Although it is not very central to the main shopping street, it is well placed and close to other shops and on busroutes. Will recommend this hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and amenties”
Reviews.Author: drbcr
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Royal Ambassador and I was able to get upgraded to a Shophouse Suite (additional cost) which included access to the Club Lounge. We arranged pick up by the hotel from the airport in their Mercedes Sedans. Check-in was via the Club Lounge. The breakfast, afternoon tea, and evening drinks is worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in the newly renovated Shop House Rooms on a cracking deal which gave us executive lounge access, internet and breakfast included in our rate. The hotel was wonderful and we adored everything about it. The whole place just sparkles and the staff are amongst the friendliest hotel staff I have encountered at any hotel, anywhere in the world....so helpful and they really do know Singapore like the back of their hand. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable king bed with nice linens, a sofa and a work desk and 3 giant windows looking down into Bugis Junction. The tv is a huge flat screen. The bathroom was huge by London standards with a massive tub and huge walk in shower. But the best thing about the hotel were the warm and welcoming staff that assisted us with any request with a smile. We enjoyed our stay at Intercontinental Singapore very much and look forward to returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCM80
Reviews.Content: Although its rated as a 5 star property we were slightly disappointed as there was no 5 star feel to the hotel.It's a very small hotel.If you go expecting that you are putting up at a 5 star chances are that you may be disappointed.At best it would classify as a 3/4 STAR at best.Rooms are extremely small at least the one we were put up in and the hotel has no view as such.the breakfast is lavish but if you are staying there for a longer duration you may get bored as its the same menu everyday.Not much to do at the hotel in terms of activity.You will be charged 500 SGD at the time of check in and told that its just a lock in and it hasn't been charged to your card but later on we found out that it had been charged to the card and are now having issues getting it back.Overall an average hotel and not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: kolukolu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and found this hotel okay (we preferred Conrad where we stayed for 2 nights prior moving to InterContinental). The swimming pool was a bit small and it was kind of in the shade hence can get quite cold. My husband enjoyed the gym room which was open 24 hrs a day. The room was a bit old but clean. Nice shower and bath tub. Staff were friend and the check out was very quick! The hotel was about 5-7 mins walk to Bugis MRT station. Plenty of shops around the hotels and many restaurants to choose from. Hotel breakfast was good and a lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DNigelL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on way to New Zealand. Highly recommended, clean spacious rooms, very attentive staff, good food and very central.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and I have to say I was quite disappointed about it, I don't think that it can be considered a real 5 star hotel because it has some critic issues: the room is small and noisy, it's very sad that in a very pricey hotel you wake up during night sleep because of the extreme noise of the water flush from the bathrooms of the rooms near yours, curtains are poor and they can't block the morning sun properly. Breackfast is nothing special and so is the location.

Reviews.Title: “good old times”
Reviews.Author: FM_LM
Reviews.Content: We approached Singapore returning home from Nusa Dua at Bali and made a good choice to stay at the Intercontinental. What else you can desire: quite atmosphere and polite service, distinguished guests, refreshing pool on the terrace overlooking downtown of the city, and unforgettable breakfast one could prolong all morning time. Perfect approach from airport (and back taking a romantic London Cab), a couple of nice malls and restaurants also around, we really drew out a lot from the two nights stay here. Nice memories left for one older and the second younger pair ":-).

Reviews.Title: “Best for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Saeeda M
Reviews.Content: We came back to this hotel after one year as previously we were upgraded to Club Shop house room. When I booked this time I just paid for Club room and when we arrived on Dec 30th (busiet time of the year),they didn't have the same club shop house room when we checked in, but the very next morning Mr. Sakdapol Thongjan took care of us. We had 2 rooms and they moved both room to club shop house level We stayed for 7 nights (currently still in the hotel) and are very pleased! I will defn come back to this hotel and as the hotel was great with decent price and very conveniently located to all shopping and dining. I would highly recommend this hotel especially if you could book a club room.

Reviews.Title: “Incomplete Intercon”
Reviews.Author: bcheong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Bugis and Illuma malls, which are malls a tier below those in Orchard Road. The check-in was polite and professional, and they do tend to go the extra mile by walking you to the areas you want to go. I think they are refurbishing the hotel in phases and i was disappointed to get an old room, which mainly explains my rating. The room decor is dated, the flat screen tv smaller than an apple mac computer flatscreen. The room service is very "international" - the 1st day it was a japanese server, and the 2nd day he was korean.The food is ok. They must be interns or something. The conceirge is effective, but too clinical, they seldom smile. Internet is expensive at $30, and breakfast equally so at $30. I opted out of the breakfast. You can get a much cheaper and nicer local breakfast at say Toast at the Bugis mall . I used the printing service at their business centre, and they told me of the charges prior ($1.50 per page). After printing 2 pages, they waived it on the spot, it was probably too insulting to charge the $3 fee. It was a nice surprise though

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: QldTraveller62
Reviews.Content: Nicely placed next to Bugis Shopping plaza. Food is great and beds are so comfortable. Very relaxing place after working all day.

Reviews.Title: “good stay and .......recession?? where is the recession in singapore”
Reviews.Author: jhonnyhome
Reviews.Content: good fair hotel in great location friendly staff, nice big room - excellent breakfast We stayed 2 night and I had a coupon for 1 night free stay, but conditions were not 100% correct, no-problem, they accepted my 1 free night

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend new years eve in singapore !!”
Reviews.Author: mark s
Reviews.Content: My wife and i go away each year after christmas and experience new years eve in a different place. This year we picked Singapore and what a mistake. We stayed at the intercon and when i made the booking in July i emailed them to ask what events they had for new years eve. They said they had not yet fixed them but would email us when they did. Numerous emails later still no news then when we checked in we were told that they do not really have a big party but that the resteraunts close at 11pm and they have a "countdown party" as they are concerned about guest safety?? So good we went to bed before midnight. If they had told me when i booked i would have gone somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel and Great Services”
Reviews.Author: San_Rob50
Reviews.Content: I travelled to many different countries and this is my first time here in Singapore. I stayed at Intercontinental Singapore and I find that all the staffs knows everything and synchronizing ways. Im impressed with the front desk staff who welcome me for the first time and my first impression is the way the doorman greeted me out of the car. The hotel is very unique and cozy. It has nice fixtures and decorations. But what I love the most is the services rendered to me from check-in all the way to check-out. The Operator staffs are polite when answering my calls to request for my needs. The Concierge and Business Centre staffs really know the places well and offered me best and attractive places to walk around. Shane from Front Desk had check-in my stay professionally. With the explaination given, I dont mind to upgrade room with more facilities. In room, the ambience is so different that I feel like at home. Felt so welcomed and the room is well prepared for my arrival. When I call the operator, Atiqa who answered my call has a very nice voice to hear. She attend to my needs efficiently and I received what I want from housekeeping immediately. There is one point that I wanted to take cable car that I approached Jun at Business Centre really help my way out. She showed me the Singapore map and direct me slowly both via train and bus. Im impressed that she even offered me alternatives like what to do in Sentosa and the prices and packages to go along with cable car. She explained to me very clearly that I went and tried all attractions in Sentosa on the very same day. It was an eye opening for me that the services here is superb and wonderful. I dont mind coming back here with my family knowing that we will be taken care of in the hotel. Well Done!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ali_mumoftwo
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Singapore many times however this was our first stay at the Intercon. I had telephoned ahead and booked a shophouse suite with a rollaway for our daughter directly with the hotel. Upon arrival we were shown to our suite but advised we were not able to have a rollaway in the room due to their recent refurbishment (and not having had their official launch of the new rooms) - they were concerned about rollaways knocking the freshly painted walls. We were shown to an alternative room which was larger but non-refurbished (very dated decor & tired furnishings). We were disappointed as we'd made the decision to stay at the intercon based on it being an upgraded room and because of our priority rewards platinum status. Upon advising of our disappointment we were advised to go out for a spot of shopping while they decided what they could do for us.
