We returned about 2 hours later to be told we were upgraded to an ambassador suite. Whilst the room still had dated decor the size of the suite made up for this fact. Our suite was on the top floor overlooking the national library. The ambassador suite included a master suite, additional powder room, living room, dining area and study/office nook. Hotel service was great, we found the club lounge to be wonderful and the cleanliness of the rooms was of a very high standard. The buffet breakfast downstairs is lovely and adequate. The location was interesting as it is an area we'd never stayed before - the bugis markets & bugis junction mall were worth a visit but nothing amazing. There's an abundance of shops around the area and The hotel is conveniently located metres from the MRT Bugis Station. We caught the MRT to Orchard Rd - it took a change of trains and about 10 minutes travel time but the kids enjoyed the experience. Overall, it's a quality hotel with good staff. Not the most amazing hotel in Singapore, but definitely nothing to complain about either.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully upgraded while keeping Singapore essence”
Reviews.Author: alwaysenjoyinglife1
Reviews.Content: Just left Singapore for a 4 day tour and this hotel was indeed worth it. We had a shophouse club suite in the original building on 2nd floor that was just renovated and it worked great. King size bed with soft white duvet and pillows. Huge flat screen  along with separate living room, foyer with wardrobe and safe along with double sink bathroom. Excellent water pressure. Soaking tub was large enough   and walk in shower was capable of scalding hot shower with an overhead rain faucet as well as a normal hand spray on the side wall. Not the full on car wash service some places had but it was pretty good. Only one small shelf to put your stuff on if you are like me and don't want to put stuff on the floor.  Plugs-not horrible, but ok. No outlets in the bathroom. One next to the bed on the nightstand and the other side was under the nightstand. One strip in the living room next to the desk and one in the LR under the window. A random single outlet was inside a wardrobe next to the safe. Overall ok and much better than some other hotels that left you with nothing for all your electronic stuff and hair care etc. For the ladies, it was not easy setting up shop for your beauty routine since the bathroom counter was so very limited. The only other mirror in the suite was on the back of a door inside a wardrobe. A simple fix for hotel mgmt is to add a mirror next to the desk so ladies can plug all their appliances in and have a chair and mirror to handle their prettiness. :) Room service was fast and pretty good. Not ridiculously overpriced. Room location on floor two was great since it was right down the hall from the club lounge and the access to breakfast and high tea. The service was excellent for us. I don't know why other reviewers chose to rate poorly, but they were all so super kind, always so genuine. A special note goes out to the club lounge attendant Lai Tiefang who went above and beyond for my hubby to find a restaurant amid a bunch of other issues we had. He really tried everything for us and it showed.  One small note, internet is not free! It does not say anything on the web connect page like, you now accept this rate etc. etc. or say anything like the cost is X flat rate for 24 hrs. They tried to charge for every time you logged in. That could be 20 times in one day just for two people! Even ambassador didn't get us free internet like the other Interconti's. Christmas dinner at their hotel ended up being somewhat of a letdown. I guess we expected a bit more. Live and learn. The room was conveniently overlooking the Bugis mall... A weird and different experience, but was actually super convenient. Noise was not excessive and didn't stop us from sleeping at all hours.  Hop on hop off tour bus was truly across the street and loved it. So easy. Hope this helps you choose a nice place to stay in Sing depending on your needs.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Price, 4 Star Location, 3 Star Hardware, 2 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: GreatGTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have high regards for the Intercontinental chain due to my excellent experience at Intercontinental Hong Kong and Intercontiental Ho Chi Minh City. However, Intercontinental Singapore fell short in many aspects and customer service is a grave concern. During my check in (supposingly to be treated better since I am a gold member using the Priority Club lane exclusively for Gold and Elite), I was dumbfounded by the question raised by the front liner 'You are visiting Singapore for Christmas? Why? There is nothing in Singapore...It is so crowded'. I was speechless and I thought I should head back home. My room wasn't ready (2pm) and was requested to return after 30 minutes. When I returned after 45 minutes, was told to wait again and return after 15 minutes. The front liner wasn't apologetic. I wasn't angry that the room is still not prepared but I hate broken promises. I hate promises which cannot be delivered. I came back 30 minutes later, she recognized me and instantly just hand over the room key card to me. No smile, no sorry, no explaination. Nothing. She didnt even explain to me where is the lift or how I should go to my room. She didnt even tell me what is my room number - I have to read myself. How can you beat that for poor customer service? On one morning, hung the 'please service my room' tag on the door when I left at 10.30 am and upon returning at 3.30pm. the housekeeping was in progress and requested to wait for 10 minutes. I would think this is highly inefficient. In general, do not expect warmess and friendliness from the staff - not from those manning the gym, doing housekeeping or the porter. Location wise, although a short distance from Orchard, the hotel is approximately 10 minutes walk from Bugis MRT station. The adjacent Bugis Junction (shopping mall) is convenient for shopping and food. The hotel, room and gym facilities are a bit dated and definitely a no match compared to the newer hotels in Singapore. Luckily the hotel still maintains the "Intercontinental Bed', which is very comfortable. Stay here only if you get a hard to refuse rate, but don't expect 5 star....

Reviews.Title: “Great service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nocebo
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 minutes from the subway Bugis station (though walking through the crowds may take some extra time), within walkable distance from the Esplanade station as well. Price: It's not the cheapest one you can get - near this hotel there are 2 hotels way cheaper - Hotel 81 and Fragrance Hotel. But I think it's worth the price given its quality. Services & Value: I arrived in the morning and they had a room ready for me to check in at 11am. Breakfast, wifi internet, 2 pieces of laundry included in my room rates, the latter one came in handy as I had to change at least twice a days - Singapore is still VERY HOT in December. Amenities: All you need is there, this time I even used the umbrella coz it was already raining.

Reviews.Title: “Need more staff and information in Club Area for Ambassador Members”
Reviews.Author: Zansue
Reviews.Content: Club area needs to have more staff and much more of them. They run out of food tonight and could not service the number of people in the club area. Someone should tell them its Christmas and put on more staff and food . Just joined the Ambassidor Club and are starting to wonder why? Very slow service is this really 5 stars? The receptionist could not care less, take a good look managers, I think you would be horrified if you knew what was going on, or maybe you do.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in this hotel for 2 times and still want to be there again”
Reviews.Author: Achikiri
Reviews.Content: A little feeling that I do not have my own private when I was at the first floor because there are many people use the first flow of the hotel as their short cut or free toilet.

Reviews.Title: “STILL NO MIO IN THE ROOMS!!”
Reviews.Author: Tysin30
Reviews.Content: Hi Intercontinental Singapore, I have been returning to Singapore over the past few months, unfortunately I am now staying at another property, as you simply do not have the football in the rooms. I love the EPL (Go Liverpool!!) I am so sad when I stay at the Intercontinental Singapore, the hotel is great, the service is great, but the TV is terrible - no games, no football talk shows, no monday night crazy !! Anyway I am enjoying the games from another hotel until you can resolve this issue.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but away from Orchard”
Reviews.Author: coolkamal09
Reviews.Content: In fact, the hotel was nice & elegent,, rooms were delicately decorated and had beautiful fixtures. I liked everything but as a mtter of fact I am in love with Orchard road and if was my first expereince staying in any hotel away from Orcahrd road and I was really missing it. Although I was also pleased to see one hotel door opening directly to Bugis Junction.The total atmosphere was quite beautiful and life lasting. Hotel staff was also very cooperative, however, during breakfast, I noticed many people were un happy in delay serving hot coffee or tea,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Vegetarian4ever
Reviews.Content: Well, due to the cost It was only possible for me to have one night here on this occasion. The service as soon as I got out of the taxi was well presented and thereafter to my comfortable room. There is a nice wine and beverages bar which also serves cofee in the afternoon on ground floor. You can sit in here and watch the traffic go by outside in air conditioning. I like the fact that I could walk across the road to the the big National Library. A few minutes from the traffic lights. There is an outside bistro which runs along the hotel around the corner but with so much chioce of other eateries in Bugis Junction I didn't feel the need. I also found it easy to walk to the 'Fortune Centre Vegetarian centre', a couple of blocks down near Bencoolen street corner. Just ask anyone for the Fortune Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service, great price”
Reviews.Author: Northshoresoi1
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3 night stay at the IC-Singapore. Was on a Club Room package, which included breakfast, internet, 3 pieces of laundry pressing, and access to the Club Lounge. Near the Bugis MRT, and attached to a big shopping mall, the IC is a beautiful property, starting from the entrance way, to the lobby lounge, and the Club Lounge-everything looks appealing and upscale. The Club Lounge was excellent, but I choose the option of having breakfast at the Olive Tree on the lobby level-superb breakfast array. My room was spacious, with a lovely bath, and very comfortable bed and pillows. Internet was good, but a little slow. The Club Lounge was superb-staff, especially Anne, were uniformily outstanding. The location is excellent, although a taxi ride away from Orchard Road. Other hotel facilities, eg., the Fitness Center, pool, business center, all were very adequate. Overall, a new hotel for me in Singapore, but a very enjoyable stay-I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money ?”
Reviews.Author: scan100
Reviews.Content: Positive: Great location, close to shopping, transport and sights good sized rooms, very comfortable beds, generally friendly service. Clean and well kept public areas Negative: Check in experience slow, ineffective and distant. Conference facilities very average - beamers and screens very outdated, windowless rooms more suited for social gatherings than for professional meetings and training events. Internet access cumbersome

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: casden8
Reviews.Content: We were going to Hong Kong for two weeks and decided to stop by Singapore again because our last experience at the Intercontinental had been so good. We were very disappointed. They say, "never go back, keep the memories" and I wish we had. It was nothing like 2009. There have been several openings of large hotels recently and I think they must have taken the cream of the crop in staff. The atmosphere was completely different from the beautiful lounge bar to the Chinese Restaurant. The hotel itself is beginning to look a little tired as well.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay, different room type, still excellent”
Reviews.Author: ci1705
Reviews.Content: This time we stayed in a shophouse room. Lovely new modern decor, bathroom was extremely roomy, beds are super comfortable. A little noisy from the street and shops below but not enough to stop you from sleeping. We had an incident on the last morning and we were immediately moved to another room and given late checkout due to the inconvenience. Great service. Club lounge food and beverage is still excellent. Service was good but not as good as last time we stayed, staff changeover I guess. Highly recommend it as a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JHKiwi
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times on family stopovers in Singapore, and would have to say this is now our hotel of choice for future visits to Singapore. The location at Bugis Junction is really convenient and there is a great selection of shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff are fantastic, so friendly and helpful. The rooms are excellent - good size, clean, great shower and really comfortable beds. Really appreciated the swimming pool to cool off in as well. Although a bit pricier than a number of other hotels around I still felt this was reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: neeran
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a very nice, large room at the InterContinental Singapore for 3 nights. Room had a nice writing desk with good universal power points, connectivity for iPods and USB devices built in, etc. The bathroom was large and well-appointed as well. The hotel's location is superb -- right at Bugis Junction, with exits opening right into the street market. This means that good shopping and food options are available right next door. The hotel itself has a couple of high-quality (and correspondingly pricey) restaurants -- one Chinese, one Japanese. Prices are steep, but for me this was a business trip so I wasn't paying out of my pocket :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large room, nice bath”
Reviews.Author: bmike2000
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel except for the check in area. it was ok but had low ceilings for a lobby. the hotel has a great lounge area but because of where the main entrance is you don't walk by it. they should reroute the entry to give it a more luxury feel. nicest part of room was bathroom. tv was flat but awkwardly small

Reviews.Title: “Super cushy, great service, wi-fi a pain”
Reviews.Author: wandersmuch
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel, and top-notch service from the concierge and front desk. The Continental Club was a great plus and lovely to have evening cocktails and breakfast a bit more privately, and the folks down at the concierge desk answered so many of our questions and made sure my laundry was done super-quickly for a meeting! The wi-fi demanded re-logging in often, and the first night it didn't work at all and I missed a meeting, but they were kind enough to refund my charge for that night. Really well-located near Bugis Market!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: lopez_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very convenient location near the subway. The staff were very helpful at all moments. The rooms are very spacious and our daughters stayed in a room connected to ours. The pillow menu is outstanding!! The breakfast at the Olive tree restaurant is great with a wide choice of different dishes. It's worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizinKL
Reviews.Content: The room was great, and quite large. Good service, with fruit basket, good selection of tea/coffee, free water, chocolates on arrival. Bathroom toiletries are good, and a nice supply of towels. One criticism would be the small shower cubicle, quite cosy for 2 people! The bed was really comfortable and there was even a pillow menu. Breakfast in the Club Floor Lounge was good, though there wasn't as big a range of items as in other similiar hotels. The main negative point was that the wifi wasn't working very well during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Luxe”
Reviews.Author: mcbeanie38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reminisent of an old European hotel. It is lovely! From the beautiful carpets in the lobby and on the Club Lounge Floor to the evening piano music in the lobby, the feeling is one of total luxury. If possible, invest in Club Lounge rooms ~~ complimentary breakfast buffet (wide variety from fresh fruits to Asian cuisine), coffee, tea, soft drinks throughout the day, with High Tea choices mid-afternoon, and drinks and hor d'erves (really a full buffet) in the evening. The ambience in the Club Lounge was great for making friends and visiting, or just spending personal time alone. The concierge was very helpful and made many suggestions on tours that kept us busy for the week we were in Singapore. When planning a trip to Singapore, think of the Inter-Continental!

Reviews.Title: “My first Intercontinental Experience, and it was a delight...”
Reviews.Author: JamieLansdell
Reviews.Content: I received a complimentary upgrade to a suite in the Intercontinental Singapore over the formula 1 racing weekend. The hotel was very busy, the service was fantastic, the room i stayed in was amazing. I would wholly reccommend this hotel over the marina bay sands hotel where my friends were staying.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, stay at club floor”
Reviews.Author: Travel12370
Reviews.Content: The club lounge and other extras are worth it. The hotel has good service, their newly renovated rooms are however a bit small especially compared to the "older and cheaper" rooms. The gym is good, although it might be time to make some investments. The breakfast has plenty of choice. The small mall has a Starbucks and the location is good, what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms... decent location”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiMan
Reviews.Content: The InterCon at Singapore has good rooms. I arrived early by 8AM, but they were able to find a room - not a king, though, but the twin beds are large enough if you are travelling alone. However, that is where the good news stops. The reception/check-in was indifferent at best, perhaps 8am is too early for them too to flash the smileys. The breakfast service was terribly slow - worse than Goa - even though i can't imagine why as it didn't seem that crowded at all! Overall, if you are a business traveller, this is just as good a place as any to crash at night after a long, hard day. On the other hand, if you expect anything esle, maybe you should consider some other place. The standard late night room service burger meets the cut and the pool is tiny. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asianexpert
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the InterConti in SIngapore many times over the last years and it has become one of my favorite hotels in SIngapore. Located adjecent to one of the smaller shopping centers (Bugis Junction), it offers everything you need in walking distance: Small shops, restaurants, bars, food stalls - and if you want to walk 10 minutes or more you reach the big shopping malls at North Bridge Road. To the far end of Orchard Road one may want to take a cab or the MRT. It is locate din the "real heart" of the city, away from the touristic Orchard Road buzz. Rooms: The hotel has actually two different buildings, one is the so called "Shop House" which has rooms with a small balcony opening into the shopping plaza of Bugis, which is quite nice (no worries about the noise, it's closed after 10 pm).The building has just two floors and the rooms are ral "old style" with wooden floor, dark rose-wood furniture and wooden balkony doors and with old-fashion shutters. It has the charme of maybe 100 years back, but of course all the usual amnetoies and the bathrooms are state-of the art. But - one has to like it, it may not be everyone's taste. The other building is the 25 storey tower, which has the usual modern 5-start business rooms & suites. I sually take the Shop House room, which distinguishes this hotel from most of the other luxury brands in Singapore. Lobby: The lobby is a highlight, it opens towards a large coffee-shop area, where live "lobby music" is performed and which obviously serves as a meeting place for many business people in Singapore. Leave the lobby to the back-side and you ewnter the marke place of the Bugis junction shopping centre. It's really pleasant and relaxing. Service: I always received excellent service in this hotel, very knowledgeble concierge tips and, whenever possible, early check-in, even at 8 am in the morning. This is outstanding - in other hotels I had at times to wait till 3 pm before getting a room. Restaurants: I only know the coffee shop, which is a bit dark, but offers excellent choices, specifically the patissery is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, friendly staff but the hotel has an age !”
Reviews.Author: liveyourlifegood
Reviews.Content: My parents and some friends of mine stayed before in the Intercontinental Singapore and recommended the hotel to me. So I booked my stay immediately. We just came from Dubai and had a night flight. We so already arrived around 09:00 at the hotel. It was a not very expensive taxi ride but it took us about 25 minutes from Changi to the hotel. When the taxi stopped in front of the entrance, some staff members immediately helped us with our luggage and gave us a luggage tag. We proceeded to the Ambassador check in and checked in with Ms. Rafiqah. She was very friendly and of course also very helpful. We are Priority club platinum and ambassador member and so got a choice between our booked room now, or an upgraded Premier room, actually a Junior suite, in a few hours. We chose for the Premier room and decided to wait but we already checked in. Ms. Rafiqah suggested us to have breakfast in McDonalds or have breakfast in the hotel but it was off course not free of charge. We found it a bit strange in a 5 star hotel to recommend breakfast in a fast food chain restaurant. We did not have breakfast there but went to the concierge, Mr. Hock Kim. I asked him what we could do during 90 minutes because then, normally, our room would be ready. He looked a bit confused and was not so friendly in my eyes. After a while he recommended us to visit the Singapore Flyer, the big London Eye of Singapore. He explained us the way to there and gave us a map. We were tired and unfamiliar with Singapore and the immense pressure and heat there so it took us over 40 minutes by foot to get there. Once we got there we did a tour, which took about 30 minutes for one round. It was something nice to see once but it was air conditioned, very comfortable. We took a taxi back but he did not know where the Intercontinental was, probably for letting us pay extra but after 10 minutes we were back at the hotel and got our room keys from Ms. Rafiqah. She told us our luggage was already in our room. Our room was on the 10th floor, next to the elevators. Our room had a wide door. We had a small entrance in the room with some closets and on the right side was the bathroom. The bathroom had a bath, separate shower, toilet, sink and many toiletries. The shower was leaking some pressure and looked a bit old. Further in the room was a small living room area with couch and some seats. There was also a small table with some welcome gifts as ambassador member. We got three Fiji water bottles, some chocolates, some fruits and also some guides with explanations of typical Singapore fruit but not to forget, all served on very nice decorated plates. To the left was a very big King sized bed and a new LCD TV. Our room had a view on the next doors Bujis Mall. The air conditioning was working correctly and the temperature was good. The only bad thing is I think they dropped my camera bag on the floor a bit to hard because my screen protector was broken. There were many curtains and because we were tired we had a sleep. We forgot to set our alarm clocks and woke up in the evening. The ladies from housekeeping did their turndown service and opened our bed. We took a taxi and had diner in the city. Next morning we had breakfast in the Olive tree restaurant. Mr. Vincent showed us our table. The table was far from the buffet and next to a big closet. It is probably one of the worst tables and even though there were better tables available, he did not give them to us. He was not very friendly and did not offered us any drinks or asked us what we would like to drink. We asked a waiter for a Hot chocolate and received it. It was 50 percent foam and the rest was okay. The buffet is big and is half Chinese and half International. I ordered eggs with the chef, Mr. Wong. He put my egg in the pan for some seconds and I got it already back, still raw in the middle. It was disgusting. Fruits were not at all tasty but some were hood, others not. Service was to slow and not at all 5 star worthy. Juices were good but I personally did not like the Chinese dishes very much. We went to the concierge, this time Mr. Sidek. He was extremely friendly and very helpful too. We asked the what we could do and see that day in Singapore and he showed everything on a map and explained us how to get there. We walked through some shopping malls and passed the Theaters and walked over the bridge to see the typical Singapore dragon, the fountain of wealth, the Marina Bay Sky Park and the Art Science museum with an exhibition of the Titanic. We returned to the hotel and went to the fitness center. The center and machines are old but still working. The outdoor pool is nice and had a good temperature. Mr. Sidek, the concierge, printed some boarding passes for me and we asked him for an Italian restaurant and he suggested Garibaldi, a good restaurant close to the hotel. The hotel offers nowhere free Internet and in the room it is expensive. For free Internet we had to go to the Bujis mall next doors. The hotel has a direct connection to it but unfortunately it has not much nice stores. Next morning breakfast again and now Khoo gave us a very nice and central table. The hot chocolate that day was better but still 40 percent foam on it. I did not dare to take eggs but I was not very hungry. After breakfast I went to the concierge, Ms. Al Afrah Salleh and asked her what we could do, we had still two hours left and she send us to Little India. We there visited a huge store called Mustafa Center and walked in some streets around it. We walked back to the hotel and got a late check out till 16:00, we packed our stuff and checked out with Mr. Darren, he to was friendly. We left the hotel and took a taxi to Changi. The hotel has a good en central location in Singapore city, everything is doable by foot. The hotel is also connected with the Bujis shopping mall but bigger malls are located in 10-15 minutes walking. Overall a good stay, there are areas for improvement but that’s the case with all older hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cool lobby, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location in Bugis junction, while not one that comes to mind as the most obvious for business, is refreshing and surprisingly effective. Distance to the CBD is short, airport access is easy, and the MRT is just downstairs. The neighborhood is popular and lively. Nearby shops host not only the big brands, but also some more innovative and inexpensive fashion. The common areas are very attractive, set in a Malayan colonial style that features bright ceramics and dark wood. The atmosphere is relaxed and rejuvenating. The entrance lobby works as a meeting place, with ample space around the reception counters, while the inner lobby hosts the seating and drinking area. Special mention to the Mediterranean restaurant and the well-appointed patisserie. Service is friendly and efficient, if sometimes slow. Where the hotel fails, in my opinion, is in the rooms. For a start, they are quite small in comparison with other 5-star hotels in Singapore. On top of that, their classic decoration, with an abundance of plush duvets and quasi-rococco fixtures, clutters whatever limited space was available in the first place. Bottom line: one feels very comfortable in the lobby, but very cramped in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller8311
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip for two weeks... Se thoughts to share - Hotel - overall a really really nice hotel with a certain kind of old school charm to it...the reception was kind enought to give us an early check in as I reached around 9am!!! Location - very centrally located with bugis mall right next door... The MRT station was also very close making it easy to go anywhere.. Was also very easy to get cabs right outside the hotel... Staff - very friendly and extremely helpful.. Helped me get dinner reservations and arrange transportation etc.. Food - breakfast was included in my rate and ate there every morning.. Decent variety of food and cuisines... Although the guy at the omelette station was a bit quirky.. By asking him to put "extra mushrooms" he would only put 1 or 2 pieces... That's it! Overall service says good.. Rooms - very comfortable rooms and a very nice bathroom which had a separate shower place.. Room service was great as well.. Internet - although I was ok with paying for internet it was stupid that there was no wireless Internet in room.. Wasn't happy about that...

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this is the best place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Deb P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental on a short stop-over in Singapore and would definitely recommend this hotel. The service is friendly, personal and genuine, and nothing is too much trouble. The club lounge is a quiet intimate place to relax, have a drink and catch up on emails. The breakfast and snacks there were delicious. The lobby on the ground floor is spacious and roomy, with plenty of comfortable seating space. Our room was spotless, spacious, quiet, and equipped with anything that you could possibly require. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The location of the hotel is excellent, in walking distance of many tourist haunts, and adjacent to the Bugis Mall (tastefully renovated Peranakan laneways and shopping mall) and underground train station. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at the IC Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KohalaGal
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and were given both an early check in and an upgrade, our experience at the Singapore Intercontinental was special. Everyone was beyond gracious, our 'shophouse' room overlooked the Bugis Mall and, after 28 days in a cruise ship cabin, was blessedly spacious. The club floor lounge was large and comfortable and offered a good range of items at breakfast, tea and cocktail hour, as well as a couple of house computers and free wifi for your own devices. The bath was huge and luxurious with separate shower and tub, 'rainfall' type shower heads, and high end amenities. The bed was spectacularly comfortable, with heaps of pillows and more available on the pillow menu. The only 'niggle' I had was the complexity of the lighting controls - it was a little hard to figure out. The staff were uniformly gracious, efficient, and generally just lovely, the property is immaculate and we would love to return. The location is fabulous, too, very close to the Bugis MRT Station. The MRT is clean, safe and you can get pretty much anywhere you want to go on it.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler190511
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with wife and son in one club room. The room is ok, the bed is super. The club lounge is very good with free cocktails and wine during happy hour. Impeccable service throughout the hotel. The internet connection is the room is unfortunately unstable and sometimes even unavailable. The breakfast in the Olive Tree restaurant can be so crowded that you will have to wait in the lobby. We tried it once and went back to the club lounge for breakfast, which is already very good. The location is excellent with Bugis metro station very close and Bugis shopping mall and a great food court. Outside is a street with many Chinese hotpot/steamboat restaurants which offer good food at moderate prices, although some look a bit shabby. I will certainly come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: vacationerfmsing
Reviews.Content: Have the pleasure of staying frequently on business in this hotel and sometimes on vacation now. Possibly as my face is known it is a pleasure to have the greeting welcome back from the door to reception to club lounge and the bar Generally friendly helpful staff and you are made to feel at home The rooms are spotless, service swift and with the ever missing smile these days - but credit to all in this hotel Standard Intercon beds ... You fall into them Guess if you like a hard bed it's not so good but for us the rooms are just 7 star Standard 5 star prices but 6 star rooms and service Avoid rooms ending in 1. Or. 11. The bed is adjacent to a noisy service elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit old”
Reviews.Author: ckatsuya
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, good location. The architecture is charming, with that kind of "old time" feel, but I found that the room was in need of a remodel. Breakfast was ok, internet connection a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 nights before our trip to NZ.This is realy an outstanding hotel.with service second to none Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable so much so hard to get out of it in the morning. Pleased to say free internet in this hotel. We only had breakfast in the hotel and was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slbgotravel
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, pleasant and quick, which was appreciated when you check in late after flying for many hours. Room was great, best bed I have ever slept in any hotel by far. Breakfast is EXCELLENT for variety and service. Hotel is central and there is usually a taxi waiting right outside the door. Lots of brochures/maps near concierge to help find your way around easily. Would very happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding service at this Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: llleung
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 7am and w/out an early check-in guarantee, they had a room ready for me within 30 min and had also upgraded me to a suite. During the wait, I was escorted to the club lounge where they were extremely attentive and the food was terrific. I ended up spending quite a bit of time in the club and the service did not disappoint...they were pleasant and always went the extra mile. This is the best Intercontinental I've stayed at thus far in terms of service. Facilities were also very good....my room was newly remodeled and the rest of the hotel was nicely outfitted.

Reviews.Title: “Very good intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Travelerworldbelgium
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, extensive excellent breakfast, nice lobby bar. I had a non refurbished room (KING PREMIER), so a bit old dated but still very good. It is a spacious room , really a junior suite. The concierge at reception of which some were very knowledgeable and others not so knowledgeable... The service in the club lounge is the best I have encountered so far in any IC club lounge. It really feels like one star more compared to the already high standard hotel service. Very, very friendly and client focused. They go the extra mile without hesitation. Well done! Yes, I would recommend this hotel. It clearly deserves 5 star status.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staycation”
Reviews.Author: pngpng
Reviews.Content: Had booked for a much - needed getaway recently at this hotel. I had stayed here a few years back with friends and had a great time shopping and resting at this business hotel which is connected to shopping centres next door. Room is large and the important thing is, ventilation is good. Bathroom is of considerable size and tub is large. Love the Elemis bath range available. I was pleasantly surprised by the turndown service after returning late to the room on the first night. Bedding is soft and fluffy though it is a bit too soft for me. But with different pillows to choose from the pillow menu, this is an extremely minor grouse. Guests who love soft beds will definitely not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: 1SRG
Reviews.Content: After check in the shopping experience in the buggies junction was simply superb with a cold coffee stop and continue with it, the gaming junction, restaurants, all amazing interesting. time pass centre, an ideal one

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jyap
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Intercontinental Singapore, and it was a wonderful experience. The room was well quipped, with a spacious bathroom and a very comfortable king size bed. Appreciated the little but unexpected touches of bath salts, and a choice of 7 different types of pillows, turn down service. The staff were helpful and polite, though slightly lacking in the genuine warmth and interest which other reviewers have noted on which was a bit disappointing. Perhaps this warmth is only reserved for corporate travellers, Priority Club travellers or those who had booked direct with the hotel?. Some of the room service staff had a poor command of English, room service was too early in the morning. The air conditioning was a little cold. However overall I would recommend the Intercontinental. Location was great, a few subway stops from Orchard Road. Near the hotel was the Bugis market, Li Xiang Street with many restaurants. Located above Bugis MRT, and a shopping centre also made the location more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding night”
Reviews.Author: emijose
Reviews.Content: Due to our wedding banquet, we were entitled to 1 night stay at the bridal suite on level 3. I liked the exclusivity of the suites and you get a small "corridor" before reaching the door. The room was comfortable for us and our guests except we had 1 that faced the gym so we couldn't keep our curtains opened all the time. The room facilities were great and service excellent. There was even a pot of warm red dates tea for my tea ceremony even though I only asked for tea cups. Very considerate. Couple of things we realised - there was no dressing table, where I could sit at and do my make-up unlike the usual standard rooms, although the wardrobe did have a large enough mirror. We also found it strange for the toilet. At the other hotels, usually the bottom of the glass doors of the cubicle to the shower and toilet bowl are matted, but here it is completely see-through. It was quite weird to sit on the toilet bowl seeing someone else showering. The breakfast buffet was good and great variety - good food. The butlers were friendly and greeted us whenever we entered. Except that valet parking with cars parked out in the open sun, ended up with very warm interior when we retrieved our car.

Reviews.Title: “As Intercontinental Hotels go, this one is one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: FiMBeckett
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a friendly place with excellent levels of service, that said Intercontinental Singapore exceeds the local 'norm'. The hotel is in a great location, room standards are good, but as always the bottom line is down to the staff and all the staff at this hotel are friendly, attentive and hard working, but have to make a speci mention of:- Loh Jing Feng, Snr Duty Mgr, Sophia - lobby bar and Esther in the club lounge who all went over and beyond to make our three week stay so pleasant. The biggest compliment to this hotel is that ICH Group Australasia held a major annual convention at the hotel whilst we were there, bit of an inconvenience for us fare paying guests, but let's be honest ICH execs are going to pick a good hotel for their own convention and this one is good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Chpodles
Reviews.Content: What distinguish most is the kidness of all the hotel staff and the quality and variety of the buffets, breakfast and launch. It is very well located, close to Bugis MRT station and walking distance from the bay area. I would just advice housekeeping to do a deeper cleaning and take out any used glass or dish.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DubaiDoug066
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I stay in worldwide and overall best Intercontinental hotel anywhere. Service is top notch, rooms delightful and decor harmonius! In house Chinese restaurant offers Delectable food whilst Olive Tree on ground floor had Best French Onion soup I have tasted. However what crowns everything about this hotel with is the Club Level lounge and the superbly trained staff who attend to your every need but with genuine warmth and delight. It is always a pleasure to arrive at this hotel and genuine dismay at having to leave again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Bluestar79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are so impressed with the Intercontinental Hotel at Bugis, Singapore. The rooms are immaculate and spacious. The water pressure in the bathroom is amazingly good, with lots of hot water. The location of the hotel is ideal for shopping, food and access to the MRT. It is attached to Bugis Junction Shopping Centre, which in turn is next to the Bugis MRT station. It is also across the road from the Bugis Markets. At the other end of the markets is a large hawker centre. We were spoilt for choice in terms of food, with not only the hawker centre, but also a food court and lots of little food shops in Bugis Junction, plus a supermarket in Bugis Junction for fruits and emergency supplies, and the markets sold trays of sliced fruit, snacks and drinks. What impressed us the most about the hotel, however, is the service. No waiting in lines to check in. No waiting for our luggage to be delivered to the room. And there is a button on the room phone labelled 'Instant Service', which is pretty much what it says. I was greeted by name over the phone and my requests were delivered in mere minutes. The hotel had a main pool, a spa pool and a baby pool, which our toddler loved. It is also much better value for money than many hotels along Orchard Rd. We love this hotel and would definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: BJA82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last week. We were pleased with the hotel, rooms and service as always. Yes, it is a little expensive to stay, but most definitely worth the money. The rooms are spacious and presented so well, and the service from the staff is excellent. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough...

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: x66reg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in six weeks,everything was great,good service,clean,food excellent BUT it was a bit expensive compared to other hotelsin singapre.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, buts that's Singapore”
Reviews.Author: archer66
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit of 3 days after 6 months absence. The service again was brilliant and the hotel although aging was in top condition with refurbished rooms, at least in the area we paid for. Location is great with direct access to the undergound taking in most of Singapore. We were particularly impressed with Peter the lobby ambassador who provided a wealth of local information and this is a position that other hotels should adopt as our aging population travels and requires that little extra assistance. We were disappointed with only one change that has been made recently. Breakfast at the Olive Tree was the highlight of my previous visits and a change in format has reduced the Asian influence considerably. Sure there is a fine layout but we visit the region to experience the local food and this has largely been replaced by western style dishes. Dont change what was working so well!!! We will return next year as the staff are professional and the best we have encountered in Asia, and that takes some beating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebookpunkie
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel; centrally located; pleasnt staff; nice rooms; pleasant public areas. And often the same price as less 'luxurious' hotels. If you can't affor raffles - stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Club Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jetsettter
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Intercontinental Hotel in Singapore and this time I opted for a Standard Club King Room and with Ambassador Membership, received an upgrade to a Shophouse Club Room. Recently rennovated, this room was located on the corner of the building on the 2nd floor - same level as the club lounge. Since the room faced Victoria Street, my first thoughts were of road noise... and whilst there was a low hum, even during the busiest time of day - the room was sufficiently quiet. However, in the future I would suggest just one level higher would be even better. The shophouse King rooms are reasonable size, the double vanity is certainly a benefit for couples, the King bed functional and comfortable. The Pillow Menu will suit most people and for the technophiles, the Bose Wave Player, ipod connectivity and plenty of power points will be welcome. To use your ipod though, you'll still need to request the remote cable function from room service. I liked the layout of the room, the extra lighting and the old Singapore Shophouse feel. For larger rooms you can request the shophouse suites which add a living room area. All shophouse suites are located quite close to the club lounge. We also experienced a Standard Club King (19th Floor) due to a maintenance issue with our room which required us to be moved immediately and which was handled impeccably by the hotel staff and management. As this happenned on the last day of our stay our check-out was also extended which was very much appreciated. Standard rooms are quite bright and have different views and have standard (no double vanity) bathrooms, however these are certainly comfortable rooms and I would have no hesitation in recommending them as the lead in and particularly to upgrade from if you are an Ambassador member. For us, Intercontinentals are about the Club. The friendly staff, the personal service and greeting, the variation in food, the ambience and location, each Intercontinental Club can be the difference in a great or ordinary experience (in my opinion). This time, it seems like new staff are settling in although I do believe they were trying very hard and most of the time I found them pleasant and helpful. The lounge is well located, easily accessible and is tastefully furnished. What lets this club down based on other experiences is the variation of food. Maybe I am being overly picky but after Dubai and Hong Kong, afternoon tea really was a let down and evening pre dinner fare was only reasonable. That said, I will always recommend club access because it represents fantastic value. With a room service/hotel restaurant & Bar Soda (Coke) costing S$7.50, theres a saving right there!! And often the rooms are only S$30-$50 more a night. When you add food (Breakfast/Afternoon tea/pre dinner snacks), Internet, and drinks (sodas anyttime club is open) - quite simply - Club Rooms are the best option. The truth is, buying a drink at this hotel will hurt your pocket. 2 Bottles of Tiger Beer (local) and 1 Coffee cost S$39.00, 1 coke/soda costs S$7.50, a cocktail around S$13+ so enjoying several of these each night during happy hour in the club - the savings add up quickly. If youre not staying in club rooms, there is a 7-11 close by and the Bugis Mall connects directly to the Hotel providing shops, cinemas and MRT access. On the flip side, food costs in both restaurants and room service seemed quite reasonable and again there is huge range just outside the door. The question is would I go back? Definately!

Reviews.Title: “This place runs like a clockwork”
Reviews.Author: philiplk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at one of the club room with lounge access. Room was spacious with comfy bed, bathroom was big with nice toiletries. Lounge food n drink selection was good n the breakfast at olive tree was good too. Pressing was delivered punctually at stated time as was the dry cleaning, overall an enjoyable n comfy stay

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKatie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for the third time on our way home from Europe. This time, we had my in-laws with us, who hadn't stayed in a hotel as lovely as the Intercontinental before. We splurged on club rooms, which we were grateful for, as we arrived at the hotel at around 8-9am after flying from London, and could stay in the club lounge until our rooms were ready. My father-in-law ended up spending our entire two-and-a-half day stay at the Raffles Medical Centre due to food poisoning from something he ate in London. Being so close to the hospital made the stress of the hospitalisation much easier on my mother-in-law. My 4.5 year old daughter slept on a fold-out bed in our room. Her bed was beatifully made each day, and her bedtime cuddly toys displayed on the bed, rather than discarded to the side. Nice little touches. We had breakfast each day in the club lounge, and went to the happy hour one night. The food was all great, as was the service.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe a pet peeve”
Reviews.Author: AZuser1
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were great. Excellent service. Escorted to my room at checkin. I travel to Singapore quite often and, as you know, it is almost always a bit warmer than comfortable. So cold AC is important to me. I hate when I get back from a long day/evening/night with customers and the room is hot because house keeping turned off the AC. I was there for 2 nights and it happened both nights even though I asked the front desk to "please make sure" it didn't happen, with a reminder after the first night. I was pretty upset the second night. They also missed my wake up call one morning as well. So nice hotel and the staff try, but it seems they just miss on the (important to the customer) details (at least this time). At checkout I spoke to the manager and his only consolation was giving me his card and telling me he would take care of me next time -we shall see whether that was sincere or a "get out of my face" gesture.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasse57
Reviews.Content: A fabulous stay! Upon check-in we were escorted to our spacious room. Elegant, comfortable and the staff just hit the right spot every time

Reviews.Title: “UPGRADE/DOWNGRADE”
Reviews.Author: wanderingspoon
Reviews.Content: Sometimes "New" is not always better- I have stayed at this property many many times over the last ten years in various room classifications - most recently twice September/early October on the club floor - the rooms have been upgraded from the straits raffles look furniture to a suedo Italianate Faux chinoiserie look - the rooms felt cramped -you fall over a velvet tub chair and footstool oddly placed parallel to the bed - look like an afterthought - this was room 242 club level - It just felt fake designer borax walnut with transfer inlay The other more worrying change was the staff - never felt the insincere "have a nice day " attitude before - don't get me wrong it all works but compared with most Intercontinental property's in Asia and judging from previous visits - this is a pace behind not great for IHC as the competition in Singapore is fantastic - The Grand Prix was on in September so if Management was not on top of things- particularly when they where charging premium rates for this period it would be of concern to IHC Group i would presume I suppose as a Platinum Ambassador with IHC I am concerned that one my favorite hotels is under performing - My advice is do your research Singapore has a lot to offer perhaps a late check out and a room upgrade could be sacrificed for exceptional accommodation top restaurants and service at the other top listed trip advisory hotels

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a fine choice”
Reviews.Author: josefk68
Reviews.Content: This must be the 7th or 8th time I have stayed here and I always enjoy the experience. At reception I was escorted to check-in to the new executive lounge (was smaller and different floor last time I stayed). Very spacious. Note, Fullerton Hotel management - they let children in. Not only that, the staff were lovely with them. Room was an average size and fine for the three nights we were there. My wife found the Bugis market and that was it...my bank balance decreased daily. The location is great and close to Little India, Arab Quarter and a block behind Raffles. Breakfast in the executive club was very good as was the evening canapes and drinks. We tried breakfast in the lobby cafe one day...20 minutes and 3 requests to get a cup of coffee. And there can't have been more than fifty people at breakfast. Very disappointing but probably an off day. Staff - very nice and friendly, our luggage was in our room by the time I walked in, threw my bag down and ran downstairs for a cigarette. Room service was very good and a relatively wide choice. I rate this hotel highly

Reviews.Title: “Intercon Singapore”
Reviews.Author: chris_w01
Reviews.Content: Great location in more historic centre but near little India, financial district and Orchard road . Great feel and mix of colonial and modern feel. Good pool for a roof level pool, very good breakfasts, great lounge with creative cocktails. Big rooms in a city centre hotel are a rarity. Did not feel like being in a bit city conference hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel connected to mall”
Reviews.Author: PhillyJoan
Reviews.Content: Its everything you would expect with InterContinental. The staff are amazingly friendly and attentive, going out of their way to help and the also seemed to remember us and asked how our day shopping was etc. Its clean, the food is good, the restaurant had good choices. If its too hot or raining to go far there is a connected mall with good shopping. Its also not far from MRT, Orchid Rd and other attractions. The only bad thing I could say is that they decided to knock on my door just before 10pm at night for the turn down, which is a little late, so remember to put up the do not disturb.

Reviews.Title: “the very best bed ever ...!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arifin_dena
Reviews.Content: the hotel easy to catch..!next to bugis junction nice place to stay, the best experience is the BED really comfortable, soft and king size..either blanket and bed sheet..!all in the package of the bed ill give value "PERFECT"

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: horhay
Reviews.Content: We're giving this hotel a very rare 5 out of 5 as everything during our stay was just perfect. We transit through Singapore many times during the year and were getting a little tired of our usual hotel choices so chose this hotel for a change. We were very glad we did. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we experienced a very personal and warm level of service from everyone from the doorman to the reception staff to the pool guy. This went well beyond our expectations for a large international chain hotel where one gets quite used to receiving the bare minimum - the staff here were without fail excellent. We stayed in one of the newly renovated club shophouse rooms which was very well done and has been refurbished to a very high standard. While not enormous, the room was a good size with all of the amenities you would expect and most importantly the most comfortable hotel bed Ive come across in years of travelling. The club lounge is a very pleasant place to retreat to for some peace and quiet with highly attentive staff and a decent range of snacks of beverages and they make a mean espresso! The in house chinese restaurant was very good and room service breakfast also good. Staff in the lobbly lounge were just charming. Pool area pleasant but as others have mentioned a little on the small size for a hotel of this size and was completely full every time we were there. Overall, a refreshingly excellent hotel stay. Well done team.

Reviews.Title: “Service and food is missing from an otherwise nice property”
Reviews.Author: Osloboy
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby, and public areas. The guest room was large and with a good bathroom. The shower had a water leakage so that water came out of the wall near the floor, so maintennance might be a problem. I found the staff to be less than helpful and service minded at the times when I really needed them. Food ( tried room serice breakfast only) was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gaurangd12
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel which has preserved some heritage character of Singapore's old world charm. Its right next to Bugis Junction and very close to thriving hubs of Orchard, Suntec, Little India, China Town - Great location for tourists and businessmen alike.

Reviews.Title: “Club lounge is great value”
Reviews.Author: frecka
Reviews.Content: We didn't get into the hotel until almost midnight & checked out the next day but the room was very comfortable & the water & fruit left in the room was a lovely touch. The breakfast was grand probably not as nice as the Fairmont but it was still enjoyable. The best aspect for us was the club lounge; I had read on here to ask for an upgrade to use the club lounge and I did it cost $100++. For this we had access to: breakfast, afternoon tea & cocktails. It was just great value & a great facility for us to use. Our flight didn't leave until 11.10pm so we had a walk around came back & had high tea, had a lovely swim & lounge at the pool area & then after showering we had champagne & hors d'oeuvre before heading off to the airport for our hideous 13.5 hr flight to London!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loyalty-Club
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at this wonderful hotel. If you can, then book a Club room for an even greater experience with top benefits including lounge access, which provides for a real luxury experience with complementary drinks and food. Formal, but friendly staff makes this hotel an excellent place to stay. The only improvements I'd like to see are WIFI signals in the Victoria bar and the outside Pool area, which would make for useful business or leisure Internet access use whilst relaxing in these nice surroundings. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service!”
Reviews.Author: AEKBS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental in July of 2011, in a King Club room, and I must say that this is by far the best service I've ever experienced in a hotel. Other recent reviews have discussed its great location, nice rooms, and comfortable beds, and I agree with those positive reviews. I would like to focus my review on the hotel's amazing service, and why I will now opt to stay in InterContinental hotels over other brands in my future travels. From the time I arrived until the time I checked out, the staff made me feel as though my satisfaction was the most important part of their job. I had access to the Club lounge, and the service staff in the Club remembered me every day and even remembered what drink I usually preferred and which newspaper I liked to read. I ordered room service two or three times, and room service was usually faster than the time estimated, and the food was always delivered with a smile. The real distinction in service actually came after I checked out of the hotel. I emerged from my taxi at the airport and suddenly realized that I had left cash in several currencies in my hotel room. The total amount of cash equaled several hundred U.S. dollars! Naturally, I thought of returning to the hotel to see if it was still there, but I then realized that I did not have time to do that and still make my flight. I called the hotel, and talked with Ms. Loy, a credit officer. She sent housekeeping into the room, and they found the file folder that I'd accidentally left containing the currencies. I offered her a reward if she could send it to me, but she refused to accept one, saying that this was part of her job. Rather than send the cash and coins to me, she converted the cash amounts to Singapore dollars, and even found people willing to buy the various coins! (There were also coins of different currencies.) She then credited the entire amount to my account! I was amazed with this level of service, as I had truly expected never to see that money again. (Even as I write this, I'm still shocked! And they would not accept a reward!) My experience has made an InterContinental customer out of me. Shortly after this trip, a friend of mine called asking about my hotel recommendations in another Asian city, and I unhesitatingly advised him to choose the InterContinental. I've made similar recommendations to other friends, as well. They say that word-of-mouth marketing is the most effective tool in the hospitality industry; hopefully, at least a few people choose the Hotel InterContinental in Singapore because of my experience there!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMFTravels
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel now at least twice over the last couple of months and I have to say that it is a pleasant environment for business, working and well located. I will be back again in two weeks time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: feibeesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with wife and 2 young kids. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is connected to the Bugis Village Shopping Centre with plenty of F&B outlets and tons of shopping. There's plenty of local hawker fare as well all round the hotel. The Bugis MRT is accessed directly through the shopping center. With the MRT, you can get to anywhere in Singapore. If you are driving, parking is free and you get to park in the underground car park of the shopping centre. The hotel is the typical InterCons with well appointed rooms and good service. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: DaveTheMan88
Reviews.Content: Was there during 9Nov to 11Nov. Room was clean, spacious and good. Club floor staff was very pleasant. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “A place well definitely go back to”
Reviews.Author: AndygWatford
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveller to Singapore, I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel together with my wife during a recent visit. Given the large number of good hotels in the city, standards for this type of establishment have to be high and we were certainly not disappointed! The Hotel is excellently appointed with some rooms being recently re-furbished and its central location is really handy for most of the usual attractions. We found the staff very helpful, polite and attentive; more so than some of the higher price hotels. We were on a club level and the afternoon teas and evening cocktails were definitely not to be missed! The pool / gym were a bit small but overall a great place to stay... we'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Just alright!”
Reviews.Author: stugs123
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I expected a bit too much from this hotel after reading the other reviews. It's a good hotel but there are others in Singapore which are just as good. Hotel staff are always polite and courtious in Singapore so you will find this kind of service at any good quality hotel. Swimming pool was very small, and so can be over run with kids at times. We stayed at the club rooms and was told that there was no wireless in the rooms, and TV didn't even have a menu on it. There is however, wireless in the club lounge. Afternoon tea and drinks at the club lounge was ok, it was in par with the other club lounges in other similar type hotels. Most hotels in Singapore offer free local calls but not this one, as soon as you dial out, you are charged $4SD! Yep! and I was even calling a free call number! Taxi was very difficult to get during peak hours due to the conferences in the hotel, so it is much better to book a taxi just incase! (especially if you need to go to the airport by a certain time) Breakfast in the club floor had limited selection but still good. Go have breakfast at the Olive tree for a greater selection. Overall, ok stay, nothing to rave about. I wouldn't go back in a hurry as there are other as good quality hotels with better packages on offer in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service but a little on the slow side”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: Overall had a great stay in a premier room with club room access. Club lounge is spacious and quiet. Afternoon tea and breakfast spread in the club lounge was ok and there was a good selection of evening canapes. Staff in the club lounge were extremely polite and friendly although the man that checked me out of my room could have been a little friendlier and perhaps smiled. Room was clean and spacious. Club lounge benefits allows you to have breakfast in the hotel's Olive Tree restaurant but most of the food in the buffet is cold (eg. old pancakes/waffles etc) and staff in the restaurant are inefficient (I ordered a tea but they brought me a coffee) and the chef sprayed butter at me as I neared the pancake counter. The only complaint that I have is that we had to wait quite a long time to check in because the rooms were not ready yet even though it was 4pm. Staff in the club lounge were very polite and apologetic about this though. Also our room (number 301) was right opposite the gym so is a bit noisy because you can hear people going to and from the gym. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay because of the staff in the club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: billandlynAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Two visits to the hotel, the first in a Shophouse Club room the second in a Club Deluxe room. We were most impressed. Location is perfect. Generous, quiet, restful, well equipped rooms with lovely beds. Service throughout was efficient, friendly and considerate. Reasonable rates. The Club Lounge is brilliant. We felt very welcome at the Intercontinental. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well presented,clean, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kirishma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recommendation from the travel agent, an excellent and enjoyable stay.Location is excellent with all main sights within walking distance. Well appointed with comfortable rooms,had everything I needed and expected from a business class hotel. Great breakfast choices. The staff were very polite and helpful , cheerful and taking personal interest in showing us how to enjoy local place. I warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewR2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved it. Rooms are a bit dated but well maintained, spacious and clean. Staff friendly and went out of their way to help. Breakfast was good, and the beds were plush and provided a great nights sleep. Location is good with plenty of shopping nearby, and the rest of the city is easily reached with a taxi. This hotel will be my #1 choice the next time I go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice , simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: trilly11
Reviews.Content: Room super clean , excellent service . We stay in the club. Very nice lounge as well. Elegant atmosfera. I really enjoy .

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental Singapore is a top quality hotel in a good area (Bugis).”
Reviews.Author: Austman_1
Reviews.Content: Summary: InterContinental Singapore is a top quality hotel in a good area (Bugis) in Singapore. Arriving at InterContinental Singapore: InterContinental Singapore is (usually) a quick taxi ride from Singapore Airport. I arrived this time at around 11pm. Check-in was quick and my Ambassador status was recognised with an upgrade to a larger premium room that included a sofa and a small dining table. I was also given a welcome gift (a shawl). Some water, fruit and chocolates were waiting in the room. InterContinental Singapore itself: I've stayed many times at this hotel. It is stylish and comfortable with good attention to detail. Being directly connected to the Bugis shopping centre is very handy. Staff are usually very friendly and helpful. Rooms: The rooms are comfortable, modern, quiet (just a few elevator noises in the premium rooms) and very well equipped. A newspaper is delivered each morning. My L-shaped room had a good sized living area. Meals: I'm not a great fan of buffet restaurants but the Intercontinental Singapore's is one of the best I've tried. Dinner is a little more relaxed while breakfast can get crowded. Leaving InterContinental Singapore: Check-out was quick and simple. Within minutes I was in a taxi on my way to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel offers great service and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. I was upgraded to a Chop House room a while back and regret taking the upgrade. The Chop House side is a great room and I love the feel of the history but the location is not very good in relation to Burgis Street. The street kept me awake later than I wanted to be and the trash pickup woke me very early. I have since stayed and declined the Chop House upgrade and have been very happy staying here at least four times in the last year or so. Stick to the main house and you will not be disappointed with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a staycation”
Reviews.Author: yatee151
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental provided professional service and gave me the privacy I needed in the middle of the Bugis bustle. The room itself is a joy; I fell asleep in seconds in the bath. My iPod plugged on the dock provided went right into the speakers in the bathroom so I really did get a lullaby. Breakfast is in a sunny enclave with a nice healthy spread of muesli and omelette with the usual asian and western offerings. I just like the simplicity of it all. At SGD250 for a 2day-1night weekend stay, you get the understated luxury without going bust.

Reviews.Title: “Three stays, all good”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times since April and really do recommend it. It is not as modern as say the Conrad rooms, but it is very classy and the location is top notch. It is located by Bugis Junction (you can get to the MRT without getting wet) and gives you access to the shopping in Bugis Mall, the Junction Market and the Luna centre a few minutes walk, five minutes more gives you City Hall area for the mall there. Food wise there are courts under Bugis Mall, stalls just beyond Bugis Junction and the strret directly across from the hotel (I think Lien Sieng) is nothing but interesting places to eat. Chijmes is 5 minutes away. Room wise the hotel rooms are good ,well laid out and equipped, but not the big TV screens you can get elsewhere. Wireless networking works well. Beds are big and comfortable, if a tad high. Twice I have used the exec lounge in the hote and it is classy - food range generally limited but drink is served quickly and with a smile, staff are top notch. It is laid out with Peranakan furniture, making it warm in feel. The main lobby of the hotel is similar and a treat to relax in. I have once had one of the Shophouse style rooms. I was surprised to find it facing the main road, so had to careful with my windows/shower etc, but it was definately nice otherwise, but dark. However it's the bell boys that make it for me. My luggage carries a tag for easy recognition at the airport - it's the colours and name of the soccer team I support. On my last two visits the bell boys recognised it and came to say" welcome back" - that's a touch missing in many hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: IamFromNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on business. The hotel is conveniently located -- i.e., walking distance to offices; you walk out the back door to a shopping complex and a basement of restaurants. Walk a few blocks to the exotic alleys of restaurants serving more diverse cuisine. Subway is also in the same shopping complex. Very convenient! The room was clean spacious, including the bathroom. No complaints. I had a great stay. I would recommend to both business & leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect !”
Reviews.Author: KhloeSummer
Reviews.Content: Nice design, good location, great service, nuce pool,. in one word .... PERFECT !

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: MPBConnect
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in some good and not so good hotels in Europe and Asia. The InterContinental must rate as the very best. We booked the Club Floor and arrived at the hotel at around 8.00 am, after a flight from Paris. We were welcomed by name at the reception desk and taken immediately to the Club Floor and served breakfast. We thought that we would have to wait until 2.00 pm for a room but, no, our room was available. The service was seamless, professional and friendly. The snacks and drinks on the Club Floor were excellent and it kept coming. Our room was extremely comfortable. Concierge service was knowledgeable and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and we were always greeted by name and with a friendly smile. The InterContinental is well located. This is an exceptioanl hotel. Phil & Marilyn Brisbane

Reviews.Title: “Outdated - not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: LavJo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to Bungi Station. We didn't get the category we'd booked. Very very long walk to town house rooms, lots of up and downs (lots of stairs and floors). Not very clean, especially the bathroom. Outdated Room and Bathroom. Rooms are very clairaudient. We had a room with no view. Pool is very small.. Staffis not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: camsean
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of Intercontinental Hotels in Australia and Asia, but this was easily the most impressive. The service was attentive and professional throughout the hotel. lt was unusually consistent in this respect. It was not a case of a couple of especially good staff- everyone we came in contact with gave excellent customer service. Also worthy of mention was The Club Lounge, which offered an especially good range of food and an even better 'evening cocktails' selection. Unlike the usual suspects- wine, beer and spirits- the lounge had a cocktail menu, with a variety of unusual selections. Having said that, we had the breakfast in the main restaurant and it was also outstanding. The whole hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury...”
Reviews.Author: Cmd2011
Reviews.Content: If a little pricey at times, this hotel has it all: wonderfully comfortable and functional rooms, the best breakfast buffet we had ever seen, offering both western and oriental food, caring and friendly staff, and a location that allows for walking in the city, or diving into the subway system next door to go further afield. We will most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Glenn M
Reviews.Content: This is a flagship hotel for the chain and it shows. I stayed for only two nights but both were excellent in every respect in terms of the time spent in hotel and room. The restaurants are extraordinary. The location is literally right in the middle of the best shopping district and seconds from business and entertainment mecca. The rooms are literally worth twice what they charge. At the higher level, the concierge service is incredible, including a lounge that makes the finest first class international airline lounges look bad. All the glamour and quality of Raffles, Singapore's best known (and close) hotel, but $100 a night less expensive -- for a vastly higher level room.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck In The Middle”
Reviews.Author: MrBuff
Reviews.Content: Ever wondered where the heck those places are that just seem to be in the middle of everything ? Well the Intercontinental is one of those places, right in the middle of Singapore yet calm, quiet and decidely spacious. Stayed here early August 2011 and found it to be great, admittedly it was in a Executive or Club room (shophouse King room) but it was great. Right next door to Bugis Shopping Centre (& train station), as well as being 10 minutes walk from the Town Hall station where you can purchase the transport Tourist Pass. Pool area at the back nicely tucked away, if your looking for a 5 * place to stay which wont break the bank and has quiet, comfortable and central location then I highly reccomend the Intercontinental. It really feels like an 'old fashioned' hotel with great modern day equipment and levels of service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Package Price”
Reviews.Author: pdxballard
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week for business meetings at the hotel. They had the best all around price for the meeting room and hotel rooms combined. The Hotel is a bit dated but the room was nice enough. No wireless so you had to be hard wired in which was a hassle. The bathroom had both a soaking tub and a separate shower with a great wide shower head. The breakfast buffet and lunch buffet were nice although it was included so I didn't see what the "nice" cost!

Reviews.Title: “excellent property and excellent service great location”
Reviews.Author: Soosie999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is timeless in not only its architecture but its quality and service. After an unpleasant experience at the much vaunted Marina Bay our return stay at the intercontinental was excellent. The room was spacious, beautifully appointed and very comfortable – you gotta love a pillow menu! The service was excellent but as with all of these high end hotels the ground floor establishments were not cheap. We dined at the Japanese restaurant – lovely but was shut on the weekends?! We had a couple of drinks in the main bar – nice but expensive. The concierge deserves a special mention – didn’t seem to matter how obscure a request – they had an answer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dav_Barbarossa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two weeks, great service, helpful staff and good restaurants. Room was medium sized, with a very comfortable bed. However it had a slightly bad mouldy odour. If I go back to Singapore I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: fortune2010
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in singapour , centrally located within walking distances of all major places and museums.The hospitality is excellent. Food and breakfast is very good. A peaceful place to rest and rooms are very spacious and good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with superior service”
Reviews.Author: stonhaus
