Reviews.Content: For many years I have been travelling twice a year and as an A/Club member always stay at Sofitel hotels in Club rooms. As there is no Sofitel in Singapore I tried the Interecontinental at Club level. The comparison is interesting particularly as my previous stay had been at the Metropole in Hanoi. Tthe Intercontinental rooms are big and have everything required to make the stay comfortable but the room somehow was a bit tired. The overall quality and finish of the Sofitel rooms is superior. That aside I am of the opinion that the overall hotel experience at the Intercontinental was faultless. The bed was the most comfortable I have slept in. The service was outstanding whether it was the front desk, the club, Olive Tree, bell boy, room service or room make up. Everyone was friendly and helpfuland very efficient. We arrived at 7am and were given a room ASAP. The next day we requested a room on a higher floor and this was provided without any fuss. The room service was the fastest I have ever experienced. It seemed I had no sooner put down the phone and my order arrived. For thr extra cost the cub was outstanding, the food, drinks and service was great even though the club was at times quite crowded. The one negative was the availablity of the computers in the Club room. As it was a short holiday I did not take my laptop and found that the club only had two computers available. What was annoying was that young children were constantly using them and it therefore was difficult to access the internet. This was the only disappointing aspect of the Club Lounge. Overall an excellent hotel experience in a very convenient location. If you can afford it try club, if not I believe you will still have a great stay

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stormgrass
Reviews.Content: make sure you pay extra for club rooms,gives you private b/fast room,free drinks

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: brettnwau
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in an Intercontinental Club room. All staff at the hotel were friendly and welcoming, regardless of who you came into contact with. The hotel is well located adjoining the Bugis Junction mall, with the MRT in the basement of the mall offering easy transport options. Stayed in a Club room decorated in the local Shophouse section of the hotel. The room was a reasonable size and well appointed with a very comfortable bed. The room was a little dark during the day time as some of the shutters on the window did not open. Otherwise comfortable and quiet. Only had breakfast in the Olive Tree restaurant which offered a good range of options and attentive staff. Cannot comment on the other restaurants. The Club Lounge offers good value with breakfast, snacks during the day and evening drinks/canapes. The pool area is pleasant and well laid out, although it does not get sun in the morning. Overall a great stay at this hotel with friendly staff and a good level of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Average overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajiv91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for business last year, I have stayed at numerous Intercontinental Properties in other countries and had expected same level of standards and service, but that was not the case. The rooms were OK, not too lavishly decorated, the TV was not a flat screen. The lobby was very average, so was the lounge to have pre dinner drinks. I was not too happy with the pillows as they were too hard, and rang up to request something softer. They didn't have any soft pillows! The breakfast was also disappointing, with 2 star hotels in Thailand offering better value and much wider range. Definitely giving this hotel a miss for next business trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - but they need to watch the competition”
Reviews.Author: Garymelbourne61
Reviews.Content: travelling year round on business i get to stay in the some great hotels and this is one of them - however they are getting too aggressive with their pricing ... Breakfast $44 SGD per person 24 Hr Internet $29 SGD per 24hours 1 water and 1 coffee during a meeting in Lobby $26 SGD 6pm checkout 50% = $260 SGD half day rate .... Tea and Coffee Making facilities very basic - 3star standard ... Bathroom amenities - Elemis - great quality .... Beds great - but rooms very tired and quiet dated.... Check around in Singapore - there is better ....

Reviews.Title: “Location location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Psha24
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 days here - walk out into a shopping mall with great shops and places to eat. Great rooms could see the Iluma light show from our room. Helpful staff, easy access to orchard road, little india and a short cab ride to Sentosa Island.

Reviews.Title: “old school charm with modern convenience”
Reviews.Author: Rinjani_Queen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to experience the peranakan, old shophouse kind of charm in S'pore, this is the place to stay ... very convenient location and good service! Particularly enjoyed the breakfast and the lounge ... friendly and personable services ... huge room ( only drawback, no wireless) Will consider returning for next visit ... an excellent alternative to hotels on Orchard Rd.!

Reviews.Title: “IC SIN Continues to Shine”
Reviews.Author: infoworks
Reviews.Content: IC SIN remains a great hotel, with friendly staff and good amenities. Recent renovations have made the shophouse suites particularly modern, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TashAdelaide
Reviews.Content: After departing the ship Arcadia we stayed in this oldish style but beautiful stylish hotel for three nights. At the time of choosing this hotel we mainly did so to use some accumulated points with Priority Club however I feel that those travelers wanting to stay in a hotel that is surrounded by some classy shopping as well as the cheap markets should be made aware of all the benefits this hotel offers., look no further if you enjoy comfort, quality and wonderful service. We were allocated a corner room, the room was large,great King size bed , very comfortable lounge type chairs and table. The bathroom was exquisite, very large by hotel standards that I have seen also provided a wonderful selection of bathroom products, plenty of large soft white towels, which seem to be replenished twice daily. As we were staying on our points we decided to upgrade to a hotel CLUB room which provided access to the Hotel Club. This was well worth while, delightful breakfast, all day refreshments, afternoon tea and pre dinner drinks and eats. The pre dinner eats were almost enough for a meal especially if you had had a large lunch. The service provided in this area by the staff was exceptional. The restaurant had great food with excellent presentation. The staff throughout the hotel would have been overall the best we have experienced in our world wide travels extending over 20 years. This will always now be our first hotel of choice when we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - lovely people”
Reviews.Author: EltelUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days en route to Sydney. We booked a club room which is well worth the extra for the inclusive breakfast, snacks, evening drinks and comfort not to mention the use of the club lounge on the the last day until you have to leave, irrespective of your checkout time. Everything was spotless, the room was supremely comfortable and as in most Asian establishments the people were polite and helpful. We ate in the Olive Tree restaurant which was great fun especially as were in there on Valentine's night with all the young Singaporean couples and were treated as "one of the family" as it were. The outdoor pool area was good for daytime relaxing alhough not especially private being overlooked and subject to some street noise it didn't spoil the experience. All in all a very comfortbale break and a good stop off if you are there either for a holiday or on your way to/from somewhere else and just want a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “4th Stay the Best”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay, and it was the best. My previous 3 stays I was not totally happy with the room, low floors with no view. This time, I got a room on the 10th floor with a very nice view. When checking in, front desk welcomed me and acknowledged that I was a return guest, and walked me to the elevator. The room was wonderful. The bed was super comfy. I can finally say I had an excellent stay at the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation!”
Reviews.Author: hurstie617
Reviews.Content: As a loyal IC club member was very happy with the great service provided. I had ordered a wheelchair for my aunt and the staff were waiting at the door and could not have been nicer and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: davidkwchong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the spacious King Club Premier Room with my children (we were provided two extra beds at no extra charge). Room is a bit dated with no wireless internet connection, which was very annoying. Check-in/Check-out done was at club lounge, afternoon tea spread was unimpressive. Decided to have breakfast at the Olive Tree restaurant on the ground floor instead of the club lounge for better variety and space. The pool is also tiny and the spa pool was not functioning when we were there. It took housekeeping an entire day to press one shirt and I had to call up to request for it in the evening. Concierge was also unresponsive, took 2 calls and 15-20 minutes for them to send someone up to assist with the luggage during check-out (10am, hardly a busy time). Positives would be the Bugis Junction shopping experience and the excellent Cantonese restaurant on the same level of the club lounge. Everything else was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “SIngapore Truely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: amitlodha23
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a amazing place and we stayd at Intercontinental for our work. Intercontinental is a great chain and this property is no exception to that. It has great friendly andever smiling staff and superb service. I would to mention about their CLUB LOUNGE also which was amazing as it had a fair collection of facilities fot the CLUB guest. In all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Third Successful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokexpat
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the InterContinental. With so many fine hotels available in Singapore, the fact that I return here says it all. I've given details of why I like the InterContinental in my previous tripadvisor reviews. Suffice it to say here that, during this stay, I found that all of the good points continue to exist, and that nothing negative has been introduced. I do have one gripe, however: at these prices, which are ever increasing in Singapore, it is inexcusable that the InterContinental doesn't include room internet access in the rate. To pay for this as an add-on is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “I might want Orchard Road location next time”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel. I like the colonial style and the overall look of the grand lobby where afternoon tea is served. My room was also of a colonial style. It was of a quite comfortable size for me, with a nice entry area. I had heard reports that rooms here were quite small. I did not think that was the case, but I paid for Club Floor access, so this may have had some bearing on the room size. The bathroom has both tub and walk in shower, which I prefer. Seating included two comfortable side chairs and plenty of table and desk space. The king bed was comfortable, with four big pillows. Amenities were plentiful, and replenished often. I also had two comp bottles of water everyday. I was advised to get more beverages from the Club Lounge rather than pay the mini bar prices. Internet required a wire connection, but was quite fast, and was included in the Club Lounge rate. Internet was wireless in the lounge, and several computers were available for free use by the guests. I paid the Club Lounge rate so that I was able to have free breakfast and evening cocktails and enough finger foods to make a meal (I don't like to eat a big meal in the evening). The lounge is on the 2nd floor, and away from lobby activity and noise. There are plenty of food items, hot and cold, so no reason to head out hungry in the morning. As my title suggests, I might want to consider staying along Orchard Road next time, although I was only strolling around this mall street once during my 3-day stay. The IC is actually connected to an interesting shopping complex with plenty of small shops and eateries. No need to wander very far to find plenty of interesting shopping. I found the hop on/hop off bus drop off location to be very handy to the hotel. Some of the more interesting museums were within easy walking distance, maybe 10-15 minutes. In that respect, the location of the hotel is just fine. Orchard Road would be a somewhat longer walk, which I did not make, opting instead to use the hop on/hop off buses. The hotel itself is inviting enough. Staff is very friendly and ready to help with advice and directions/suggestions. My first impressions were very favorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: oina
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was second to none. My daughter fell sick while we were there, and not only was the in-house doctor excellent, but the staff rang us after his visit to check on her progress. They even sent her a complimentary tray of fruit and chocolates to help her feel better. You only had to stop in the foyer and look confused to have someone run up and ask if they could help ... For such a big hotel, the system it had in place to make an individual guest feel wanted was outstanding. The appointments are great, the position is wonderfully central and the food is good. It's not exactly cheap, but you feel that you're getting your money's worth. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: Pros - Price - the advance purchase rate was very attractive - comparable to that of many four star level even the hotel is five star - Located right next to the mall with lots of shops (Bugis Junction) - Staff were very friendly throughout - Turndown service with bottled water Cons - I stayed at the lower floors and views were non-existent (roof of the mall) - Renovation at shopping mall means construction noises that could be clearly heard at the room at 9:30am - Room decor was on the older side but could use some renovation - Room sizes were around 35 sqm, and is smaller than other 5-star hotels in the city - Internet in room is only wired (not wi-fi as stated on the website) Overall, recommended (but not highly recommended). I have stayed at the Ritz, Conrad, St. Regis, Four Seasons in Singapore before and to my opinion, if the prices were the same among all hotels, I would not have chosen the Intercontinental

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: globedetour
Reviews.Content: The service is great. We have a very pleasant stay here for 3 nights. The staffs were great, very attentive, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: DaysofThunder
Reviews.Content: All we were after was a rest and recuperate stopover in Singapore, after a couple of weeks trekking through the Cambodian & Vietnam countrysides. We had a wonderful three days made all the more memorable by the staff of the InterContinental. Quite the most polite and efficient group of hotel personnel I have been associated with, and I have seen a lot.

Reviews.Title: “i'll never go back”
Reviews.Author: travellerjohn04
Reviews.Content: I am a Royal ambassador with the Intercontinental hotel group which i am told puts me in the top 1 percent of their clients. This hotel will make you feel like you must have booked into a bargain basement discount motel. The fruit basket consisted of an apple and an orange.The japanese restaurant was absolutely the worst meal i have had in years! it was also expensive and they had virtually no fish! We ended up eating a 300 dollar hotpot! We had drinks in the lobby during the happy hour and were charged full price! The service was horrendous. The beds are very soft and i had to call daily to housekeeping for them to clean the room.I finally checked out early and moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Facilities and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Herninawati
Reviews.Content: I stayed at some hotels in Singapore and l stay in Intercontinental Hotel is my first time. This time l was not wrong to chose this hotel because my self and my friends really enjoyed this hotel very much. I love this hotel very much, the location is near by everywhere. Staffs are very friendly and helpfull. Rooms are nice, clean and spacious, and comfortable. Me and my friends stayed there for 1 night, we were very enjoyed staying there. I will come back again soon, and recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Fantastic Club InterContinental Lounge”
Reviews.Author: E_Sweat
Reviews.Content: As always I had a great stay at the InterContinental Singapore. It has been a few years that I stayed at this property and was pleasantly surprised by the new Club InterContinental Lounge. The new lounge is definitely one the best I've ever experienced and can definitely recommend other travellers to take the opportunity to experience it for themselves. The team was friendly and professional and deliver the personalized service that is expected from the Club InterContinental Lounge. Food selection was was diverse and of good quality. Will definitely come back here on my next trip to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location but old hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandeak
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for 5 days for our family of 5 through Hotwire. When we arrived they only had one room on file but were able to give us a 2nd King room on the same floor and put a rollaway bed in for free (normally a charge for the 3rd person) because they didn't have the double twin available that we requested. All the staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to help us. Location was great. Attached to a mall with the metro underneath for easy transport. About a 15 min walk to Arab street and Little India and a 15 minute walk to Orchard street. No wireless internet though. We had to walk to the McDonalds in the mall to get wifi and it didn't always work. Couldn't shut off the TV speaker in the bathroom and there was not blowdryer plug available in the bathroom but they had a place with a mirror and a plug not far from the bed. The beds were very comforable and it was pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JulesDarwin
Reviews.Content: In one word, GO. The hotel is wonderful. Attentive staff, clean rooms, service is exceptional and staff friendly. My husband and I stayed twice June and July 2011, we can not express how satisfied we were with this hotel. Singapore after France was well worth it. Clean city, friendly taxi staff, outstanding safety in the streets and hotel, and excellent service in the Intercontinental. Many countries (including mine) could take a lesson from Singapore. I will be returning in December 2011 to spend Christmas. Well done Singapore and the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great Service, great loaction, but...”
Reviews.Author: jestra
Reviews.Content: In June 2011 we made a 2 days stopover in Singapore and stayed ath Interconti. This is really a great place located in the heart of downtown. Bugsi market is walking distance, a nice shopping mall is dierctly connected to the Hotel and the MRT (SG subway) is 5 minutes away - from here you´ll arrive in 10 minutes at Orchard Roads - SG´s shopping paradise for around 1 S$ (ap´p. € 0,60). Anyway, we had a lovely room with all expected equipment. The people did welcome us very warm and as well the concierge service is superb and knows a lot about "where to go?" - fancy place like the bar on the 71st floor of the Suiss Hotel or nice local restaurants. All together we had a wonderful time. The only thing I have to complain is the Fitness Centre. The area definitevly needs remodelling. We had a night flight out of SG and checked-out lunch time. So we left our lugagge ath the concierge and went to the new Marina Bay Sands Sky Gardens, Casino, theather and shopping mall. Before departure to the airport we were offered to refresh and to shower in the fitness area - this is something I would not do again. Next time I will go to the airport and shower in an Airport Lounge (we were SG Airlines so very beautiful lounge). From my perspective this area of the hotel is not the standard of an exclusive 5* Interconti. But in general the place is great! If I wouldn´t have gone to the firness centre a would have rated 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious - dreaming about going back”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissAverage
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had the worst time in Bali, her purse was stolen on the first day and iphone stolen on the last day, we were in a terrible mood but stopping via Sinagpore on the way home and staying at the Intercontiental was one of the best moves we have ever done. Instantly forgot about the terrible time in Bali, the hotel is so so nice. Room service for desert is a must. The location is really central. The service is really good and not pretentious, my sister and I looked a bit feral when we first got there and were not frowned upon at all. I have stayed at the Fullerton previously and that also was really good, I felt that the Intercontinental was definitely on par.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience and worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Pranay75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of a shopping district, as well as government building. The staff is very helpful, and they are aware of the Intercontinental standards and live up to them. The hand-crafted dumplings in the Japanese restaurant are great, and can be ordered in the bar. The lunch buffet is huge, and gives a wide range of choices. If one believes that breakfast is the most important meal of the day, the hotel endorses that, which can be seen by the sumptuous spread. The rooms are great. The Intercontinental concept of Club Lounge is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Leandro_Ang
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 3 times in 2010. both for Business and leisure. Every time I stayed there is was a good experience. The staff is very polite and friendly. The location is amazing (close to Bugis Area with shops and restaurants) The fitness center is well equipped. Rooms are not very big but extremely cozy and warm. Internet is charged.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service - Club lounge is a must.”
Reviews.Author: Genius12
Reviews.Content: Our taxi took us along the beautifully landscaped Airport Boulevard and into the city centre, with great views of downtown Singapore, the Esplanade area and the Singapore Flyer (akin to the London Eye). The InterContinental (IC) is situated on Middle Road, in a great location between the Colonial Core and Little India, ideal for exploring the whole of the island. I had a booked a Club Room for 6 nights, for the very reasonable price of a little over £850. Upon pulling up at the entrance, the taxi door was immediately opened for us, our bags taken, and a sincere welcome to the IC was given. We had arrived at around 10am, and despite the official check-in time being 2pm, we were immediately escorted up to the Club Lounge (on the second floor) for our private check-in. The lounge has recently been relocated from the 10th floor (where our room was) to the 2nd floor, and as such is a brand new interior with views on one side of the quaint shopping area and on the other of the splendid lobby lounge, both a floor below. Our check-in was completed so smoothly and efficiently that we really didn't have to do anything but sign on the dotted line, and I was given a pashmina as the IC Ambassador present. (IC Ambassador is a paid-for membership scheme which gives various benefits at IC properties, including guaranteed complimentary room upgrades and complimentary Priority Club Gold membership.) We were offered breakfast in the lounge, but declined and opted to be escorted straight up to our room as we were feeling a little worse for wear after the long flight from London. Our room was beautifully appointed with great views across the Colonial Core as far as the Esplanade area and down onto the hotel swimming pool below. The large bathroom, entrance hall and bedroom was immaculately clean and had every amenity you'd want from a five star hotel, without going overboard. Because we required two beds and were already in the highest available category of room with two beds, the Ambassador room upgrade was not offered, but instead (upon enquiring) we did receive a sizeable discount on the final bill. The IC is an almost faultless hotel. From the delightfully courteous and professional staff (especially in the Club Lounge) to the beautiful interior design and ambiance, the IC is one of those hotels that makes you feel truly special, without being insincere. In-room dining was of an excellent quality, and the amenities of the Club Lounge were superb. From breakfast, through afternoon tea to evening cocktails and hors d'oeuvres, the standard never faltered. One minor criticism of the Club Lounge is that the internet on their PCs was painfully slow, although it may have been quicker when using the complimentary wifi service on one's own laptop. Our check-out was extended to 7pm, another benefit of Ambassador status. After checking out in the lounge, we hopped into a taxi to take us on the short 15-minute journey back to Changi, leaving the truly remarkable InterContinental Singapore behind with heavy hearts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic staff in a bustling part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Brancepeth1983
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel on business and had a really good stay. The room was spacious and clean, and the gym is relatively large and well equipped for a hotel gym. The newly renovated Chinese restaurant is a gem. The staff are friendly, courteous and really in the know about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Frequent Traveller from Scotland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this IC before and I have to say it is one of the best in the group. Way better than the likes of the IC in Melbourne (check out my review of that!) I have an Ambassador card and it really came into its own at this property. Not only did I get (unsually I have to admit) an upgrade to an enormous suite but the internet was also free. A nice touch, especially as lots of high end hotels seem to charge high prices to access the net. The bed was every so comfortable. A/c worked perfectly as it was extremely warm and humid so it was nice to get into the room. Late late check out was easily arranged (that card came in handy yet again). Everything about this place - from the location to the staff are fantastic. Will stay here without any doubt next time I am in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “singapore stop over”
Reviews.Author: teddybearadelaide
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 24 days in europe it was a pleasure to stay here. The hotel was perfect and very well positioned to explore singapore central. The staff made us feel very welcome and the best of our holiday. Stayed in a club room and the benefits soon had us forgetting about the little extra it cost We are looking forward to returning soon. We travelled every where in cabs due to the low cost and the humidity. .

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Perthbhoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights on our way home to Perth Australia from Europe. The hotel was excellent in every way. The location was spot on and it was close to everything including shopping malls and food outlets. Maybe I was tired after a long flight but the bed would have to have been the most comfortable ever. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff, spoils us for anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: WendyPerth
Reviews.Content: Once you have stayed at this hotel in Singapore it becomes the gold standard for anywhere else. For a minimal extra charge it is worth upgrading to the club executive class as you then have access to the club lounge which includes some meals, coctails and check ins and outs. It is truly beautiful and the staff go out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Even when they were off duty they made sure we had everything we needed. The rooms are also lovely with top quality linen, beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Brightievictoria
Reviews.Content: Fabulous in every way. A lovely old colonial building totally refurbished inside with modern conveniences - the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - best ever and a very comfy king size bed”
Reviews.Author: missyv13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the long weekend in June to attend a wedding at Raffles - which is located very close by. Location to everything in Singapore very good, with Bugis shopping centre and MRT located at this site. The airline lost my bag (very stressful) and the hotel staff took care of all the follow up and were very attentive. Its this level of detail and service that takes the stress out of your holiday. The king size bed was extremely comfortable - I loved this hotel and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This is as good as any Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Spheroids
Reviews.Content: Not been to Far East for some time ... and on this business trip had 3 countries to do. Colleagues choice was the Mandarin Oriental .... however at ½ the price the Singapore Intercontinental was my option ... and being member of IHG priority club it guarantees me a upgrade room, and loyalty points for my stay. Location – everywhere in Singapore city is pretty central ... and this location is good for business or vacation. Hotel – is luxurious ... I could happily live there (and not many Hotels I would say that about) It is very much Colonial splendour, opulence personified. The staff can’t do enough for you ... they really want you to have a good stay. Rooms were large, working desk area, even had a BOSE radio and iPod dock. Desk also had Laptop & USB charging points. The touches such as fresh fruit, bottles of water, slippers at end of the bed .... all make for a memorable stay. Same day laundry or even overnight laundry also welcome. The Hotel has a roof top pool with luxurious loungers for a lazy day ...... and a modern well equipped gym. I only had breakfast and a ‘bar snack’ at hotel, but both were excellent ... the breakfast choice is very wide indeed. Next door is a significant sized mall, so plenty to shop in 21st C environment ... or cross the road to the bazaar which is chaotic bustle of Asian markets, both great places. Eating out – you have to go to the .... area, superb walk around the water, with loads of choice – I ate at a great Thai restaurant While in town you just have to go to Raffles Long bar and have a Singapore Sling ... it’s world famous, and outstanding setting. Many visitors end up in Orchard Towers .... a unique experience. I have no doubt when I return to Singapore later in year, I’ll stay at the Intercontinental again.

Reviews.Title: “good one”
Reviews.Author: atishayjain
Reviews.Content: This property is in the heart of Singapore and good value for money. The rooms are spacious so are the wash rooms. Ease of conveyance adds as an icing on the cake. Property is surrounded by voluminous eating joints for all ages, though the only negative for me was dearth of good vegetarian restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “best stay so far”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: best location best service (comes with complimentary bday cake & late check out) friendly staff clean room comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “Good stay..”
Reviews.Author: About_and_about
Reviews.Content: Had adjoining rooms, both were what you would expect from the InterContinental group - clean, comfortable and well equipped. Front desk staff were friendly and everything went smoothly - which is all you can ask! Fabulous breakfast selection, covering all nationalities. Lovely bar/lounge area, which I spent some time in as I needed to sit there to get WiFi connection - none to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Unforgettable Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Wong75
Reviews.Content: Excellent location due to its proximity to one of the greatest shopping heaven in Singapore, Bugis Junction, as well as MRT subway station. Loved its mix of Peranakan & Western design in the room as well as hotel interior. Personally, I think the bed & pillow and its shower are the best thing I adore. The bed is so comfortable with lots of down feather pillows. You can even choose a different type of pillow from a pillow menu! Loved the powerful shower too! Housekeeping was carried out twice a day, with the major one at noon and the other in the evening, very efficient and truly satisfied with the excellent service. I will retun if I have chance and recommend to my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “My little nest.”
Reviews.Author: binita_kp
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel location service rooms all very impressive. This place was so nice and comfi and clean and cozy on one side. On d other side it had shopping malls restaurants and so much hustle bustle. Great place to b in. V well done. I would def go back der. There maybe better but this is d way I like it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: thegothicgoat
Reviews.Content: Date: 06th - 09th May, 2011 It was my first trip to Singapore accompanying a group of almost 150 people from a reputed corporate client in India. If you are a first time traveller to Singapore, then the Intercontinental hotel is like a breath of fresh air! Just one look at the hotel exterior and the spacious lobby, the friendly staff who welcome you and are at your beck and call, is just enough to make you feel at home. The breakfast area is huge and spaced out, a wide range of breads, hot and cold dishes, Indian and vegetarian dishes and freshly squeezed juices are real soothing to the eyes. The rooms are quite large, clean and adequately equipped with all that you need be it in the main room, the cupboard or the bathroom itself. The main attraction being, that is located bang in the middle of the shopping area, called the Bugis Junction, which snakes out and criss crosses inbetween the hotel. You will be spoiled silly with the many 'shop till you drop' options apart from the Junction i.e. Bugis Village, Bugis Street, Albert Square, Burlington Mall and the BHG Mall. As far as location is concerned, it is located about 10 minutes from the Mustafa Shopping Centre, Serangoon Road, Little India and if your local tongue desires, the Indian restaurants as well! If you are out touring the entire day and need to grab a bite to eat, there is a 7/11 just in front of the hotel where you can get anything under the sun!! A real treat of a hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: chileandreamin
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, quick access to the MRT (subway), good service, clean rooms with very efficient housekeeping and a knowledgeable concierge....great experience given we were traveling with a one year old!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but NO EPL Football Action !!!”
Reviews.Author: Tysin30
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I love this hotel, it is great, location, service, etc. But if you want to watch the EPL (English Premier League) stay at the St Regis, Hilton or just about any other 4 or 5 star hotel in Singapore as these hotels have subscribed to MIO for the football action. Come on Intercontinental pick up your game, get the MIO channel in the rooms, what it would cost about an extra $2/day, just put it on my bill !!! I am staying again at your hotel again now, but come the next EPL season I think I will need to switch - my room this week is 1509, i checked in on Sunday 29th May, so you can see who I am actually :>)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant colonial hotel with excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: NeilnJess
Reviews.Content: So glad we decided on staying at the Intercontinental Singapore while on our holiday. The hotel staff were so friendly and welcoming everyday, after arriving back from a long day shopping the concierge was more than happy to insist on carrying our bags to the room. Our room was serviced twice a day, once in the morning and a turn down service at night which was a pleasant surprise each night after dinner and sightseeing. Check in was fast and friendly and more than happy to spend time explaining the services and restaurants available in and around the hotel. The hotel is located in the Bugis district with shops and the MRT station right at your doorstep. Bugis markets are a must for anyone looking to pick up a bargain in a pleasant and friendly shopping enviroment. The buffet dinner at the Olive Tree restaurant was absolutely superb, with the staffs attention to detail and service among the best we have received. Overall a very pleasant stay and look forward to returning in the future

Reviews.Title: “Just a brilliant hotel - unforgettable experience!”
Reviews.Author: ThomTord
Reviews.Content: A trip through Asia couldn't have finished on a more positive note. What a marvellous place to end up.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Birthday”
Reviews.Author: missastrid
Reviews.Content: We loved that every staff member warmly greeted "Good morning Sir" each day. The fragrance from the lilies and orchids was beautiful. Our room was an echo of colonial times and a super comfy bed. I'm sure the current renovations will be worth the disruption once they are compete. It is 2 mins walk to Bugis MRT and all via the air conditioned pedestrian mall. We walked to Raffles for sightseeing and used taxis from the Hotel for travel to satay hawker market at night. Wonderful staff, fabulous lobby and generally gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: raindrops2226
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in early May, this is a great place to stay as it is linked to the Bugis Juction. the location is def 5 stars and the staffs were so helpful at all times, it is definitely a 5 stars service at this hotel. we stayed here after checking out from marinabaysands and theres no way Marinabaysands can be competed to Intercon! we are def recommending this hotel to any of our friends and family =) The service from the concierge is defintely 5 stars, especially theres one person that def made our stay more enjoyable, he is an adorable old man ( Peter Kan?! i hope i didnt get the name wrong) , he was being very sweeet and helpful to us. the room is very roomy, we got three girls staying in the same room and they gave us three beds without us requesting it, it was very sweet of the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit, just as good a the previous visit”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: Had to make a last minute change of itinerary and stay over in Singapore. Requested an early check in (5am). Hotel was obliging and had a room ready, no extra cost. No wireless Internet in room, however hotel supplied a wireless router, connected it up for me and everything worked fine. Room was clean, spacious and comfortable (as always).

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: XJ900
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed is the extremely helpful and friendly staff. From exiting the taxi someone is beside you helping with luggage, check-in, finding your room...The culmination was that I asked for the way to a nearby location and someone from the staff walked with me the 500 m all the way to the place I needed to go! The rooms are spacious and very clean including everything you need. The only downside is: no WLAN in the room, internet access via cable is possible, though. Even the A/C in the room is so quiet, you can hardly hear it. Breakfast is very good. Not a huge selection of things, but again, everything you need. There is also a fitness area and pool, which I didn't use, though. All in all: Yes, I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “definitely deserve 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: patthanakorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days and cant find anything to complain about it. Everything was perfectly-done perfectly. I highly appreciated their professional style in serving. The hotel's staff are nice and firendly people. They spoke good English and always showing willingness to help us. The hotel's location is convenient also. It's very near a shopping mall. We enjoyed shopping here very much. Make a trial on this hotel if you visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An exercise in excellent luxury”
Reviews.Author: read_my_mind
Reviews.Content: I was super impressed with the Inter Continental. We were fortunate enough to have a club room and the club floor is amongst the best I've ever been to, especially their cocktail hour. Service was ever-smiling, prompt and friendly. The rooms were well appointed with every feature you could want. As many others have commented, the location is first class (to go with the hotel). It's great to be able to pop across the road to the Bugis Markets, or there is some good shopping at Bugis Junction itself. Would very much recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisamik
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel 2 nights we felt very pleasant. It was really a good hotel that we have ever stayed. The reception staffs were really pleasant and helpful. Our room was large with a comfortable king size bed and clean. The location was excellent, very comfortable.Breakfast was delicious and served on time. Overall everything was good . We will recommend this hotel for my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to high expections”
Reviews.Author: zippy10k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a stopover and it's well located for this as it's on the train from the airport and next to Bugis Street station. When we arrived it was Earth Hour so a lot of the lights were out which was all terribly worthy but made it a bit difficult to reception as we had come in the back way. We had club room which was well worth the upgrade for the breakfast, cocktails and afternoon tea. The breakfast selection was remarkably good. Our departure flight was very late but we still had access to the club lounge after we had checked out which meant full appreciation of the free cocktails. The concierge was very helpful managed to answer some slightly random questions. Only slight niggle, and only very slight, was the duvet was ludicrously thick (thicker than we use in a very draughty old house in winter England) so had to get hurled off pretty quickly but then had to argue with the aircon which was freezing as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not very child friendly”
Reviews.Author: brownie1973
Reviews.Content: We arrived on foot after a long day traveling and the door staff tried to head us off at the pass - we obviously didn't look as though we belonged there but we had just spent 3 weeks traveling round Vietnam so perhaps we were a little disheveled! The room was lovely but we had booked for 2 adults and one child and when we got to our room the extra bed hadn't ben set up for our son. After 10 minutes a young woman turned up on her own pushing a huge bed so my partner ended up having to help her put it up as she would have injured herself doing it on her own. Not what you expect in such a hotel! The bathroom was spacious but looking a little tired. Some rooms on our floor were being refurbished so maybe this one was on the list to do. The pool was nice and the breakfast amazing - every kind of food imaginable but the service was slow and we had to ask several times for things like spoons and cups. The attention to detail was lacking a bit. The bar attached to the hotel looked nice and had a happy hour but we weren't allowed in with our child and they wouldn't let us get drinks from there and take them through to the lounge so we had to pay the extortionate hotel prices which seemed a little unfair. Overall, a very nice hotel in a good location. More attention to detail and friendlier staff would be a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ON 3 WEEK ASIA TRIP”
Reviews.Author: archer66
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly to experience the Bugis district as we have often stayed on Orchard Road. Hotel comments. I have stayed at much glitzier hotels all through asia, but, NONE have equalled the quality of fittings throughout this hotel. Its not new but it is maintained in top condition, with the bonus of the ajoining Bugis Junction mall. Rooms. Quiet and well furnished. We were surprised. Staff. The best trained and most genuinely oblidging group I have encountered. I was so impressed I congratulated the duty manager as we departed. Thanks to Anna in the club lounge who really went out of her way to help. But then that was the experience with all staff we met. Food. You must experience the buffet, it was quality and variety. We will return in October and looking forward to the experience again.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: HKasyouare
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Good location with a connection to a shopping centre and food court. A short stroll to the Liang Seah Street where you can sample all the good, local Singaporean sweets that you heart desires. HOTEL: Standard Intercontinental hotel. Functional, clean and bright room. Check-in staff is indifferent and cold, fairly common here in Singapore. Good size swimming pool, recommended in the late evenings when there are less people. CONCLUSION: A standard business hotel in Singapore: no character, no passion, purely business. The indifferent front desk staff could benefit from a course on how to make a costumer welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: AM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with 4 yo. Location was good as its right next to a shopping mall. Taxis are easy and relatively cheap in singapore so travel was not a problem. Hotel is luxurious and service was excellent. Club lounge was great for evening drinks and snacks. Sentosa is about 30 mins away by taxi. Zoo is around 45 mins. Room was large and very nicely fitted.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowStephen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here,as a stopover on way to Oz; stayed 3 nights in an upgraded shophouse suite; very comfortable and characteristic.Location;within walking distance to almost everything.Staff great and attentive.Breakfast in Olive Tree also great and plentiful. Only complaint !.. Renovation work slightly noisy,would have preffered to have been warned of this before arrival, but did not let this put a dampner on our visit to a great hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks holiday in Europe, on our way home to Sydney, Australia. we stoped over at Singapore. We arrived at the hotel before 7 in the morning, the front desk staff took us to the second floor club lounge for check in, we were greeted by the staff and get us settled for coffee and breakfast immediately and at the same time preparing our paper for checking in , with in 15 mins there our room was ready. After 2 weeks having european style hotel's service , this is like a home to us , so warm !!!!! When we need more towels , they were there withing 10 mins and house keeping people even called us to make sure the towels arrived.. Such world class service, I can only find it in Asia and nowhere else. ths staff at Intercontinental Singapore did a great job !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Janisadra
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel we have ever stayed in April, 2011. The location is very comfortable from the hotel we can walk to many tourists attractions in some minutes. Our room was large and clean and very quiet we can sleep well after the day. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good with a lot of food to choose. There is one thing we do not like that is price. It is quite expensive but we will come back and stay at here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, exciting”
Reviews.Author: Mykelsapepe
Reviews.Content: My name is Mykel Enweduwa I am a business traveller, but my trip to singapore still remains my most rewarding experience, the Intercontinental hotel, gave a most wonderfull stay. the comfort is world class, my most remarkable experience was with the business center, I was attended to by the most deligent and courteus, staff I think her name was Liana, she was an angel, the food was great and so where the staff, now I want to stay in all intercontinental hotels every country I travel to.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Pooky_TH
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on a stop over and everything was as I expected. The regular deluxe rooms are a bit small and the bathroom's fixtures look very dated. Service was prompt and efficient and I like the pillow menu. Location is good and there a nice semi open mall attached to the hotel with a good selections of mid to low price shops. If you can get a good rate then I recommend this hotel but if the rates are the same as the other 4 or 5 stars property then.........

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SmithsinTaiwan
Reviews.Content: If offered opt for "Up Sell" special. Included breakfast, internet, tea time, and cocktail hour. Totally worth it. We saved a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, a hotel with Style”
Reviews.Author: BigRuss1213
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days on business. Booked a Club room so I had access to club lounge and meeting room. This turned out to be a very popular option as the club lounge was very busy in the evenings. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, even though check in/check out was a little slow. They didn't seem to have enough staff on reception desk. Hotel location is excellent on the edge of the marina district, and close to shopping, transport and a vast array of restaurants. One slight issue was the extra extra heavy doona on the bed, not necessary and not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel + great services = an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Hang10CA
Reviews.Content: From the minute that we arrived to the time of check-out, everything was perfect. Our room has a very comfortable king bedroom with every imaginable amenity.Bathroom was very nice and luxurious. This hotel deserves higher than 5*. The service is impeccable as all staff know the meaning of customer service. The hotel has free Wifi on the first floor around the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed here several times over the last 2 years. I know not to go for the old style rooms, effectively in an annex overlooking the shopping area as the rooms can be cold and uncomfortable I stayed this time with wife, young infant and young child. We booked through Booking.com and paid extra for Breakfast. Check-in process is typically very friendly and efficient... service standards in Asia are so, so much better than in Europe and the USA. Anyway we were told that the booking didnt include breakfast - I thought I'd take it up with Booking.. as I've never experienced this before One of my main gripes is that this hotel seems to get more expensive as each month goes by.. it seems to be twice the price it was 2 years ago, with me typically paying $350-$400 Sing a night.. 2 years ago I was paying $200-$250 Sing a night I stay here because its a pleasant walk of 20 minutes to my office You dont get free internet.. this is disgusting for a hotel this price Breakfasts are expensive but they are great The hotel has an excellent location on Bugis Street so you can check out 100's of cheap restuarants and go for one that doesnt put an automatic service charge on! Rooms are a decent size, beds are very comfortable Staff, especially Robert is very good - he helps you get Taxi's... I simply cannot give this hotel more than 3 stars due to the pricing, breakfast issue with my booking and the fact it doesnt give free internet as standard. I will be looking at alternative hotel choices for my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: tim_phua88
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with friendly staff upon our arrival, check in was smooth and and we were shown to our room by one of the staff. Room is nicely design, very comfy cozy. Excellent bed. i told the staff we were there to celebrate my partner's bday. when we got back to the room in the evening, there is a slice of cake place on the desk with a card wishing my partner's happy birthday! That was so nice of the hotel. The hotel is located just next to a shopping mall. there is a MRT station beneath the mall. Will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location....wish the construction could end soon”
Reviews.Author: hwonder11
Reviews.Content: The room was booked by family members who recommended Intercontinental for its convenience. It's located on the Bugis junction, which is very easy to access to MRT Bugis station, Only one stop away from City Hall station. But you might find too crowded when stepping out the hotel sometimes at the weekend daytime. I particularly like the colonial style decoration of the entire hotel, especially the lobby. From the signage, this hotel is renovating. Unfortunately, I think the hotel is rushing to complete the renovate construction. Therefore, the construction noise starts around 10am, which I think it's acceptable, but I do wish they could end this renovate work as soon as possible. Another pity thing is the room only have internet cable line available, they don't have WIFI available in the room. However, along with more and more sales volume of iPADs and smart phones, which means the WIFI users are increasing. I do hope the hotel can aware this market trend.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Byford1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband 3 times between the end of January to the beginning of March this year. Everything was perfect throughout each stay. Even the Royal Ambassador gift was just perfect for me-the staff had remembered from a previous stay how much I had appreciated the shawl I was given and they ensured that I was given another in a different colour on my next stay, The staff in the Club Lounge were exceptionally friendly, welcoming and helpful. They were professional and attentive without being intrusive. I felt there had been a significant change for the better since our visit in the Spring of 2010. Whilst we were there it was our wedding anniversary. We were unexpectedly given a celebration cake at afternoon tea-it made our day extra special. The hotel is in a good location but its biggest asset has to be the staff. They are exceptional and make up for the slightly dated feel of some areas of the hotel. I can say nothing negative about any of our stays this year and hope to return soon. YD

Reviews.Title: “A four and a half”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night in February 2011 , to top up my miles. The next day I went to stay in my home away from home, the Mandarin Oriental. I found the service excellent all over the hotel and the airport pick up from the gate was very nice. I had a Club room which was ok/ standard, but nothing special. A normal bathroom with a separate shower, maybe a little bit worn out. The Club premises are really nice looking in an old Singapore style as is also the lobby. The food was not really to my best liking, the same applies to the Olive restaurant where I had dinner. I don't mean there was anything really wrong, I'm quite fussy, that's all. I didn't try the pool but I went to check it out. The pool area is small as is the pool as well. So, I only stayed here a while, this is my first impression. I think the hotel is ok value, if you don't want to spend on MO, the Raffles or Shangri-la Valley wing.

Reviews.Title: “seconed stay”
Reviews.Author: bishay
Reviews.Content: sorry the date not right on top cause i was there couple of years ago but i am going again on may everyone was very nice and decent even they upgraded us when they knew i was going with my mum from shop house room to club it was great that is why i decided to stay again there first the hotel very quite not far from Raffles mall less then 10 minutes walking to marina bay mall to arab street almost 15 minutes walking by taxi to orchard road also 10 minutes just u never regret your stay i used to have breakfast at lounge or at the Italian restaurants i think it is called olive tree but we had lunch or dinner at any restaurants at the mall which is connected to the hotel this time when i was replacing my booking they were really helpful and friendly wait for my review when i get back

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: millymm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location. Check in was friendly and efficient, concierge was also helpful and friendly. Room was typical for this sort of hotel, well furnished and clean. Pool area was good, great to have a recharge and refresh on a hot day. Breakfast was very good, not the best but very good. Wifi why are the 5 star hotels still charging? wifi is free in Singapore if you have a local telephone number so come on guys! Would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: TrackFast
Reviews.Content: Checked in 11 March for 2 nights; Club level room. They were unable to offer an upgrade based on my Gold Ambassador status but did offer free internet as an alternative. Club InterContinental is nice but take breakfast in the Olive Restaurant for a better buffet selection. Very friendly staff with the Concierge being very helpful with tips about things worth seeing as well as stuff to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: AliyaA2
Reviews.Content: I would call the hotel - Just OK. Good location, nice rooms, good service, however reception and concierge services are not good enough. We booked king-sized bed room, but they suggested room with two single beds room, as hotel was overbooked, which I found not a reason to be given. Finally theyfound room, but in smoking floor. Was ok anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rado_Daria
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed at this hotel 4 nights. I like the location of the this hotel. It is very convenient for me to go to meetings of my company. Staff here are friendly and caring. I asked a bit about the room change and they agreed to the request immediately. The first time I visited the city to confront themselves and to learn various methods of life on the road. They do not have walkways for pedestrians! In short, I will stay here for business trip next time.

Reviews.Title: “central position, friendly & helpful staff, super clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: debono255060
Reviews.Content: Recently spent one week here, staff make you feel like royalty, housekeeping serviced our room twice per day, to our amazement. Fridge wasnt working, but replaced the same day with much apology. Internet service is pricy at SGD8.20 for 15 mins as is buffet breakfast in restaurant at SGD83 for two. We managed to find less expensive eating places, all nearby,especially breakfast. Apart from this , would definately recommend this motel, most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Corporate hotel in Food Court Mall”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what it used to be...Bugis junction is a downmarket food court w/ clothing shops and the hotel is a bit of a walk from the main shopping areas and certainly not walking distance to the business areas. It is very corporate cookie cutter - and, if the tag line 'living the Intercontinental life' is anything to hold a standard by - this hotel is not exactly up to scratch. The rooms are fine, but a little tired in the decor. the Baths are nice and big, and the shower stall is roomy but in my room the drain smelled and the toilet was broken when I checked in. The pool is small, can't really swim laps and it is cold. The gym is ok - and is nothing to get too excited about. The room service and housekeeping was good - and, the front desk were prompt. A good reliable hotel - but, nothing great. The Olive Tree restaurant buffet is nice for breakfast, but the whole place lacks ambience and is noisy due to the poor fixtures and fitting/furnishings. The huge lobby lounge is usually empty and over-air cond. If you have more work to do in Singpore which means you won't spend time in the hotel - stay here. If you are on holiday - not the best hotel by far to stay in. It is adequate, but not what you would expect of an Interconti.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for Wifi!!”
Reviews.Author: glover
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel in most ways. Since we arrived New Years Eve, it was still beautifully and tastefully decorated for the holidays. Our room was great, bed was super, and we found the location to be really convenient. (Walk out into shopping mall, right there is Starbucks. Downstairs is a food hall and also metro stop. We liked their theme of "we help provide an authentic experience" borne out by their recommendations to us for dinner - Blue Ginger one night, and, when asked to recommend a not terribly expensive Indian restaurant in Little India - Kamala - which was obviously tremendously popular with locals. Our gripe was that we got inconsistent info from staff. We understood a lobby welcomer to tell us that there was free wi-fi in the lobby/lounge on first floor. And in fact we got a password (though with quite a bit of hassle) and used it there for some time. The next day however we found that this was not correct information - that only club members could use it for free. Forgotten what charge was now, but it was rather expensive, as was the breakfast for nonclub members. So we naturally took to going elsewhere. Can't understand why a hotel of this size and calibre and pricepoint would not offer free in room wi fi. It was the only place we stayed in two months in Southeast Asia where this was true.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL - will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: JenNZ12
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel central location. Seriously recommend it although it was pricey it was money well spent. Such an awesome way to start the holiday. Staff were super friendly. Rooms very clean and refurbished . Nice size. Location was the winner. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - esp club lounge”
Reviews.Author: Gordon_Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now. In Dec 2010 and Jan 2011. Both times we had access to the club lounge which is open until 22.30 and offers wi-fi afternoon tea and light dinner in the evening. Also, complimentary drinks from 17.30 til 19.30 (always a bonus considering how expensive drink is in Singapore). the staff are great and all very friendly. Gym is fine and the pool is good and was never too busy. Close to Bugis underground and shops/cinema also very close. The only thing that would improve this would be free wi-fi/internet access in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vikasmohan12
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay in this hotel during one the business meeting in Singapore. The rooms were nice though view from window was not exactly exciting. Staff was very helpful and prompt. I did not get to try much of the dining options but room service was quick and prompt. At the check out I forgot few of my clothes in the room which I was promptly informed of by the hotel. It was simply amazing that hotel kept my items in safe custody for more than a year, till I collected those few weeks back!! I would call this quality service!

Reviews.Title: “Service but need renovate”
Reviews.Author: SLTW
Reviews.Content: Good location, just minutes away from mrt station. Good service, great staff from the club lounge Booked club room and got upgraded to shophouse suite. One of its signature room type overlooking the mall. A bit noisy and wear out. Noted room will be closed down and renovate next month. Will return after.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone deserves to be spoilt sometimes.”
Reviews.Author: Bozz56
Reviews.Content: Check in on the club floor was freindly and efficient. Offered a juice or coffee during this process. Room was spacious, well appointed and spotless. Quality fittings throughout. Pillows and bedding just perfect. This place also has a pillow menu but we didnt require it. Room has full size bath and a separate shower. Cocktail hour, drinks served to your table by freindly and efficient wait staff. Plenty of snacks available. Complimentary High Speed Internet available in lounge but need to pay to use in room. Very quiet in room, no street noise. Concierge very knowledgeable. Excellent location away from Orchard Road but adjoining Bugis which is great for local food and shopping . Keycard worked first time everytime. I wont be looking elsewhere for my next time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “NO Black out curtains and other issues”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl14
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights on the Club floor with two teenagers. Charged for one extra adult but my 13 yr old was considered a child under their policy and no extra charge for him. I think the Club floor check in is not very good though. Although the whole purpose of whisking you up to the Club lounge for check in is to make you feel "special", when we got there, the guy was busy and I was left to stand at his desk and watch whilst he finished some paper work he was doing. No invitation to take a seat or "can I offer you a drink and I will get back to you". It was rather awkward and I stood there with my kids for about 5 minutes before he attended to us. And even then no apology. By then I just decided I might as well sit and sat myself down in front of him uninvited. A bit like waiting at the headmaster's office! When I gave my credit card for the guarantee, their machine would not accept my preferred card and I had to give my alternative card. Later I asked them to double check why the card was not accepted as my bank said there was no record of any attempt to use the card. They reluctantly did so and after a lot of to and fro they realised it was their machine that was at fault and not properly plugged in! Again no apology. Then I found out they had put my entire 6 days charge on hold on my other card so now that I wanted to use my preferred card, I had the full charge X 2 on hold. They said the first hold will reverse when I checked out and may take up to 2 weeks for that to happen! Essentially that means that cuts into my credit limit and fortunately that did not adversely impact me, but if my limit was smaller or if I am potentially going to incur further credit charges during my travel, I may find that I have max-ed out my cards! I insisted they reverse the hold on my card immediately and it was returned to my credit available after 4 days. The rooms themselves are spacious and beds comfortable but there are no black out curtains and with the Ilumo building across the road having flashing lights on its facade, my room at night somewhat resembled a night club! Only thing to do was to close my eyes. Fortunately I am not epileptic and not too good if you are recovering from jet lag! Local calls are charged at some ridiculous rate of 50 cents a minute and I had to call the lounge to find out the rates as it was not displayed in any of the room information. Food at the lounge (breakfast, afternnon tea and canapes) was above average and the staff friendly. Free flow of soft drinks, coffee, tea. Cannot comment on the alcohol as I did not drink there. Ambience in the lounge was also very pleasant. Two computers available with microphone and web cam for skype which I would say is something different from other hotels and very welcomed by us as we could skype home. Location near MRT station and a lot of food option is definitely a plus for this hotel. Overall good value for a Club room in Singapore which is incredibly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: tholland55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very central location being close to an MRT station and surrounded by shops. The staff appear very well trained and go out of their way to be friendly and provide a very personal service. The Club Lounge is very good and again the staff are very attentive and look after every need. The food and cocktails provided were of a high standard and they were always topped up or renewed as required. The room we stayed in was spacious and fully featured although the bathroom could do with some modernisation as many of the tiles were starting to crack and the ceiling was looking a little worse for wear. I suspect the bathrooms will be updated soon. The room had a lovely colonial feel and the TV and air conditioning worked well. My only criticism of the hotel is that they need to have free internet in the Club rooms as most hotels of this standard now provide this. The internet in the club lounge and lobby work well but for a business traveler the internet in your room is almost a necessity.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: dalandan_soda
Reviews.Content: Great location, it is connected to the Bugis Junction, Bugis MTR, just across is the Iluma Mall, and Bugis street market. It is also near City Hall and Chinatown. Yet Con Hainanese Chicken is 5 mins walk away. All the staff were very courteous. The room was spacious, large bathroom with separate shower and batch tub.. We stayed in a Deluxe room, King bed. plenty of space for my kid to run around. The Hotel is secure, you need your room card to select the elevator floor.

Reviews.Title: “we almost felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: lala_cybele
Reviews.Content: from the moment we stepped out of the taxi, they welcomed us with genuine smiles and fast assistance with our luggage. I have never experience this treatment to other hotels. Honestly I worked and stayed in a 5 star hotel before, and this property is unrelenting to that one and any other. For their fast service and courteous staff, we felt like family...almost like royalty. We salute the Whole IC Singapore team. Special thanks to Ivan from front desk. The engineering staff( they did a fast response although there was not really a problem in the room, we were just not aware of the master switch. haha). Three gentlemen from the concierge( I can remember Jonrex name.) Again thank you so much for making our stay hassle-free. Such a wonderful hotel and location. Your best asset is your staff! We will surely be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare turned to perfect thanks to staff”
Reviews.Author: PatriceVietnam
Reviews.Content: My family and I were on our way to Bali for the lunar New Year celebrations. We were supposed to stay at Intercontinental Bali resort but at the last minute, our KLM flight to Bali was cancelled with no further notice of when we would be able to take off. This cancellation was due to a volcano eruption that left ashes around the Denpasar area which prevented planes from landing (at least from Singapore). We therefore decided to sleep at Intercontinental Singapore and hope they would be able to arrange something. Upon arrival, I was greeted with the usual courtesy of Intercontinental staff (very good) and proceeded to the check-in counter where I would explain the situation. The staff were absolutely fantastic! First, I was able to get a room at a much lower rate than the walk-in rate (I had no reservation). Second, the Singapore staff undertook all communications with the Bali people to make modifications to the reservations, without any penalties whatsoever. This shows great customer service from the Singapore staff. Thanks a lot guys! Being an ambassador member that systematically stays at Intercontinental on all my business trips, I have become used to this high level of service. But on the other hand, I chose to stay at Intercontinental because of that high level of service. To make a long story short, I needed to book new flights to Bali which changed our original and newly modified travel dates. Until the end of our stay in Singapore, the staff was instrumental in providing piece of mind to my family and I. Conversations were being held behind the scenes with hotels in other countries and the conclusion was always favorable. Again, great job! The hotel in itself is a very classy building that is right down town. It is linked to Bugis Junction shopping mall that offers a wide variety of options, although not the high end boutiques. Normal shopping if you want. Rooms are spacious enough and well appointed. We were upgraded to a Shop house room which offers a more "old style" decor. Not my cup of tea as I prefer more modern facilities but the hotel also has more recently furnished rooms. Club facilities are very well setup and the service was above what I have seen in previous Intercontinental hotels. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxury getaway with piece of mind in case something goes against plan.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: ThomasJonathan
Reviews.Content: Arrival - smooth!! Check in - smooth!! Room - spacious!! Staff - very friendly!! There is just nothing to say about this hotel. Everything was no hazzle to anyone. We didnt want to leave the hotel. The club lounge was a gem. Such friendly staff! The breakfast buffet was lovely and they served different dishes everyday, same with the evening canapes. The location of the hotel is brilliant. Everything is within walking distance. We'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “good but not a five star service”
Reviews.Author: kd2011
Reviews.Content: Located near the singapore famous Bugis street, the hotel has an amazing location. Somehow I felt , being a five star they need to upgrade themselves in terms of services provided i.e I pod dock, a big screen LCD, the interconnecting rooms are too noisy & and not noise proof. Our only meal in the hotel was not posted to our room, we asked for a taxi in the wee hours of the morning, not aware of the fact that we will be charged waiting charges. We had a wake up call a 2 am, the bell desk would have been proactive & intimitated us that our car has come. When I called to check a 4 am, he informed that car is waiting since half an hour. Then I confirmed that i hope we are not being charged for waiting, he confirmed that No, its only 5 dollars for booking taxi. I was ripped off when i paid 80 dollars when i reached airport.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: YUKITANA
Reviews.Content: 1) No door service in front of the hotel even though a door man is there. they have a chat themselves. 2) No guide to the table at breakfast time because few staffs are there. We was waiting a long time to sit at the table. 3) We did not use the mini-bar but we were charged the mini-bar fare when check out. 4) Sluggish drainage in our room so it takes 5 minutes to discharge water.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel, fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: KJHNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at this wonderful hotel. True 5 star luxury and service, including a 'pillow menu'. We upgraded to the Club Intercontinental, which I would recommend. There is a lovely pool and a good fitness centre. The service from the friendly staff could not be faulted. Great location at Bugis Junction with short walk through mall to train station. Easy access to all parts of city by either train, taxi or walking. Ok, it's not cheap. But as an occasional treat it is pure luxury that I couldn't fault. For luxury and service this is the finest hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzieKY
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the IC, using the club floor. On arrival the room allocation was not what I had requested, and even though they were full they managed to swap our rooms. The Club lounge was very nice, good breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktail hour. The staff in the club lounge were generally slow, although the manager in there was excellent and took charge. In the main part of the hotel, there are a lot of staff just walking around trying to assist you! Not a great place for families, not that they pretend to be, this is a business hotel through and through. Having said that they were able to organise babysitting and they do have a kid's menu. The pool was a good size and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars hotel with beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: DeltaAT
Reviews.Content: Every time we go to Singapore, we always stay at Intercontinental. My 5 years old son loves the restaurant, Olive Tree. We like the room. It's quite spacious to add a roll away bed for my son. My son loves taking MRT and the Bugis MRT Station is just right there. And my son loves to go to the National Library that is just across the street. So it's perfect. In early Dec 2010 we stayed at Intercontinental again with another family to watch Walking with Dinosaurs show. As usual we were happy with the service. Good breakfast. We were upgraded to the more antique room. It was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for a better start to our holiday travels”
Reviews.Author: dynamic-hoteliers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long flight from the UK, and were quickly checked into the room. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the room was so high up so there was no noise from traffic. Being above Bugis Junction, and all the food outlets there, we did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on that. The room was spacious, a very comfortable bed, and exceptionally large en suite which we were very impressed with. I do take the point made in an earlier review, that you do have to watch you dont trip over a couple of door frames, however, a minor point. The shower was very hot, which I enjoy, and although we had an initial problem with hot water in the taps, it was soon remedied. The concierge service was excellent, extremely helpful, and when approaching them to ask about internet bookings of our onward flight, the concierge spent a fair amount of time helping me to prebook online, to the point of telephoning the airline in sydney to check the booking. The concierge booked us into Raffles for afternoon tea on the afternoon of our last day, and we had the use of the Health Suite to freshen up before leaving in the evening for our onward flight to Australia. All provided with as much help that we needed, and no fuss. A great plus. The only downside, and a small quible, was that there is a speaker system in the bathroom, wired to the television. On arrival, we had sound in the bathroom, and not on the television, and it took a while to sort it out. Methinks the chambermaid may have had her favourite music channel on whilst cleaning the ensuite. I would suggest that the hotel puts some sort of note in the room with directions of how to use the television, and remote controls. Having said that, and after a five week trip and five different international hotels I would always loot to the Intercontinental for accomodation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel, with a hint of an old-world feel.”
