Reviews.Author: nick164
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Exceptionally good hotel-arranged airport transfers, having been collected immediately upon disembarking the aircraft, transported in a buggy to the VIP terminal, cleared immigration with no queue and after a short wait in lounge (with access to complimentary refreshments), whilst they retrieved the luggage, was escorted to the car. Upon arrival at the hotel I was escorted to my room to complete check-in. I'd highly recommend this for a hassle-free arrival (at the time of my stay it was $150 SGD for a Mercedes E-Class). - The club suite was a good size, and well appointed - with separate lounge and dining area - and located on one of the highest floors of the hotel. - The Club InterContinental lounge was spacious and tastefully decorated with an old-world yet modern feel. - Excellent check-out service: request to leave luggage (as I was returning to the hotel 3 days later for another night's stay) was happily fulfilled. Upon indicating I was taking the MRT the bellman asked if I knew the way, to which I replied no, and was then escorted by him on the 5 minute walk. Cons: - As a hotel brand which aims to distinguish based on their exceptional level of concierge services, I was completely underwhelmed by my experience. With only one concierge on duty and already dealing with a guest, after a few minutes waiting I was briefly asked my enquiry (checking availability for an airport transfer), and asked to take a seat and the staff member would make a call upon dealing with the guest. It took another 10 minutes for them to complete dealing with one guest, and then proceeded to SMS with their phone and tidy their desk. It took my return to the desk and prompting for their to remember my enquiry - hardly a 5-star service. - Whilst the room was well appointed, a few aspects of it were showing small signs of wear - e.g. the bath was marked, white/cream doors had a slight unclean appearance/in-need-of-repainting including the entry door, brass handles worn. This is however a minor criticism. In summary, a very good hotel in a good location close to Bugis MRT - and, with one exception, a very high level of service. Postscript: My subsequent stay a week later was also good. However, I was less impressed by the Shophouse Room. As an Ambassador member this entitles a room upgrade - on the first occasion being from a Club Deluxe King to a Club Premier King, however on the second to a Shophouse Room. It was tastefully decorated with old-world charm however had a non-existent outlook (see photos). I personally do not believe it's worthy of being classed as a superior room merely due to its location in the hotel - given the size is comparable to the Deluxe room, and lacks a view/natural light. Aside from this, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnmason211
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel that I ever stayed. Everything was great from service until people. We are really enjoyed.Will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for four nights in December. We got a great rate for a basic room by pre-paying online. The hotel itself is excellent. Our room was clean and spacious, quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. We didn't eat at the hotel very much, as there are many other food choices nearby, but we had several excellent drinks in the lobby bar - best lychee martini I've ever had. I highly recommend this hotel for both its quality and location. It served as a great base for exploring Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good location - good management”
Reviews.Author: safetycrew
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in great spot - walk to Raffles City - Chijmes - Bugis etc. MRT on doorstep - as is Bugis Mall - pleanty food and shopping nearby. Healh Club was good - pool popular. I stayed for 5 weeks over Xmas and NY - staff very friendly. Very clean / modern / yet classic. Pay extra and join Club - it is worthwhile tranqility - free booze and FAST internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Rata30
Reviews.Content: My family had a 4 day stay here and it was a pleasure.We arrived on a late night flight after a long day and our arrival was hassle free. The rooms were spotless and the bed was a delight to sleep in. The staff at this hotel can not do enough for you and their service is outstanding. The location of the hotel is just around the corner from Raffles and the shopping complex of Orchard Road is only a $5 taxi ride away.The Hippo tour buses have stops outside Raffles and also on Victoria Street. We found these a good way to get our bearings on the attractions but the underground service is also very good. Internet access was a bit expensive at the hotel but there is a very good internet cafe opposite Raffles. Singapore has a WiFi free network available in hotspots but you must obtain a Userid and it is probably easiest to do this on arrival at the airport from Information. I enjoyed Singapore and this was due in no small part to staying at the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Talisker1227
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre and 3 nights post our Asian Cruise on board Superstar Virgo. The hotel is strategically located. Check-in was pretty smooth. Rooms were spotless. The pillow menu was just awesome. I loved the pillows i requested. It was my aunt's birthday and when i told the frontdesk staff they surprised my aunt with a bottle of wine and cake. Overall, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alvarezgranda
Reviews.Content: There's nothing bad to be said about this hotel as it has all you can expect from a 5 star hotel. The rooms are very big and clean. The bathrooms have both a shower and a bath. However you have to be careful while showering as the water filters underneath the door and the floor gets flooded all the time. There aren't any hooks to hung the towels on the sink or near it so you have to leave them on the bedroom. Those are the only 2 reasons why I won't give it 5 stars as I don't find it functional at all. The location is very good as you can walk everywhere or to take the tube 5 mins away walking. The swimming pool is very clean and great to relax after sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: fitzfloyd
Reviews.Content: We arrived early one morning after an long, overnight plane journey. We were feeling extremely tired and jaded, and it was wonderful to be met by courteous staff at the InterContinental who arranged access to our room immediately. Our room was beautifully furnished and, most importantly, very quiet. The bed linen was crisp and of lovely quality. The lobby area is extensive and has some exquisite and interesting pieces of furniture. Our breakfast was one of the best we had on our entire journey and I was delighted by the quality of the double shot cafe late. I highly recommend this hotel - it deserves its impressive rating on TripAdvisor. I would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great service that goes the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: mtan8349
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for business and on my first night I lost my iphone in a cab. I hadn't planned on mentioning it to the staff but when the receptionist noticed I was upset I told him I had just lost my phone earlier that day. He was very apologetic (not that it was his fault at all) and asked me if I had caught the cab from the hotel. When I said yes, he told me to give all the details of the cab (pick up time, cab colour etc.) to the concierge to look up the CCTV footage. Thankfully, Eugene (the concierge) was very happy to assist even though he said my chances of getting it back were pretty slim (which is what I thought too). To my surprise and his, Eugene had managed to track down my iphone!! I had to pick it up from the Singapore police lost & found and the hotel graciously offered to send someone to collect it for me. I thought that was really above and beyond their job so when I said I would collect it, Eugene even printed me a map of the address to give to the cab driver. All in all a wonderful stay. The service was the highlight for me but the rooms were also very clean and spacious, great pool and delicious food to top it off. My only issue would be that they don't provide free wi-fi in the rooms or free internet access in the business centre, besides that it was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Mim74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights at the end of November and was very impressed by the location, the hotel was just along from Bugis MRT so it was easy to get around, Singapore is quite compact anyway so even without the MRT you can walk around easily. I arrived late, just before midnight and stil managed to find a hawker market just along the street which was still open, very good value food and drink. I was in a club room which meant that afternoon tea, evening cocktails and breakfast are included, all very nice and plentiful, the lounge gets very busy weekday mornings though and the service wasn't so good on the monday morning. I didn't experience the restaurants in the hotel but the lobby lounge was very nice for a drink. I will stay again when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, this is what 5 star should be”
Reviews.Author: trvl_addiction
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was amazing from start to finish. We came for our 1 year anniversary and wished we had spent our honeymoon here. Staff we polite and ever-attentive. Rooms were beautiful, very tastefully decorated with a lovely balance of moderness and traditional Peranakan style. All the common areas were stunning, including lobby, reception and club rooms. Club access was worth every penny, includes breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails with beautiful food. My husband would have happily spent the 4 days in the club area! The thing which set this hotel apart was the service, which was personal and professional. On our honeymoon we had spent a few days at the Fullerton hotel which was much pricier and was very impersonal as well as a bit dated. We will definitely be returning to intercon. Another plus was the position, above Bugis mrt and shopping so very handy for shops and access to Orchard rd.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for this part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Beachbilly
Reviews.Content: We agree with rating this hotel relatively highly in Singapore. Definitely go for the Club level option if it works for you. The club lounge is attractive and it is a great oasis for food and drink throughout the day. The direct connection to Bugis Mall is very handy especially if you don't do club level -- you can walk through the covered arcade to McDonald's for egg sandwich and Starbucks for coffee or take the escalator to the food court for Japanese breakfast breads.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Center”
Reviews.Author: pereira963
Reviews.Content: This business center does more than just typing, faxing, etc. Can be asked to do do other tasks too like to do a search on product, company and so on. The crews are very helpful and freindly. Been coming for more than a year now, it is my secretary now. Thank you business center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kuttan1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights Nov. 2010 excellent hotel but little bit pricey. Clean, Child friendly and club lounge fine. Compared to IC HK it is far better. Will recommend to any type of traveller as the location is near to MTR Bugis Junction walkable distance 10 minutes all the way to MTR it is covered so no direct sun or rain. Room was excellent and neat stayed in deluxe room, but breakfast not that much attractive and the staff seems not that much cooperative, rest perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LumexG87
Reviews.Content: I stayed the first time at the Intercontinental this End of Oct and it was like my best stay in a Hotel ever. About a 20min drive away from Changi Airport this Hotel is right next to the Bugis Shopping Mall / Bugis MRT Station. Check - In was fast - as of the Gold Ambassor Status we got a free Room Upgrade from Shophouse to Premier Room. Located on the 12 Floor we had an huge Room with a great View ! Room Service was great, they even changed all the used Towels every Day and came twice a Day. Once in the Morning and once in the evening to make our beds again for the night ! The Pool Area seems small, but actually over our Stay of 9 Days not really that much People used it. Great for relaxing and you can even see the Marina Bay Resort while ur in the Pool ! We didn`t use the Restaurants in the Hotel so i cannot tell something about that. They are so many little Restaurants around the Hotel - theres even a Food Junction at Bugis Mall so we ate there for less money. Bugis MRT is just a 3min walk away from the Hotel - you can be fast everywhere you want to be. Orchr Road is like 15min away with MRT - you need to change at City Hall to the other MRT. Singapore is just so nice - its the nicest and cleanest city i have ever seen. There is even so much to see that 9 Days was even not enough. Going to the Beach at Sentosa, going shopping in one of the Malls or seeing the beautiful gardens like chinese or japanese. There is so much to see and enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful luxury”
Reviews.Author: SusanManlyNSW
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel superb in almost every way. check in was efficient although we arrived early we were immediately shown to a room. I had requested no feather bedding so beds were stripped and remade without any fuss.The room was spacious and well equipped as was the bathroom. We particularly liked the lobby for drinks and compared it to Peninsular in Hong Kong for the feeling of space and luxury. The only downside was the restaurant- food was ordinary. there was a shopping centre next to hotel with other dining options. The concierge service was most professional and helpful in giving us ideas on transport and places to visit. My husband wanted a hair cut and he was escorted to what was the best $10 deal. The pool looked excellent but because we hit the pollution from fires in Indonesia outdoors was not a good option. We plan to use hotel again for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cinroundTW
Reviews.Content: If you plan to visit Singapore, this hotel is the place to stay. It is nice and rooms, even if not brand new, are large and comfortable. Get a drink or tea at the bar in the lobby (at night, with music from the piano). Service is nice and the staff very polite and eager to assist. The location is nice: you can walk around and find nice restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer...”
Reviews.Author: MrsMacNT
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the Intercontinental Hotel Singapore in July for a night on our way to Thailand. This was our first stay here. We travelled with our 3 kids, aged 14, 13 and 7. We wanted to publically thank staff at the Intercontinental for the high standard of service and accommodation provided to us. We quite honestly could not fault this hotel, its staff or the service at all. In fact we have nothing but the highest of praise for our whole experience. We were made to feel very welcome and were completely looked after from our first contact with the staff upon booking our rooms. We all had the best night sleep we’d had in a while, the beds and pillows were very comfortable – I wish we had the same at home!! The rooms were comfortable, big enough and very clean. The food was also great, breakfast had everything you could want! Room service was nice, and promptly delivered. The location was great also – nice and central for where we wanted to go the next day - the MRT is right there! All staff looked after us wonderfully and were very pleasant, courteous and professional throughout our whole stay, from the porter’s who greeted us upon arrival and saw us off, the reception staff, the maids, the restaurant staff, the concierge and the man who greeted us and showed us the way to breakfast up to the management staff of the hotel! It was certainly service with a smile all round! Our children were also welcomed nicely. And, to absolutely top the whole experience off the management of the Intercontinental went out of their way to make our youngest son’s birthday a day to remember. Our son turned 7 on the day we travelled to Singapore and stayed at the Intercontinental. The hotel knew this, and upon arrival he was treated to a lovely surprise – when we went up to our room, staff were in there with balloons and an absolutely delicious personalised birthday cake they had made especially for him, a birthday card and a wee gift of yummy biscuits and we all sang happy birthday to him. You couldn’t wipe the smile off his face for the next couple of days – he felt very special!! It was a wonderful end to a busy day for us all!! We all loved our stay here, the kids talked about it for quite a while after. We all wanted to stay for longer, and wished we could have! Then we could have also used the facilities it offers, like the pool, gym and lounge areas. The only one suggestion we would have to add to this 5 star hotel experience is for the hotel to have plunger coffee available for guests in the rooms. We are actually going back for a 3 night stay in mid November and are really looking forward to it!!! We are sure our next experience will be just as satisfying  Andrea & Gordon

Reviews.Title: “Not anymore my favorite in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Dinha_et_Erick
Reviews.Content: During the past 4 years, this is where my wife and I went when visiting Singapore. And we were quite happy with it. The service was good and efficient. The rooms are more than satisfying in terms of size and comfort, even if on the old side. Last time we have been there, we have tried one the “shophouse” rooms. The room is bigger and some may appreciate that. But they are situated on the second or third floor of the “Bugis junction mall”. Therefore the you cannot open the curtain, otherwise the office or shops or whatever is in the opposite building will see everything happening in your room. But, because of this, and the fact that the opposite building is quite near, it is very dark in the room. Ok, we do not spend much time in the room, but, at least , when I wake up, I like to have some daylight in my room. In addition, we found the room too cold and, because no sun ray can reach the room, it is almost impossible to warm up, even if you switch off the air-con. So last time I have decided that I will not take this kind of room anymore. Since several weeks, even months, each time I try to book a room, they first propose the shophouse room. I guess it is because, they have some difficulty to sell them that they offer now a better price for this kind of room whereas, several months ago they were more expensive. Anyway, since I certainly do not want to be in the “shophouse” part anymore, I realized that the prices they offered now for the “deluxe” room is much higher than before. So I have began to compare with some other hotel like Hilton or Swissotel or Mandarin. And guess what, for at least the same level of service, you can find much better prices. And during the past few months the service in the Intercontinental has seen its quality of service has declined. I must add that their gym is quite small, even if the equipment are of good quality, there are not enough machine to satisfy you. Otherwise, the location is good, you are walking distance from Chinatown, Little India, Singapore Flyer and even Orchard road. It is on top of MRT. Erick

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic. Superb service...”
Reviews.Author: majoreaguemental
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic. Superb service ,food and location. The best bed we have ever slept in. I want it !! Fab location for shopping ,views and eating. We will return !!

Reviews.Title: “Always a memorable stay, all requests accomodated with a BIG SMILE”
Reviews.Author: WeeOon
Reviews.Content: Club facility Excellent and Service Faultless! Nice variety of drinks and food served throughout the day. Have stayed in many Club Lounges/Levels world wide and the Intercontinental Spore's Club Facility is top 3. Food and Service makes up 50% the other 50% is ambience and decor....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Singapore Grand Prix, clean rooms, wonderful service from hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Prashan
Reviews.Content: Stayed over 4 days during the recent Singapore Grand Prix. Was somewhat apprehensive about paying for a standard room but was given a room on the high floors, facing Bugis junction shops. Room was spacious, clean, had a Bose Wave radio, Elemis toiletries. Staff were courteous and always on hand to help - especially good considering how busy the hotel was during the F1 weekend. Nice to see some top end Porsche's on display during the race weekend as the Porsche Cup team were also staying here..will definitely return for next years Grand Prix.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Lynch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and our young disabled nephew. Staff couldn't have done more for us. The hotel was wonderfully accessible for the wheelchair, all entrances and exits. Staff got taxis for us and sorted out the wheelchair. The concierge even got us a bicycle pump when we needed it to pump up tyres! We went back again and would return on any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Bugis Street”
Reviews.Author: boboakville
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, despite the price. Unfortunately, it was Formula 1 weekend in Singapore and the room rates seemed to have doubled. The location and quality are what you'd expect from this hotel. The room, beds and facilities are second to noen. It was a very quite room - staff were up to the usual great standard. I do object being charged for internet access. It's better to head out to Bugis Street and grab the readily available Singapore WiFi internet.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJB
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive, the Intercon shows its true colours - brilliant, attentive service, wonderful rooms and facilities (24 hour fully equiped gym is a real plus when you're another time zone), close to shopping, resturants, culture centres, MTR -what more could you want? If you can, upgrade to a "Club Room" you get free internet and access to the lounge with free cocktails and drinks in the evening - given the price of alcohol in Singapore, this is priceless! They will also press your shirts for free - fantastic after a long flight. As is the swmming pool - well worth unwinding there too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near all the malls, foodcourts and shopping areas. Large spacious rooms allow for enough of space (often lacking in hotel rooms). The staff were friendly and courteous. Breakfast was good. Overall a fabulous experience

Reviews.Title: “Singapore's Best”
Reviews.Author: TJACB
Reviews.Content: The hotel facade is very 'old style' Singapore - magnificent - not some generic concrete box. The foyer and lobby areas a also stunning...this leads to concern that the rest of the experience will be a let down. Not so!! We had interconnecting Club King and Twin rooms. These were well appointed with everything you could possibly need. It is a true 5 star hotel and the staff and service support this. The executive club is simply one of the best I have encountered...it makes the Grand Hyatt Singapore's look like a shoebox. It is huge, with the interior design done in the Peranakan style. Great breakfast buffet with eggs/pancakes etc made to order, afternoon tea and drinks and nibbles in the evening. The hotel is in a fantastic position - you can walk out a door straight into the Bugis Shopping Village (my teenagers loved this). There is also a Cold Storage supermarket, food hall and MRT Station in the complex. Bugis Street market is across the road (lots of cheap pap). Raffles is just up the road for the obligatory Singapore Sling. Raffles City shopping centre has some very upmarket stores and another great foodhall. I highly recommend this hotel. It is the only place we stay in Singapore. PS the only problem I have is the cost of the internet.. We ended up using the free wifi in the Executive Club.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: LNK38
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay with our young children. The staff were all exceptional, very professional and friendly. Hotel location couldn't be better, right next to the mall, restaurants and food courts etc and minutes away from all major attractions. Room was very good, well serviced and spacious even for family of four. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel...would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: KMcCulloch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband (who was out here on business) and my 14 month old son. Although the hotel is ideal for the business traveller, it was absolutely fine for us as a family. The hotel is elegant and professional and run with efficiency. We stayed in a standard room and with the cot in there was still plenty of space. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was also fine. All the staff are very attentive and greet you which is nice. I found Fahid and Robert (taxis) very friendly and helpful. Even the housekeeping/cleaning staff were very nice. Th location of the hotel is very good. You can access the Bugis junction and Bugis village shops/restaurants/cafes from one of the hotel exits which was great and there is a 7 eleven just outside the hotel. Also on many of the side streets outside the hotel are more eateries which many locals seem to use. We ate in one of these during our last evening. In terms of facilities, I'm not sure why Internet is not free or at least free for a few hours here. There is a good gym and I used the pool and took my son into the children's pool. Ideally, I would say that this pool suits kids from the age of 3/4 upwards and is simply a paddling pool, not a swimming pool. Kids are not allowed in the other pool, which is a swimming pool! The pool area does need modernising, but it is still fine and usable. We used the Club lounge for afternoon tea and breakfast and did not find this as child friendly (no high chairs) as the main restaurant and the choice/selection is poor for what you can get in the rest of the hotel (I didnt see the point of the expensive club lounge!). Breakfast was excellent in the main restaurant and they had a high chair for our son and it was very light and airy. In terms of baby friendly things to do in Singapore, I had 3 days and I took my son to the zoo which was superb. Great value for money and the best zoo I've been to in the world. It is located in the tropical rainforest. We took a boat trip at the zoo and if you have young children there is a kids play area/park there too. You have to pay for the rides and animal feeding. We also went to the Jurong Bird park which was also pleasant. There is a tram which goes through the treetops and its worth doing a ride on that. We found the underwaterworld/aquarium on Sentosa Island very disappointing. It's the smallest aquarium I've been to in the world!! We covered the aquarium in 10 minutes and it is not wheelchair/pushchair/stroller/pram friendly (in common with many parts of Singapore - if you are in a wheelchair dont come here!). A few times I had to carry my pram in one hand and baby in the other to go up and down stairs. Apart from sharks and some of the bigger fish I thought that Singapore zoo had just as much fish and water life. The only saving grace factor that the underwater world has are the pink dolphins and if you want to visit, time your visit with the dolphin shows otherwise you'll be disappointed. Overall, we enjoyed our time in Singapore and it was helped by a very comfortable stay at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “A really posh hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ismail77
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Room Fantastic. Bathroom great! The breakfast amazing - pancakes with chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby right now - 3 Star at best”
Reviews.Author: JayODHK
Reviews.Content: Shop House wing - 3rd floor apparently a renovation of this wing is in the works but they should hurry up & get on with it because, although the bones are there for a good hotel, 5 Star rates are just not merited right now room needed a painting & you will want to wear your slippers in the shower air conditioner condenser in the foyer ceiling made an "arcing" sound every 30 seconds all night which sounded just like someone trying to get into your room - definitely good for at least 10 startled wake ups a night long, long winding walk to your room (up the elevator, through the pass card key doors, down a long hall, around a corner, down steps, around another corner, over the footbridge between buildings, around yet another corner - I kid you not) - if it was not "low crime does not mean no crime" Singapore you might be a little afraid but instead it just feels lonely & desolate - not quite The Shining, but close - couldn't even try the pool because my beautiful but modest wife would never take that walk in her swim cover-up (nor should she have to) Might try again after a reno & a reconfiguration but not before

Reviews.Title: “A repeat visit we have been before”
Reviews.Author: walkingWakefieldUk
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely helpful, the breakfast and buffet dinner ( especially the shell fish section) are really good. We like the location, because it is in a slightly quieter area, but near the metro, so all places including the airport are easily accessed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ehles
Reviews.Content: A great value-for-money hotel for location, comfort, attention and a sense of Singapore style. We arrived on an early morning long-haul flight and were immediately assigned a temporary room so we could have a shower and nap. Our room had everything we needed and the luxurious beds/linen helped ease our jet-lag. Staff, without exception, were friendly and helpful at all times. Being so close to the MRT made getting about easy and quick. Will definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby. Generous staff. Excellent sleeping quality.”
Reviews.Author: happyvaio
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby is very beautiful, very elegant. I watched newspaper there everyday after breakfast. The designer for the lobby obviously has a very good eyes. The blending of color and the light, the space, with fountain outside. I wonder whether the designer has taken fen-shei into consideration. The breakfast restaurant has a rooftop that allows natural sunlight to come in. What a nice start for a day! I came with my sister whose company has a rate that include Internet connection. But the rip off of Internet from previous review is suspicious. Singapore has free wi-fi in most places, so even you don't use hotel Internet, you probably can still use another wi-fi connection for free. This is my personal guess. I do suggest that the hotel simply offer free Internet to everyone this will solve the concern. Very nice sleeping quality. plus a big breakfast in a nice restaurant. very pleasant stay. Location is near everywhere. Walking distance to Suntec, mall and subway is next door. I gave it a four star because I like a waterfront property. I don't think it is necessary to live in the middle of malls in Orchard road area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms - Great Location - Nice Service -”
Reviews.Author: bhagwan69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights / 5 days. US $'s 300/- per night [a bit steep - I think] Location is good. Rooms are super - a bit old [on the bathroom front] The 'look' of the Hotel, I really loved. The B-Fast was nice & fresh, but the 'same' was there everyday. No change. The only drawback is the 'concierge' service. Below par, they have no idea about Singapore. Poor suggestions & each time a direction is asked, the standard answer is take a cab..... This area needs to be worked on. Overall staff is good. Well behaved & well dressed also well appointed... I would recommend a stay here, if one could get a room @ US $'s 200/- per night. Other option id Hotel Naumi & new Carlton. Nice locations & newer properties. All the Best ! MBJ

Reviews.Title: “Awesome....at that price it better be!”
Reviews.Author: sarandan98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is awesome. It is luxury. I can't say enough about the breakfast that was included with the room price! WOW! Great food. The only thing I didn't like was that the Chinese Restaurant in the hotel closes for a few hourse between lunch and dinner. That was inconvenient. Staff was helpful, rooms were large and clean, food was good. What more can you ask for? The hotel is a little far from Orchard Road, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Staff incapable of telling the truth; Internet a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Melb_tourist
Reviews.Content: Staff incapable of telling the truth.... Despite booking and paying 6 months in advanced, we were bumped to a different room type. The check in staff member gave the expanation that the hotel was full and they were doing us a favour given we were checking in early (11.30am). When we said we would wait for our room, they said there wouldn't be one available so no point waiting. They provided no options for a late check out 2 days later (we were happy to pay extra) but they then went into sales mode to get us to buy club lounge access Later that night enquired about getting the room we booked. Transferred to a room that became free. The 5th floor and our room had ioniser machines going. When we asked why, they refused to explain. Discovered next day as we got paint fumes from room next door as it was being refurbished Porter damaged suitcase on arrival and said nothing Internet a rip off - cost SG$13.50 for 15mins and 3 page printout Overall not a pleasant stay given we couldn't get a straight answer from staff and felt hotel only interested in maximising revenue by managing capacity utilisation and add on charges such as internet and club lounge. A hotel is your home away from home and this hotel did not feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5*”
Reviews.Author: Gifu
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, I was looking forward to staying here since our 2 previous experiences had been pretty good. We checked in @ 2am and they said the hotel was 100% full and gave us a smoking room. I can stand the smell of smoke, but they told us the room would not be smokey but the hall will be. As it turned out, the room smelled like smoke and the hallway was even worse. I went down to ask for a room change but to no avail. I knew they had more rooms since the guy who just checked in got a room. Funny, I paid for my room months ago and asked for a non-smoking room. How could they just overbook and think it is ok to stick me in any room. Not something I expect from a high end chain. What's the point of booking and paying good money in full if it's just a loose reservation? I wouldn't stay here again. I couldn't sleep all night. We got a new room the next day. The room had seen better days, but the bed was comfy. It was in worser conditions than the other Intercontinentals of other cities. No free wifi, but free newspaper. Curtains can't block any light, so you're forced to wake up at sunrise. So if you can't sleep with light, book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay as Fabulous as 1st Time”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokexpat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinenal in October 2009 and gave it a rave review. I returned for four additional night in June 2010 and found the hotel as fabulous as before. This time, however, I was able to leave the hotel and explore and neighborhood. I liked the mall that is attached to the hotel and ate and shopped there daily. The mall houses an MRT stop, so I could get to the hotel from the MRT without going outside, which was handy when it rained. I liked the 7/11 directly across the street. The InterContinental's Internet charges are outrageous, but there is an excellent Internet cafe in the next block. This is a fabulous hotel in every respect. I will return again this year for a 3rd time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the Intercontinental and while it was Ok, I'm sure it could be better. For starters, i have yet to be given a room above the 5th floor. I dont know if it is the rate I paid that only gets me a room on a low floor, this time, I paid the most, S$224 and only got a room on the 3rd floor. The room itself was ok, spacious and the bathroom was spacious. There was an annoying sound from the floor above, but I put up with it. I dont know if I'll be staying at this hotel again, since I know when I stay at other hotels in Singapore, I can get a room on a higher floor without asking, but yet this hotel keeps putting me on a low floor. I got an email a few days before my arrival, saying they were looking forward to my stay and would have a room ready for me. I thought that would meant that would prepare a good room for me, certainly not a room on the same level as the gym and meeting rooms. I don't think I'll be staying here again or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ML1984xx
Reviews.Content: We were truly impressed with the impeccable service that the hotel provided. We opted for the hotel to pick us up at the airport. To our amazement, an airport staff was already waiting for us at the gate with a sign and a golf cart to take us to a private area. We were whisked away to a secluded area for immigration clearance, and then offered coffee, tea, and/or snacks. We waited for a few minutes until the hotel car picked us up. The standard car was a black E class Mercedes Benz. Our driver was very friendly and nice. That experience and concierge service alone was very much needed and appreciated after many many hours of traveling. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were immediately escorted to our hotel room. We stayed in the ShopHouse suite. The bed was comfortable and our preferred pillows were already waiting for us in the bed. The food at the lounge was good and decent. The lounge served food five times a day including afternoon tea and cordials. The service from this hotel was truly impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Truly stunning hotel, fantastic service and location”
Reviews.Author: Ramblin_Fever_86
Reviews.Content: I visited the InterContinental Singapore for one night after crossing in from Malaysia and it truly was a fantastic experience. As with all InterContinental hotels the incredible levels of service and comfort of this hotel did not disappoint. The IC Singapore is situated on Middle Road and is connected to the Bugis MRT station/shopping complex. It is right in the heart of the city and its excellent transport links providing a fantastic base for a short stay or longer break alike. The hotel itself is inspired by the art and style of the 'Peranakans' and is luxurious, refined and uniquely Singaporean whilst retaining the Intercontinental 'feel'. The entrance and lobby are stunning and certainly eye-opening - even for a weary traveller like myself! My room was equally brilliant. I arrived early and was checked into a ground floor room so I imagine the view wasn't as good as other parts of the hotel but I didn't care in the scheme of things! The attention to detail was sublime, the décor glamorous but refined and the room was bright and airy. The bathroom and shower were mind blowing and I felt like a new man ready to explore amazing Singapore! After going out for a few drinks with friends to the Long Bar and exploring Little India I returned to the hotel to the same warm welcome as I did earlier in the day. I retired to the trademark incredibly comfortable InterContinental bed - sheer bliss! I didn't try the breakfast as I was meeting with friends the following morning but checkout was as smooth as check in. The staff were also kind enough to store my luggage after check out so I could spend a few precious extra hours exploring Singapore before my next flight. This is a fantastic hotel and well worth the rates charged. Stunning architecture, décor, location, comfort and service all combine to create a brilliant experience. I couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Singapore12345
Reviews.Content: The check in experience at the club lounge was great. Staff were friendly and efficient. However, the pool looks a little dated as compared to other top rated hotels and it would be great if it was upgraded. Breakfast at both the club lounge and Olive Tree were good although Olive Tree offered a larger variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Workplace”
Reviews.Author: mucben
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Singapore gives a great working environment and caters also the needs after work. Club Lounge offers fine food, drinks and nice staff. The gym is well equipped and the pool also offers a lot of relaxation. Bugis Mall is next door. Nice place to stay in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Luxe all the way!”
Reviews.Author: fullmoon911
Reviews.Content: We took a 3-night stay at Intercontinental Singapore . This is our second stay there as they Intercontinental hotels are always our top-of-choice when travelling. The Intercon Singapore hotel is very centrally-located, only take a few minutes by taxi major spots in Singapore such as Orchard roads, Clarke Quay or Marina Bays etc. We really loved the interior decor in white color and highly appreciate warmly and friendly service. Buffet breakfast was sumptuous. Enjoyed swimming at the hotel pool though it is small but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Begining to look tired”
Reviews.Author: PaulAblenet
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore. And although overall it's still a great hotel, I'm beginning to think it's looking a little tired. Being a heavy Priority Club user and Ambassador member when I checked in i was "upgraded" to a suit. Unfortunately the suit overlooked the attached shopping centre and so if you opened a window you were confronted by noise and fast food smells. So I asked to be moved to the main Hotel and was given an ordinary room, which was fine, just like I say beginning to look a little tired. Two things I would recommend however are the staff and the buffet restaurant, both are excellant. Overall this is still a great Hotel, but if they offer to upgrade you make sure it's in the main Hotel and try to avoid the area that's attached to the shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: ConstrucvtiveCritic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights with wife and two children aged 4 and 6. Took a "King Premier" room with room for a roll-away bed for the kids. Despite email confirmation and me phoning day before arrival, the room was not set up with the extra bed. Two visits to reception later ... Hotel was a bit of a mixed bag - very tired in places for a higher end property, but you kind of expect that in Singapore. Strips of paint coming off the plaster in the breakfast room atrium ?? Room was nice and pool was nice, but no where near as nice as the Shangri La. Staff were pretty friendly, but the concierge desk is a joke - don't expect any brochures, maps or helpful advice for the non business traveler. INTERNET ACCESS is a total rort - over $30 singapore dollars for two hours of wireless access in the lobby lounge! Wired internet in your room is $30 / day and not fast. When will these people join the 21st century ? I pointed out to them the irony of paying a large sum of money to stay in a flash hotel and having to pop over to McDonalds to check your email without being ripped off! Location is great, really lively and local with anything you could want or need within easy walk, and MRT station 5 minutes away. Would go back if got a really good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel and weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: nigeldiver
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times in the last 12 months. The service level is always high, although they do appear understaffed during peak periods. In a great location with a mall connected to the hotel. Just a short taxi or walk away from most business centers. Rooms have and older colonial feel. A touch smaller than the average size singaporean 5 star hotel. Prob due to the old building the hotel is within. Rooms are clean with the standard 5 star amenities, some decor is getting old however the beds sleep well and are clean. The lobby lounge is very impressive. The gym is small and dated. Don't expect cutting edge equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: skc97
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 reasons; membership of Priority Club, and proximity to Suntec City for my conference (easy 5 minute walk). Check in was attended to with a minumum of fuss; first hotel I stayed in where elevator activated by touching of room key; after correction of initial hitch, worked smoothly for all 5 days of stay. Room is spacious and light filled, being on the northern side of the hotel. Only a small hitch; the drainage of the basin in the bathroom was slow to drain, and this was attended to by the hotel staff. A quiet oasis above the bustle of the large Bugis Junction shopping centre underneath, which offers good inexpensive dining options. Also slightly disappointed that the hotel's fine dining Japanese restaurant, Ko, was closed for the weekend. Will definitely return, and would like to stay in one of the "shophouse" rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class”
Reviews.Author: Justin_in_Case
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel for Business needs; excellent rooms and friendly staff. Seperate Business floor suits the needs of the busy business traveller. Excellent drinks & snacks in comfy atmosphere in business lounge; business suites and rooms spacious and luxurious! Hotel is well located at city hotspots and starting point for business and social needs.

Reviews.Title: “Olive Tree Restaurant - Excellent Tenderloin Steak”
Reviews.Author: TowMan101
Reviews.Content: After a very fast twelve days moving around the middle east, arrived in Singapore late afternoon from Abu Dhabi, so by the time I checked in and had a shower I really did not have much idea about what to have for Dinner. I eventually went down to The Olive Tree Restaurant - I had the best Tenderloin Steak I have had for some considerable time, and prepared exactly as I like it, 'medium-well done'. Portion sizes were perfect, and the meal was a very pleasant experience. I can certainly recommend The Olive Tree to anyone who realy enjoys their food! M.H.Marshall - England

Reviews.Title: “Just average.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous 5 * hotels in Singapore we were generally disappointed with our first impression of the hotel. The hotel looks and feels like it needs a revamp to bring it up to the standard of other 5 star hotels. Location: Again we were not happy with the location as it’s too far away from Orchard Road and the shops. We took cabs everywhere as we didn’t feel like catching trains. Check in- Everything went accordingly to plan and the staff were efficient and friendly. Room – Our room was very spacious similar size to a suite. The room had a large king size bed, lounge suite and dining table. We were highly impressed with the size of the room. The bathroom was again roomy with a separate walk in shower and bath. However, we thought it did need an urgent revamp to give it a more modern feel. We had problems with the hot water and had to wait at least 10mins before it would heat up. Facilities – The pool is just okay and not very welcoming again work needs to be done around the swimming pool area to make it more attractive. There is a good size gym and spa facility. Dining – We thought the breakfast to be average compared to other hotels and were disappointed with the choices on offer. We also dined in the Cantonese restaurant which we found to be okay. Overall : The staff were very helpful and friendly but overall we thought the InterContinental Hotel to be just average regarding the standard of the rooms to the price we paid and the location poor.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in world”
Reviews.Author: ramin3
Reviews.Content: This is a fanatasic hotel if you have very deep pockets. I only stayed here for 1 night so the financial pain was bearable. The rooms are large, luxurious and super clean - i note joking to mate that i could eat my dinner off the floor! The concierge was very helpful directing us to great eateries and finding me a public golf course on short notice (esp given it was Chinese New Year which is equal to xmas for Singaporeans!). The only negative i have was its location. Its a good 20 min walk to Orchard Road which can be uncomfortable in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Cintrus
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in Singapore for 3 nights at intercontinental on our way back from the Maldives. The location of the hotel is fantastic as it is attached to the Bugis junction shopping mall and has acccess to Bugis MRT station. We booked a kingsize shophouse room and were allocated a room on level 3. The shophouse room cost more than some and we expected it to be a good standard. We found the room size to be adequate. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had great nights sleep. On the down side the Shophouse room was very noisy. Every morning there was drilling noise from 0900-1100 from the shopping centre. One night there was hammering and construction noise well after midnight. People noise is also very evident until about 2300 every night (there is a cafe/restaurant directly below rooms). On the first day we rang down to reception to express concern about the noise and asked whether they had a quieter room on a higher level. We were told that someone would ring back in 5 min. 40 min later we had not received a call so went down to reception to speak with them in person. We said that we were happy to pay to upgrade to another room. The woman at front reception was quite indifferent and offered a room on higher level which would have been equal to downgrade. Since we had prepaid for accomodation we decided that this was not an acceptable option and stayed where we were. We understand that the hotel has no control over upgrades/construction work carried out by the shopping centre but believe that guests should be informed that this can occur at any time. We dealt with Eugene at concierge almost every morning and he was very helpful in tips for getting around and restaurant recommendations!! We thought that he offered exceptional service as compared to front desk. We enjoyed buffet breakfast every morning and found the staff in restaurant very efficient. There was a wide variety of food to enjoy and the coffee was good. Overall - hotel great location. Service was a bit hit and miss. If you stay I don't recommend shophouse rooms. We would definitely try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2yo son and parents in a separate room directly accross the hall. Plenty of space for roll out bed and was able to be a bit separate from the King bed. We stayed in a club room which enabled us plenty of space. The staff were excellent and very very friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Thanks Anna and Emmanuel. Everyone loved our son and spent time talking to him. Plastic cutlery was arranged as well as a highchair. The lounge was great for relaxing in and spending time together outside our room(s). It More comfortable than 5 of us in a room and wonderful food. I highly reccommend this hotel for families. Especially the club rooms. The MRT is close by as is a cold storage for any extra snacks. The pool area is basic but still very nice. More for lounging by than children playing but it is ok. There is a childrens pool . We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever”
Reviews.Author: hubey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and were excited to stay again if only for one stopover night. Location is excellent and the bedrooms are gorgeous - the beds have those undersheet duvet things that exude luxury. Buffet is full of options and the pool lovely with the most beautiful day beds to lie on. Staff friendly and helpful. Just love the guys who open the main door and call the taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: lilyfdaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all our expectations. The staff were so friendly and were always willing to help. The check-in was a speedy process (we got the MRT from the airport - which was VERY cheap - to Bugis and the hotel was literally around the corner) and the staff were welcoming and informative. We notified the hotel in advance that we were staying as part of our honeymoon and the room was strewn with red rose petals and had complimentary chocolates with a hand messaged congratualtions note - a very nice touch. The room was a good size with great city views. The bed was comfortable with a good pillow menu. The bathroom was excellent with a powerful shower. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok!”
Reviews.Author: nairajay10
Reviews.Content: After reading excellent reviews about this hotel I was excited about staying here. It's a good hotel but did'nt meet my expectation.This was an average experience for me maybe I felt the staff could go the extra mile . We had a company meet (5 of us were staying in the hotel and had booked one of the conference rooms as well) we were going to be in meetings till 6PM on the date I was to check out I asked them if could check out after the meeting at 6 PM which would then give me a chance to freshen up they denied this request , I know it's hotel policy to not allow that late a check out without extra charge but when we had the conference last year in the 'Royal Plaza on Scotts' they allowed me to stay till 630PM at no charge. I know I should'nt compare but I can't help it. The meeting facilities and food (specially the buffet) were also better at the Royal Plaza.The buffet at the 'Olive tree' in the Intercontinental paled in comparison.I felt the concierge could have helped me more when I asked directions I was shown the internet and then the map to Singapore to figure out myself when I asked about a good place to eat I was told the name and nothing other than that (while again the concierge at Raffles actually made the extra effort to make reservations for a collegue of mine who was staying with them) The best part of the Intercontinental is the location- it's in a nice part of town and well connected by all means of transport so you can get around easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Slept really well !”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: As I have said before I have stayed at most hotels in Singapore, but this one was never at the top of my list. Mainly due to its location, its not that bad just 2 blocks away from Raffles. The staff at this property cant do enough for you and they do create a really positive environment. Lobby and lounge are nice and in a colonial style. My room I booked was a Shophouse room and also in a really nice colonial style, timber floors, louvered shutters, nice size room, Great bed and pillows, I sleeps like a dream, its just a shame that i had to get up early in them morning for an appointment. Bathroom was fine, nice size, nice amenities, separate shower. I really did feel really comfortable in this room. On the downside I found that the water pressure in the shower was lacking, also noticed a few cracked tiles in there. The LCD TV needs upgrading to a larger size, the swimming pool and area is very small and uninspiring, areas of the hotel do need updating. Also on check-in I was asked to join there Priority Club, really annoying as I am already a member, this is a pet hate and shower that they dont really value there members, also the cost of their internet was too high and there was no wireless in rooms just cable. Anyway I do think this hotel has got the price/value balance correct and this makes it an attractive place to stay when other hotels are charging $400++ for an inferior product. Check it out for yourself if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Joli-Coeur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Intercontinetal SIN in december 2008 for 4 nights. The room was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable. We had to pay for internet in the room. My wife received a birthday cake which was a nice gesture. The bathroom was clean with a bathtub and a separate shower. The toiletries were from Elemis, bigger sizes than one usually gets in a hotel. I've seen some stains on a towel. I complained about it and the manager personally apologised. The breakfast was good. Lots of choices, also dimsum. The MRT is 5 minutes from the hotel. There are restaurants in the area of the hotel, including some (chinese) dessert restaurants. If I know that I will not spend many hours in a hotel in SIN, than this hotel is a good choice in SIN. JC

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisN33
Reviews.Content: People here are Extremely Friendly. Couldn't think of a better place to say while in SG.

Reviews.Title: “tried the Club lounge this time - even better than before”
Reviews.Author: oscat
Reviews.Content: Just back home after my fourth stay at this hotel. The staff are amazing as always and the location can't be beaten. You can walk to Little India, Arab Street, Raffles and down to the river easily from the hotel. This time we paid the extra SIN$100 per room per night for Club privileges which meant that the two of us had breakfast in the Club lounge (so much you didn't need to eat lunch), tea in the afternoon(with more little cakes etc), lovely cocktails and canapes in the evening and free internet. It was great value and added a lot to our stay this time. I would certainly recommend it for an extra holiday treat. The only downside to this hotel as with most buildings in Singapore is that the air conditioning is unpleasantly cold. A polar bear would feel at home in the room when we checked in. If this will be a problem for you too, ask for the air conditioning to be turned off before you check in. When you are there, leave a keycard in the slot just inside the door so that the air conditioning doesn't automatically reset itself and turn back on while you are out of the room. By doing this the temperature increased from 19 degrees when we checked in to a comfortable 23 degrees two days later. Its easy then to turn the air conditioning on occasionally just to get some air circulating without the room getting colder. Now that this problem isn't an issue any more we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimRattray
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times its always good & consistent. Rooms very modern & very comfortable. Check-in very easy (especially if Priority Gold) and staff always great. Location not the best for me but still quiet convenient. Unfortunately wont be staying here again due to a bad Intercont billing experience (Bangkok) but looking forward to finding a new place to stay in Singapore. Last stay was bit pricey (+$500/nite) due to the Airshow and rooms in short supply.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and terrific service”
Reviews.Author: Snittster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent business trip, the staff was extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. I was ill during my stay and they went out of there way to be sure I was comfortable. I stayed in a club level room and the club staff brought tea and toast to my room after learning I was ill. Very good customer service. The room was very well appointed with all the latest amenities. It was very comfortable and the very large bathroom was just gorgeous. The hotel is in a great location with lots of shopping nearby at Bugis Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: WestAusTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our friends recently staying in the Intercontinental Hotel Bugis Junction Singapore. The rooms, service and location was excellent. It was our second time there and wouldn't go anywhere else. We booked the club room which gave you additional priviledges such as a club lounge to relax in, nice breakfast, free internet, evening cocktails and much more, which are worth the little bit extra. The location of the hotel for sightseeing and shopping is great.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Hong_Kong_Star
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of days at the hotel, it was our second time there and it was very pleasant. The room was very big and very confortable. It could fit 2 adults and 2 children without any problem. The bed was incredibly nice. The service was excellent (especially at breakfast), the staff is very warm and welcoming. The only down side was the pool, it would need some renovation works (titles) and the furnitures too. But still we enjoyed it very much. The location is excellent, you can reach any place very easily. BTW, there is no spa.... maybe they should think about it ? just now you can get massages at the fitness center though but we didn't try it (went outside). And there is no free internet in the rooms..... :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mountainview547
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental on our way home to Australia from a holiday in Europe. As a Platinum Elite Priority Club member I was able to book our stay on points accumulated during the last year's business travel. We arrived at 5:00 am on our overnight from Europe. I had expected to sit in the lobby for a while before a room was ready but they were able to accommodate us immediately. I paid the SD80++ per night to upgrade to the Club floor (always a good move in Singapore) which includes great breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails. The location is excellent in Bugis Junction on top of MRT and with 20 bus routes (including the one to Changi Beach) outside the door. Very quiet comfortable room on secure Club Floor contributed to our stay but the highlight was the Club itself - we ended up spending a fair amount of time here as the atmosphere and service were outstanding. I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “First rate in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Ornsay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night on two occasions en route Australia and UK. Well situated, being 20 minutes by taxi from Changi Airport, and just a short walk to the metro and a bit further to Raffles Check in was quick and reception staff were friendly and welcoming. In fact staff throughout the hotel were the same - helpful, efficient and eager to please. I could not fault them. We pre-paid a de-luxe twin queen-bedded room with breakfast. Room was extremely comfortable and quiet and breakfast was magnificent. Everything you could want - and more. We took dinner one night - advertised as a seafood buffet, but it included beef, chicken, pasta, asian dishes etc. It was truly delicious, and the staff, again so pleasant. Used the business centre a couple of times. Not expensive and helpful staff here too. The large lounge was comfortable, but drinks were expensive. Our flight home was just before midnight, so we were happy to be offered a 5.00 pm ckeckout - at no charge. All in all, a top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: randd33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as a stopover on our way to Australia. We got a good rate as shareholders in IHG and paid the extra to upgrade to a Club Room which was well worth the money. The Club Lounge upgrade included an excellent breakfast, wifi access, afternoon tea and a cocktail hour with nibbles substantial enough to be an evening meal. The room was a good size with well fitted bathroom and a very comfortable bed. What made this the best for us was the polite and attentive staff, who all gave the impression that nothing was too much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “First class, great restaurants and bars”
Reviews.Author: Paris12
Reviews.Content: First class amenities with a highly qualified and devoted staff - with the exception of front desk that appeared to lack organization and efficiency when we checked in. Spacious rooms with thick & comfy pillows. Too bad it took a while to get hot water in the shower. Service is also efficient and friendly in the various restaurants and bars. The evenings in the main lounge listening to the jazzy piano was probably the highlight of my stay. Rate SGD265 including internet & breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: spbennet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 weeks a month now since December and I cannot say enough good things about it. I do a lot of travel for my job and this is by far the best hotel I have been to worldwide. I am a dedicated Marriott guy but when I come to Singapore I would only think of staying at the Intercontinental. The hotel is always clean and the staff is amazing and always greeting you with smiles. They have a great lobby bar that I went to on day 1 to try and stay away and adjust to the 13 hour time change. I came back to the lobby bar 5 days later for a beer and the waitress remembered my name and greeted me properly. It’s little things like that make the experience at the hotel above others. The rooms are very big and they are always clean and in perfect order. The pool area is quiet nice and they have some places to sit and relax although it is always very hot. The location of the hotel puts you in the heart of so many great places to shop and eat. You can pretty much walk to anywhere of interest in Singapore from this location. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and I cannot wait until my next stay in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stay”
Reviews.Author: Biyani
Reviews.Content: Overall I would like to say excellent!! The staffs are very polite and very friendly and they are very helpful at all the time. The breakfast is superb and also the restaurants. I will definitely consider it for my future stay

Reviews.Title: “Classic Peranakan charm”
Reviews.Author: ABSViews
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental Hotel. It's not the first time for us and we are very likely to stay again. It's one of a handful hotels in Singapore that sits atop an MRT station making it very convenient. Located between Orchard and the business district in Bugis, it's close to so many attractions - Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, Robertson Quay, the Raffles Hotel, CHIJMES to name a few. What we love about this hotel - it's classy, the lobby lounge is exquisite (we had a night cap there every night), the fitness centre is very well equipped and staffed, the food is delicious, the rooms are spacious as are the bathrooms. There is nothing is dislike about this hotel, nothing even annoying.

Reviews.Title: “it dont get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: uglygourd
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel you can easily walk to the arab quarter little India China town and Raffles. The buffet breakfast is amazing with the biggest choice I have ever seen and very attentive but not in your face staff. The concierge was very helpfull answering all our questions. We also went to the Olive tree for dinner we had the buffet and it matched Raffles Billiard room buffet for us . The bed was huge and very comfortable and the room was clean and well decorated

Reviews.Title: “An Even Better Deal”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: Got an even better deal than the last time I stayed here. This time, I spotted a very good rate 2 months before my 2-night stay at S$163. As I got closer to my stay, I noticed the rate had jumped to S$220, so it pays to book early. I knew it was a good deal since I paid more last time, which I thought then was a good deal. And you definitely get your money's worth. The room I got was as big as last time, and much bigger than most hotels I've stayed. Everyone at the hotel greeted me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Cjcay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over Chinese New Year. The room and hotel facilities were very good, but the quality of the service we received was impeccable. I proposed to my girlfriend during our stay, and the staff went to great lengths to make our stay extra special. We experienced truly exceptional service from every single member of the hotel staff we encountered during our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: MikeBracknell
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Singapore and we were very impressed with the Intercontinental. The hotel was very well appointed, the rooms luxurious with bathrooms to match. The staff were absolutely first class very courteous and attentative, making us feel as though they were genuinely pleased to serve us (such a contrast from the UK). Breakfast was very good, if a little over priced, the best coffee I tasted in 4 weeks away. The hotel is attached to the Bugis Junction mall and MRT station is a 5 minute walk throught the mall. Will deifinitely stay here next time we are passing through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Totham
Reviews.Content: All round this is an excellent hotel in a good location with good size rooms and high service levels.We used the hotel limo airport collection service which was well worthwhile .Met at aircraft gate helped with baggage and car directly to hotel and our room where we were checked in, brilliant service after a long flight . Very good breakfast and nice outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nts at this hotel as a mystery deal on Wotif.com.au for about Aust$160 nt including breakfast. It was a special weekend (Fri/Sat) price and is usually twice this amount. Check-in was swift, but very welcoming. My deluxe room on the 4th floor was very quiet, large, comfortable and elegantly furnished. Traditional decor style. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. The bathroom had bath and separate shower. Nice toiletries and bathrobe. Unfortunately the curtains didn’t block out light while sleeping - the room was light even in the middle of the night. The breakfast buffet in the Olive Tree restaurant from 6am was wonderful. Very friendly and attentive service, huge cups of coffee. Extensive range of food from asian and western choices. Housekeeping was prompt. The location is great - attached to Parco Bugis Junction shopping Centre and easily accessed from Bugis MRT Station. The lounge area and reception is elegant and beautifully furnished with asian antiques. This is a quality place to stay and I would return if I could again get this excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish and relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlesDP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights to visit some friends in Singapore. We stayed in a club premier room. When we arrived we were directed to the club lounge where we were welcomed to the hotel and allowed to complete the check in process over drinks in the lounge. While I would still have enjoyed my stay without lounge access it really was the highlight of the trip for us. We only had the breakfast but it was a proper buffet breakfast. There was a wide variety of hot and cold items including eggs to order. Tea and coffee are brought to your table. When they clear your plates and cutlery they immediately replace the cutlery. I have been to some buffets where once you lose your cutlery you're on your own. Apart from the food the decor was very well executed and it was a comfortable place to sit and relax. I particularly enjoyed being able to check out while eating breakfast and without having to go near the desk. Our room was an L shaped premier room of 52 sqm. The colonial theme continued in the room together with some peranakan details to reflect the local culture. The room was well designed and very comfortable. There was a couch, wing chair and a dining table. The bed was an excellent blend of comfort and support so we always slept well. They have a pillow menu and we were able to order our prefered pillow. The room was serviced twice a day. Turn down was provided as a matter of course and if you were around at about 9.30am they called in to see if you had any laundry. The hotel was well located as it was adjacent to a good shopping mall and an MRT station. We did end up getting taxis to most places as they were quite cheap but the MRT was very handy and fairly easy to use. I would definitely recommend staying at the intercontinental and opting for the club lounge. The staff are very obliging and really want you to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely but expensive”
Reviews.Author: jetsed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to and from Malaysia with our children. The rooms are not particularly big but quite nice all the same.The mini bar is outrageous with $12 SGD being asked for a med size bottle of water!!! Anyway, the hotel staff are very friendly and do whatever they can to assist, I never thought anyone was rude or dismissive.I find that claim hard to believe.The location is great as it is right onto a large shopping area which has EVERYTHING and is also a short stroll from Bugis street and a walk to little India.The only reason I wouldn't stay here in future is the price is probably a little excessive and maybe if it included breakfast it would offset it a bit but you dont , so it makes for a very exxxy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service but at a price”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGardner
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the IC in Singapore and once again it was a good choice. IC is attached to the Bugis shopping precinct and MRT Station, which makes it easy to shop for fruit etc and easy to get around. The service is friendly and efficient, housekeeping is quick and thorough. Food is good but expensive in the in-house eateries. Beds are great, shower is superb (!) and the rooms are quiet. Being the IC you pay for the quality of the place but we don't think you get much value below $AUS250 per night in Singapore and for that extra money you get a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't decide Conrad or Inter- Continental- tried both”
Reviews.Author: FrustratedTravelor
Reviews.Content: The Inter- Continental wins on location ( it is on MRT line from airport and right above station- Conrad is at least a 15 min walk- ) and it wins on personality ( you have a feeling of place --the Conrad could be anywhere.) Rooms quiter and nicer at Conrad- Service a bit better there - pools the same- breakfast Conrad wins- Conrad Exec lounge on high floor wins but again the IC is more elegant- Is it bad- in any way- no

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: timotan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the weekend for work and are generally impressed by the level of service at the hotel. The girls at the Club lounge are ever friendly and the High Tea at the lobby lounge is of very good standards. Love the poached pear! While this is not the most modern hotel, it is spotless and has a distinctive and pleasant colonial character. And everywhere you turn you see smiles from the staff. Only annoyance is the seemingly endless stream of shoppers from the adjacent mall, which incidentally has a large selection of shops, restaurant and supermarket, as well as the MRT station as mentioned by the other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “very poor....”
Reviews.Author: natsha80
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews i was very dissapointed. Ive stayed at the st regis, mandarin oriental, and the conrad all in singapore and have to say the Intercontinental singapore is not in the same league or even close to these other hotels. I cant think where all these previous good reviews have come from. I stayed on business for 3 nights in a club room, the club lounge was a joke, staff rude, and on your case for the littlelist charge that went over your allowance, the rooms are old, dirty, and with no great views at all unless you like like looking over shopping malls. Had a meal in the chinease in the hotel very poor, cold , boring,no wonder there was no one ever in there. I travel on business from the uk most months and have to say this is one of my worst experiences and would never stay here again a massive let down.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: 062211d
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the InterContinental Hotel Singapore, and I was very positively surprised. It is in fact located next to the Bugis Junction Shopping Centre, which offers a variety of cheap, but delicious restaurants. The hotel and interior design is colonial, and very stylish. Most impressive is the lobby. I had shophouse room, which was nice, cozy, although I don't consider it worthwhile paying extra for this. I had paid for breakfast, but only had it once. It was ok, but frankly, considering there is a large shopping centre right next door, it is no problem to get breakfast at a fraction of the cost. Same goes for the restaurants, which were almost 10 times the price of the average Singaporean restaurants. This I thought was a little arrogant. This said, the hotel was confortable, the service excellent, and I would consider staying there again, but, and especially in Singapore, it is worthwhile shopping around for great deals, rather than booking the rack rate at priorityclub.com.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jess5788
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Intercontinental Hotel when we went to Singapore on Dec 28, 2009 to Jan 01, 2010 because of the good reviews that we read from Tripadvisor. We were truly not disappointed as to its location. A few step away from the MRT and it's adjoining Bugis Junction. Lots of restaurants to choose from and lots of boutiques that sells different stuff. You even get discounts from some stores at Bugis Junction if you are staying at the Intercon. Just present to them your hotel card key. We got an SGD$100 discount when we bought an Apple notebook. The room is very spacious considering Singapore is a small place with a very high standard of living. The twin beds are big. It can fit in two Asian-size adults in one bed. The bathroom has separate shower and bathtub. Nonetheless, we were greatly disappointed in two areas: 1. When we entered the room after we check-in, the whole room, including the bathroom smells of fresh cigarette smoke. We assumed that the guest before us smoke inside the bedroom and the bathroom even though it's a non-smoking room. Yes, we requested for a non-smoking room and we were indeed given one. However, it was like we were in a smoking room. Yes, we complained and requested if we can change our room but we were denied a change of room.
