They just sent someone to spray air freshener in our room. Sad to say, the freshener didn't work a bit. We were content to sleep with smoke scent in our room. We didn't make a big fuss of it since we were truly tired from our travel. Additionally, we even have to request for the bathrobes to be changed since they smell of cigarette smoke too (We have to use the bathrobe since our luggage was erroneously taken by another passenger, they were delivered to our room the next day). 2. The pillows stink. Maybe because of constant use by some guests with peculiar smell, their pillows emit a certain smell. Since we are not used to the smell, we had a hard time tolerating it. Yes, we left a note to the housekeeping for our pillow to be changed (since we have to hurry and go out to maximize our time in Singapore, hence no time to personally talk with the housekeeping about it), but guess they just changed the pillow case but not the pillow. Unless, all their pillows really smell that way. If not for the above 2 concerns, our stay at the Intercon could have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Experience That I Will Judge Others By”
Reviews.Author: searchforfood
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the Intercontinental in Singapore. We had only booked five initially so that we could look around and move during our visit if we found something we liked better. We didn't, and we did look at several other hotels. From the moment you enter the lobby everybody is so charming and smiling, whether you have just come down from your room or have entered from the oppressive heat outside. The man who gets you a taxi at the front door is helpful and knowledeable and this attitude carries throughout the entire hotel. We definitely had no complaints. Our room was spacious and comfortable and well maintained. It was our anniversary and apart from chocolates and a card awaiting our arrival sent from a friend in Canada, the Hotel had picked up on our celebration and sent their own note and fruit. Breakfast, every morning, was an experience in itself. There is absolutely everything you could possibly want at different food stations and fresh pancakes made in front of you. We put on weight on this trip! The Chinese Restaurant in the hotel is excellent and dim sum worth trying, as is the evening meal. The staff in the restaurant were delightful to deal with and we ate there several times. A truly great hotel experience. Next stop is the Intercontinental Grand Stanford in Hong Kong - we hope the atmosphere is similar.

Reviews.Title: “A big letdown again”
Reviews.Author: bubblygal
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the hotel. During our 1st visit, we were upset with the service and the long waiting time of an hour to retrieve our reservations that we immediately cancelled the stay. It had been a year and we presumed the service standards would have been raised so we decided to stay at the hotel for the christmas weekend given the good promotional rates. We arrived at 3pm which is the official check-in time and yet, we were asked to wait for another 45 mins because the room was not ready???? This explained the unusually large crowd at the hotel lobby with many guests hanging around with their bags. The guest relations officer offered his apology (half-heartedly) and promised to extend our check out time to 3pm, which was not arranged. The bottomline is very poor service and it is extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jacquibabs
Reviews.Content: Booked a 5 night stay here en route to Oz. very impressive entrabce and efficient check in. Room was lovely, good size, very comfortable, lovely marble bathroom and good storage. We opted for the executive club package which included free internet, breakfast, tea and cocktails etc. in the exec lounge where the service was excellent. We found all the staff very helpful and pleasant. The pool area was lovely despite being overlooked by other buildings. The location was great as it is adjoining a large shopping mall (Bugis junction) which has a great selection of shops and food outlets as well as a metro station. It is also opposite a large night market and more shops. Raffles is just round the corner and you can walk to other large malls. All in all a great stay. The only thing not too good was the concierge's knowledge and lack of info leaflets.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ttami73
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel. -Concierge booked wrong car from the airport to the hotel, not big enough for the family -No extra bed available despite our booking -Club IC lounge very busy, always wait for the breakfast table -Club IC lounge staff rude, arrogant, unhelpful, unfriendly -Rooms bit dated -No pool bar service -No free bottle of drinking water even in Club IC rooms The location is good. Last year we stayed at the Conrad, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, beautiful piece of history, with all the modern comforts”
Reviews.Author: wildauriga
Reviews.Content: stepping into the intercontinental is like walking into a sepia-toned picture of the classic, colonial era hotel. from the cobbled drive-way to the green marble and red-wood trimmed bathroom fixtures, and the acrylic still-life painting of orchids and china cups in my room, it seemed a proper slice of old-world grandeur. the wonderful bit is that this old-world classiness comes matched with the modern comforts expected of a up-market hotel, and the intercontinental did not disappoint, with it's flat screen telly which cleverly integrated a 24hour clock onto one of the speakers, and hidden speakers in the bathroom so you could follow the audio of your television programme even if you had to go wash your hands during the show. and the beds were so comfy! there's something about the multiple layers of sheets and those pillows that really make you feel like you're on holiday. the only slightly disappointing thing about the room i had on the 4th floor was that even though there was an outdoorsy pebbled garden area and a back gate to the room, which could have led us straight to the pool which was also located on the 4th floor, guests are obviously not encouraged to use this back door access. besides the chair placed in front of the door and the full length day curtains (so you wouldn't think there was a door there at all) there's a very sturdy metal security plate that blocks the sliding door, and when we lifted this metal plate to try the doors (which didn't work anyway), we found ancient cigarette butts and other nastiness underneath it. i suppose we must have been the first itchy-fingered guests in a long while who tried to use the short-cut to the pool, so they didn't think to clean underneath =) but no loss, it really wasn't any trouble to walk to the lift lobby and access the pool through the main door. the pool isn't huge, and people from the neighbouring national library and iluma shopping mall can sort of look in on the sunbathing going on on the 4th floor, but that didn't stop anyone from having fun. there's a separate shallow pool for the kiddies, and a shaded jacuzzi. the two large divan-type sunbeds were hugely in demand! breakfast was a treat. perhaps because it's not holiday peak season, it wasn't too crowded. there was an egg station, and a lovely selection from muesli, fruit, nuts and yogurt, to congee, breads, smoked salmon to go with your salad, and your usual fry-up. tea and coffee served to the table as soon as you sit down, which was really nice. the staff is warm and discreet. the young man who checked us in who forgot to tell us where we should go for breakfast, but he was obviously so new and nervous, his hands shook a little as he wrote down our details upon check in so that can't be held against him! i had a sore throat on the first day, and asked for hot water and honey... it was delivered to the room with a warm smile, sliced lemons on the side, and sunny "i hope you feel better soon!" and after the wonderful stay in the beautiful intercontinental with its attentive staff, i did =)

Reviews.Title: “As expected - another pleasant intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: R-and-L-3000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Standard Intercontinental, a very nice hotel, good rooms, good services, clean, well run. Only negative was the cost of internet access($32 / day). Yikes! The all you can eat sushi in the mall for $14.90 was great.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with some knowledge shortfalls”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_to_be
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice during a recent overseas trip. I found the reception area very intimate and well manned. Upon asking to check in I was met by a guest relations employee who took me up to my room straight away and performed in-room check in (part of being a Platinum member) it was a nice touch. This same employee recognized me a month later when I returned and enquired about my holidays. The room was well appointed (not my favorite décor but nonetheless nice). I was upgraded to a club room with no access to the club (although this didn’t bother me it would have been nice to have been informed). The cleanliness and maintenance of the room were just ok – some dust and surfaces scratched, nothing that a quick preventative maintenance couldn’t fix. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Had cocktails in the lobby bar, which to me was one of the highlight of my stay. The staff was efficient and yet invisible - giving me enough room to just sit there and read a book. The business center was well equipped and staffed. Had breakfast one morning. It was a little overpriced but a good selection for all tastes. The hotel is conveniently located, adjacent to a shopping mall and a MRT station. I only have two flaws to mention. Intercontinental Hotels pride themselves for being ‘in the know’ – the concierge will give you hints and tips in order to make your stay at that destination authentic and unforgettable. When I enquired about a nice bar by the water where I could sit, have a glass of wine I was told to go to starbucks!?!??!?! Another porter’s idea of ‘in the know’ was to keep pesting me to go get a tailor made suit from his cousin. Very annoying but it didn’t tarnish an otherwise pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: gankor
Reviews.Content: We took up a great package for 3 days and 2 nights. The service was excellent - great, friendly and proactive staff. Even before stepping into the hotel, the "reservations" personnel at the hotel were very helpful when my wife called to enquire about room rates. The price and selection for the breakfast was very good and value for money, as was dinner when we decided to eat in one night after a long day of shopping. The location was good with loads of things to do at night ( shopping and food ), and connected to the MRT station. It has been about 15 years since the last time I stepped into the hotel, and I was pleasantly surprised to find that there was no evident wear and tear, and the room did not look outdated. It was cosy, comfortable and well-appointed. Bathroom was tastefully decorated with a bathtub. There was also a nice pool ( although a little small ). One tip : It is best to call the hotel directly instead of the toll-free line when checking out promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault the Intercontinental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AustralianinEurope
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore three times, always whilst passing through from Australia to Europe. Every time, I look forward to my stopover thanks to this hotel, it is an absolute delight. Staff are courteous, friendly and always available. The rooms are spacious, soundproof, stylish and impeccably clean and the bars and restaurants are first class. Buffet breakfast was high quality and impressive. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Solid but unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: mianth0ny
Reviews.Content: Usual solid IC standard. Top-service as usual. If you pay the 40 euros for the airport pick-up things are as fast as 35 minutes from airplane door to hotelroom - all seamless as they will wait for you right as you step off the plane and when the Merccedes pulls over at the hotel lobby, you are greeted and ushered to your room for check-in formalities. Top. Just the room is not spectaculor and a bit dated. Internet connection was not very fast

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mktraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on 3rd Dec 2009. We arrived very late in the evening after a couple of long flights from New Zealand. Check in was a bit slow, but we were offered a ½ price upgrade to the club which we accepted. The room was comfortably furnished with lots of chairs. The view from the window was lousy, overlooking the roof of Bugis Junction Shopping centre. The beds were very comfortable and I slept well. The bathroom was marble and had lots of room with separate bath and shower. The shower wasn't as powerful as I would have hoped. The club lounge was nice. Large with plenty of room. Quite a choice for breakfast with a dedicated egg chef. The evening drinks and canapes were a bit odd as they only laid out wines and beers and gave no indication of any other drinks available. We only found out the full range when we asked. We had been granted a late checkout until 3pm (I'm a Priority Club member), but the upgrade meant we could use the club facilities even after we'd checked out. The lobby was large and very busy with lots of people going to and from Bugis Junction. The staff were very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must stay”
Reviews.Author: jefflang007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent several hours on “Travel Advisor” to decide on a location to stay in Singapore . I had travelled to Singapore previously for work and resided in a serviced apartment in the outer suburbs, however, as this trip was a holiday I wanted it to be just right for an “Adults” get-away. My wife fell in love with the pictures of the hotel because she likened the lounge bar area as a scene from an Agatha Christie novel. On arrival we were in awe and indeed I fell in love with the hotel too. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel special and that we were indeed staying in 5 star accommodation. The hotel has buckets of charm and the staff are all pleasant, helpful and willing to assist in any way possible. We had a deluxe room which overlooked the Bugis Junction mall. The room (for a bottom of the price list) was very pleasant, roomy and it was also a joy to take a shower and/or bath in the more than ample bathroom. A quick lift ride to level 4 brought us to the pool which is very much worth a look as the gardeners have paid fastidious attention to maintaining the tropical plants that curb the crystal clear waters. We had breakfast included in our package and I was more than pleased that we took this option as the spread was not only spectacular but delicious. Again, the waiting staff were great. The lounge bar is a little pricier than an alcoholic beverage purchased in the hawker markets but well worth it to soak up the ambiance (not to mention the magnificent voice of Kathleen who tinkled the ivories on the grand piano in the evening). Directly attached to the hotel is the Bugis Junction shopping mall which is an air-conditioned pleasure. There are plenty of shops and stalls with many items at fair prices. On the second level is an eatery that closes at 2200h and has plenty of foods to choose from at very reasonable prices if you can not afford the luxury of eating at the hotel restaurant each night. On the other side of the Bugis Junction is the MRT rail system that will take you pretty much anywhere you wish to go in Singapore. We were able to shoot of to Orchard Road, China Town and many other destinations in under 20mins. If you are a tourist, ask in the MRT station about the tourist multi trip travel pass. My only (and very minor grumble) about the hotel is that there is no free WIFI and is fairly pricey if you opt to have it. This being said, we found that in the shopping mall area there was a store offering free access and, as such, we were able to get emails and gloat to friends on Facebook about our splendid holiday. Directly across the road from the hotel is the famous Bugis markets where there are many bargains to be had from souvenirs to fashion items (make sure you check the goods before you leave). The hotel is also just a short walk to Raffles, Arab Street, SimLim and other points of interest. I can not recommend the Intercontinental Singapore enough. When booking, enquire about late check out (1600h) but don’t be concerned if you have a late evening flight as the hotel staff were more than happy to secure our luggage until our departure time. Please feel free to pop me an email if you have any questions about the hotel or things to do whilst in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: topmark4
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore. We could not fault anything about the hotel. The rooms were comfotable and spacious. Location was great ,near to Bugis MRT and within walking distance of lots of shops and markets. The staff were all friendly and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Location ??”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel , great restaurants and excellent service , as should be expected by top level hotels in Asia. Stayed here many times and always feel good about it . Only draw back is location , a bit out of the way. Rooms are of good size , even the standard room , as is the bathroom. Bed is comfortable. TV channels in English , unfortunately somewhat limited.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed here for the entire visit..”
Reviews.Author: MadsDad
Reviews.Content: As a stopover for 3 days on our way to Thailand to visit rellies, we (self, missus and 11YO daughter) we booked this hotel on the basis of the TA results here. Exceptional service, and that "welcome home" greeting that we received every time we came through the front door, should have been enough to convince us to to stay here on our return, a week later. We left for Thailand after 3 days, and stayed at the Stamford Swissotel (see separate review), but our initial experience with the Intercontinental should have been sufficient to ensure our return visit. I'm sorry to say, I paid extra money to stay at a more "as perceived" upmarket hotel. Never again. The staff here are simply lovely people, every one of them. We received an upgrade for no apparent reason, other than the wife has a Priority Card, that she hasn't use for donkeys years, and we received the royal treatment from day one. I've tried previously to claim points on my Marriott/Sheraton/Hilton cards to no avail, but these guys are way ahead of them. They know who you are before you arrive, and treat you with the utmost respect when you get there. Rooms are spacious, staff are only too helpful with directions and advice as to how to get to wherever you want to go....and if you can't get it in the hotel, then they will point you in the right direction. The (air-conditioned) shopping mall/street adjacent to the hotel caters to every taste and whim...the downstairs lounge and Victoria Bar staff keep you well supplied with whatever you fancy after a warm days' shopping, and the front counter staff can arrange anything you desire at a moments notice. The APEC Forum was happening during our visit also, but staff were attentive to our needs as well as those more "demanding" guests. If you can consider that the staff managed to still keep an 11YO happy with the service-level and staff interaction despite the attendance of various members of the APEC Convention, then I think you can give this place a big tick.... Thanks to you all...you made this visit a very enjoyable stay, and we'll be happy to do it again soon. Ric/Nol & Madison

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: NWA4EVER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during the 2009 APEC meetings, as a result the hotel was packed, but the service was great none the less. I booked the basic deluxe room, and it was upgraded to a primer room three days out (due to Royal Ambassador status), but all primer rooms had King beds, so I pick a Souphouse room instead, and I was granted club access as a result. The room wasn't the biggest at 38 SQMs, but the design made it feel very spacious, and the British colonial background made it feel traditional , but in a swanky way (pardon the oxymoron). The club lounge was quite spacious, compared to some other downtown intercontinental properties, but its more suited to dinning than lounging in my opinion, and the lack of power outlets could become problematic. However the excellent breakfast, evening cocktail services and fantastic staff more than made up for its shortcomings. Excellent property, although the location could be better, the hard product and the services makes you want to take a longer journey from the city center. defiantly recommend for anyone on a business or pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service in Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tucano
Reviews.Content: normally I comment first on room and location- this time our experience was like a test for the service quality caused by heavy toothache of my wife when checking in after our flight from Europe. We asked the receptionist on duty for assistance to help finding a dentist. That proved to be complicated as it was already 6 PM and dental clinics already closed or fully booked. Mrs. Satthya accomodated us first to our room and continued to phone around. After a while she had succeeded to make an appointment and suggested that she would book a taxi and explain the address to the driver. It worked out well. When we returned- my wife relieved of pain- we felt grateful and wanted to give her a gratuity. Mrs. Satthya refused insisting that what she did was just her duty. We found really an outstanding service dedication that is rare. Otherwise Interconti Singapore has an unbeatable location in short walking distance of Raffles City Shopping Plaza, the historical center and good restaurants. KO- the japanese restaurant in the hotel served very fresh and delicious food. The Hotel is shining, has a marvelous, noble lobby lounge to sip a singapore sling with life music. Organization and orientation of staff is perfect in all areas and give you a warm hospitality feeling. Rooms are in english style and have everything one needs. A stay is higly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: SYMOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite under the hotel's 14 Anniversary Promo. The size of the room was really spacious for my 2 young kids to run around in the room. The hotel and room was sparkling clean. Recommend to pay for the facilities in the club lounge too. The service by the staff was truly excellent and my family was given very personal service by the staff at the club lounge. Overall experience in this hotel is excellent and will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “All round luxury accommodation”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at 5 top rated hotels during our recent 24 day holiday and the IC Singapore didn't let us down. The location was great. It was walking distance to shopping, the Flyer, Little India, the underground. We upgraded to the Club lounge and were offered breakfast, all day refreshments, tea and cocktails for $90 Singapore. This was cheaper than HK. The Club was located on the second floor. The pool and spa was located on 4. The regular rooms are an average size and offered a bathroom with a single sink, separate deep tub and shower. We are Ambassador Gold, so we were upgraded to a large junior suite. Upon arrival, our suite wasn't ready, but we were immediately ushered into another room to use (without a request). The entire registration process took place in the room, which I believe is reserved for Ambassador members, and is a lovely touch. We were presented with placemats and chopsticks as a gift. Additonally, fruit and water were available free of charge. Bath amenities were Elemis and include moisturizer, shampoo, conditioner, liquid soap and nothing else, which is surprising. The concierge was excellent. Giving us superior help and providing us whatever we required in an ultra personalized approach. The hotel is attached to a mall, where discounts are available. The lobby is very large and elegantly designed, without having a business feeling. It offers a very nice high tea as well as provides a nice, welcoming sitting area for those not having club priviledges. We stayed at the Hong Kong Intercontinental, the Hilton Beijing, the Opposite House in Beijing, and the Shangri-La in Bangkok during the past 24 days. It was very different from the other hotels, but overall, I preferred it to the IC Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Oh the flashing lights!”
Reviews.Author: je2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights at the Intercontinental as part of our two week vacation in Singapore. Our first couple of nights were blighted by flashing lights in our room from a message on the telephone & more annoyingly from the smoke detector above my head when laying in bed. We eventually found the hotel book hidden away at the back of the drawer & managed to get rid of the message. We reported the smoke alarm but told this was normal, we have been to many hotels & never had this before. Two white LED's flashing every five seconds & every couple of hours on full for about a minute. This is quite disconcerting when laying awake due to jet lag etc! We did get used to it in the end mainly because of sleeping better. I did think about trying to buy some black tape to cover them over!! That's the bad bit out of the way now for the many good points. On our arrival we explained that we would be going to another hotel at the end of our stay & it was no trouble to extend our checkout time to 14:00 at no extra cost. The staff were all very pleasant, probably the best out of the three hotels we stayed in. Breakfast was very good, no hassle to hurry up when we turned up towards the end of the serving one morning. Items were replenished constantly, tea & coffee brought promptly. For evening meals the hotel is adjoined to the Bugis Mall which provides many eating places both upstairs & in the basement. If you don't want to walk too far then we found the Japanese Coffee shop right opposite the hotel doors provided very good meals. They mix Japanese with western, I had chicken balls with pasta one evening which was very tasty. Should you wish to stretch your legs then the Foodcourt in Raffles City Mall (10 mins walk) is very good value for money. We had a three course meal for under S$10, which saves a lot of money over a two week period. Great atmosphere as many people use this on their way home from work, I couldn't quite bring myself to try the Pigs innards soup though!! We liked the Intercontinental, yes it could do with a coat of emulsion in various areas of the hotel but it is clean & tidy. The location is one of the best, great for Little India, Malay Quarters, City Hall, Museums, Marina & Orchard Road all within walking distance. We would definitely stay here again & easily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good friends and service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nonefornow
Reviews.Content: Our team has stayed many nights over the last few years and all of us really like the hotel, the location, the people, the service and the food.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leithman
Reviews.Content: From being greeted at our taxi door on arrival, to our early morning wake up call (repeated 5 minutes later to ensure we HAD got up) for our departure, this was a fantastic experience. Not in Club or Shophouse rooms but our hotel rooms were big, all our requests provided without a problem, smiles and good service all the way. Well done to the staff - very much appreciated. Would highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “classy, tasteful and a delight”
Reviews.Author: PhilippaBencubbin
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at this hotel and found it absolutely devine! We went on a shopping trip, and were delighted to find a fantastic shopping centre , Bugis Junction, literally straight out of the rear entrance to the hotel. It also leads directly to the brilliant MRT, underground railroad system, which is the cheapest, and easiest way to get around the city. We paid for Club rooms, which was a fantastic bargain as it included an amazing breakfast, delicious afternoon teas with devine cakes and sandwiches, and then drinks and canapés in the evening. We found we didn't really need to buy any other food during the day other than a very light lunch. The club Lounge where it was all served was a large, comfortable room, with either tables and chairs, or loungesand beautifully decorated. There was also 24hr access to the room with free internet and board room available. Our rooms were large, beautiful and extremely quiet with no noise to be heard from the hallway. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in, with even the pillows king size! We were on the 13th floor and had amazing views of the city, especially at night. The gym was accessable 24 hrs a day, and was well equipped with all the latest gear, even a personal trainer if you need one. The piano lounge near the foyer was massive, with many private areas for entertaining friends. The pool area outside was delightful, with a smaller shallow pool for children, and a great view of the national library accross the road. All in all a very grand, majestic hotel, highly recommended. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanAirUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in for service and comfort. We stayed for two nights, arriving at 9am without advance notice and they found us a lovely room almost immediately. The staff service was excellent and they could not do too much for us. The bed in our room was glorious and so comfortable, that I just fell asleep as soon as I laid down. The location was fine. It was adjacent to a reasonable shopping centre if you wanted to eat out and was close to the BUGIS MRT station. Raffles and the river area were within reasonable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant, good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: TigiCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: very nice and elegant hotel. Close to MRT and lots of restaurants and shops. Nice and friendly reception - let us keep the rooms to 4 p.m. the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: ml3369
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers outstanding service and is in a very good location for a stopover. You can take the MRT from the airport to BUGIS in about 20 mins. Get off at BUGIS and enter the Mall there and you will pick up signs to the Intercontinental which is attached to the mall - 5 mins walk. We went for a higher priced room - the lowest price rooms are a bit gloomy. Our room was excellent and we couldn't have asked for better service. Very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST”
Reviews.Author: yerauk
Reviews.Content: I am a local. When the hotel had a promotion, I cannot pass it... the hotel is one of the best we had stayed. Much better than some of the 5 stars hotels our there. We loved the swimming pool. Our room had 2 queen sizes bed, We even had a pillow menu.... so very nice. The only question is ... when can we return for another visit :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gagabrielle
Reviews.Content: This hotel will not disappoint, truely high standard,nothing is too much trouble.Late checkout given 1400 without question.Great location connected to Bugis Mall and only $3.00 on MRT BUGIS from Changi Airport. Well Done.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic BED”
Reviews.Author: luvmissa
Reviews.Content: This place is so beautiful and has AMAZING service. But most importantly, the bed is spectacular. It is so amazingly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Well located with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vman63
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights during the Singapore Night Grand Prix so paid more (maybe USD 100 more per night) than regular rates. But we got free internet which was very helpful. But this rate was still far cheaper than what the other hotels in the area were charging during the Grand Prix weekend. And I got upgraded to a better room as I am Priority Gold Card member which was a pleasant surprise. I did not eat a single meal in the hotel but it had a variety of cuisines on offer and a nice, outdoor-style coffee shop for breakfast. The only downside was their in-room dining. It was extremely limited and the one night that I placed an order (at 2:30am!), the said it would take 45 mins due to the rush! At 2:30am! So I canceled it and went to bed hungry. Otherwise, it's a charming hotel with nice rooms and bathroom. I was given a room at the very end of the hotel which was a bit of trek from the lobby. And for the first two nights there was constant banging from the adjoining building which I complained about. The Duty Manager took care of it and ensured that the work stopped till I checked out which was very helpful. It is also adjacent to a Mall so you can always go there for your morning breakfast, coffee or even lunch. It has a 24 hr McDs which also came in good use. The location is nice - next to a subway station which is useful and close to the CDB in case you need to attend a meeting there. So all in all a very comfortable stay with a very helpful and friendly staff. They even helped me get a last minute booking at a hotel in Kuala Lumpur where I was headed next.

Reviews.Title: “A staff full of smiles!”
Reviews.Author: DJ_MJ67
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent a wonderful week at The Intercontinental. Check-in was so fast and easy. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful at all times during our stay. Nothing was ever too much bother, and EVERY staff member whether it be concierge, front desk, housemaids, wait staff at breakfast or at the business centre would always ask after us or greet us with a genuine warmth and sincerity. We really appreciated the late check out, and fresh fruit and bottled water on arrival. Best of all my girlfriend became my fiancee during our stay :-) Thanks to everyone at the Intercontinental. We can't wait to return to your lovely hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my week of luxury at the InterContinental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: beano333
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the InterContinental during a business trip. It was my first time to Singapore so I cannot compare it to other hotels. But I must say, this hotel is one of the best i've ever stayed in! The hotel itself is beautiful, decorated in an old chinese style, which I just loved. The rooms were big-- two queen beds, big bathroom (shower and bath tub). My room was on the 4th floor so it had an outdoor patio (small) that led to the swimming pool. What I enjoyed most was the Club Lounge. It was included in my rate, definitely get this because the service and amenities are unbeatable! Free breakfast (large buffet including omelets made to order). Free drinks and snacks all day. After a long day of meetings it was nice to just unwind at the Club Lounge before dinner. Free internet (broadband/cable) in the room, and free wifi in the lobby and club lounge. The Club Lounge benefits made all the difference. Overall, great hotel, friendly staff, luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: Rawiller
Reviews.Content: We booked a Club room which had everything we needed. The club lounge was excellent, with afternoon tea and evening cocktails included in the price. Breakfasts were excellent, with a great range of food available. The service was very welcoming and professional. It's location was also good, only five minutes from Raffles and the on/off bus stops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Surpasses Expectation”
Reviews.Author: shopsuey
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Intercontinental for 6 nights in September 2009. We had limited expectations of the hotel and Singapore itself as the holiday was only planned to use up frequent flyer points however we were surprised by the level of service and quality of the hotel. We had one slight problem, we booked into the Shophouse rooms, which are an upgrade from the standard room. We had requested interconnecting as we were travelling with children. On arrival we were told that there are no interconnecting rooms for the Shophouse rooms so it was impossible to meet our request. The receptionist offered us to look at the standard room and the shophouse rooms to decided if we wanted to drop back. We were shown the two different rooms by a very friendly concierge who was more than happy to answer any of our questions. The Shophouse rooms were nice but looked tired and were some distance to walk from the lobby. The standard rooms were much nicer, had the same style of bathroom and high ceilings. The rooms we were given were at the front of the hotel and overlooked the swimming pool. Needless to say given that they were interconnecting and nicer we decided to go with them. The hotel gave us free internet in one room for the inconvenience and credited us the difference in the room prices to our account to use for breakfast for the four of us for three mornings. Eating at the hotel is what your would expect from a hotel of this standard with prices to match. We were caught out on the first evening with the buffet dinner as we didn't click that the price quoted did not include both the taxes. This is seen everywhere in Singapore as ++ after the price. There is a good shopping centre connected to the hotel which has a variety of takeaway and eat in restaurants. There is also a supermarket which is handy to buy basic items. Across the road, at the far end on the shopping centre is the Bugis Street markets which are known as the largest in Singapore. You will find lots of cheap clothing and all those 'tacky' and unique gifts to take home. The overall feeling that we had at the hotel was friendly and welcoming. You never passed a staff member without them saying hello and there was always someone there to serve you. The hotel is located within walking distance of several shopping malls and to the Raffles hotel and shopping complex. Well worth the walk to have a Singapore Sling but be warned they are not the cheapest but it is a must do to have a Sling at Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely short stay”
Reviews.Author: nimy
Reviews.Content: I was there for work for only one nite and didnt' get much sleep. However I was very impressed with the service at the hotel. Hotel staffs were nice and helpful. The thing is that I had to go out for dinner with my boss and colleagues and found out that I forgot my mascara! No time to go get it, though the mall was right next to the hotel. I rang up and didn't expect anyone to go get it for me but I was very impressed that the concierge (he's a guy) did do for me. He asked me nicely of which brand and model to get (he got no clue) but then when I returned it was the one I always used. Thank you! Also the bed was very nice, though I didn't spend much time in the room...busy meeting....

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Fountainhall
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Intercon four times on visits to Singapore and each time has been pleasurable and extremely comfortable. On this latest trip, I arrived after midnight following a long 18 hour trip from Honolulu via Tokyo. The room was not quite what I had booked, but when I pointed this out, it was quickly changed - even though the hotel was full. Being on a low floor and facing the pool, I thought that perhaps noise might intrude, but not at all. The room was a haven of peace and quiet, ideal for getting over jet-lag and preparing for meetings. Overall, the ambience and decor is far more restful that the enormous atrium hotels around the Convention Centre. The location is ideal because it has an MRT station within two minutes walk and all under cover. The breakfast buffet is plentiful with a lot of variety. Indeed the breakfast room is more like a cosy brasserie than a hotel restaurant. If I have one small complaint it is the cost of internet use - but that is common now to a lot of hotels, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless..”
Reviews.Author: Platz
Reviews.Content: Standard Intercon fare but this is really spot on. Excellent staff, great location and top facilities. Had a great couple of nights - would certainly return at the first oppurtunity!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice retreat after a long hot day of walking”
Reviews.Author: tidemom
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The price was right, very centralized location, very comfy beds, large bath, beautiful lounge, very relaxing ambiance all around. Watch out for column in bedroom. Stumped my toe a few times on it, but probably had something to do with wine consumption.

Reviews.Title: “Flip flops and a backpack no problems!”
Reviews.Author: BabyAlice
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Inter-Continental hotel many times and have always worn flip flops. I have never been treated poorly by staff and have never been met with a snobby attitude. In actual fact my husband and I will be returning to this wonderful hotel next month after a 2 week trip through Vietnam. This hotel has the best location and the best rooms. The service has never been beaten by any other hotel in the world and I can honestly say I am used to all sorts of travelling. I have travelled first class and I have travelled with a backpack. In actual fact the last 2 times I have stayed at the Inter-Con I have walked in carrying my trusty back pack wearing flips flops and was given the best service I have ever received. Even my back pack was carried up to my room placed nicely on the waiting luggage holder and we were told to have a great trip and enjoy our time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the full five stars”
Reviews.Author: MM2H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in August and picked the hotel for its location and because it was attractively priced via a promotional rate. We had a king-bedded Executive Club room, which was comfortably furnished though showing a little wear and tear around the corners. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the bathroom was clean with a deep, long bath and separate shower, there was no noise from adjacent rooms and everything worked just fine. The ambience in the club lounge was very comfortable and relaxing with prompt, discreet and efficient staff. There were plenty of drinks and an appetising range of nibbles at afternoon tea and cocktails. We took our breakfast there on both mornings as it was included in our rate. We would like to have tried the main restaurant for breakfast as the dishes sounded delicious but the prices were rather scary even by Singapore standards. However, in the club lounge there was a surprisingly wide range of hot and cold foods that changed each day; something other club lounges could learn from and included soya milk and gluten-free cereal, which showed that some thought had gone into it and was a real bonus for me. So it was a pleasant and comfortable stay in a well-located, good hotel with friendly, polite and efficient staff but somehow it lacked sparkle. I'm not complaining and I would stay there again at the right price but it didn't deliver the five-star experience that some other Singapore hotels do so well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: MikeS71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shophouse rooms and the experience was great. Service level is excellent from the moment you enter the hotel. The breakfast menu is also incredible. A great place to stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cranbe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Free due to some inhouse promotion. Overall service is good, got check into the room that I can see the Fireworks without asking them to do that. Clean and luxourious hotel, but expect the service to be 5 stars but would think its at most 4. The checking out took way too long! A long queue quickly formed, would have expected it to be much faster for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: lanjiaolang
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in July. The Good: Very good location, which is 2 min walk to Bugis MRT which is attached to the Bugis Junction Mall, which is attached to the hotel itself. Very good breakfast spread although a bit on the pricey side. Rooms were clean, and very nicely furnished. Nice bathroom with separate shower and bath. The Bad: Receptionist was on the phone for over a minute while i stood there staring at him. Night receptionist told me that parking was chargeable for all guests but the next morning when i asked the day receptionist, she told me it was free. On hindsight, I should have brought up the error to management but it slipped my mind. Asked for 3 electronic keycards but due to some bug, only 2 worked at any one time. Walls are rather thin, so had to keep reminding my visitors to tone down.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: Wildabout
Reviews.Content: It took 3 receptionists half an hour to check me in - even though I was the only person in the lobby. Nobody explained the facilities or even seemed like they knew what they were doing. The room I ended up with (424) had a small yard outside and then a concrete wall 6 feet away - no batural light. Whilst the staff were polite they seemd to have no comprehension about how to actually do anything. I travel a lot (IHG Priority Club Platinum card) and this is the worst IHG hotel I have ever stayed in (even worse than Holidaty Inn Express) - go to the Fullerton

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tamworthy
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 night at the InterContinental in a Shop House Room. Although the room smelt musty and was quite a walk from reception, it was clean and quiet. The Hotel has plenty of Restaurants on site and closeby. I would recommend The Olive Tree and Man Fu Yuan Restaurant in the hotel and there are numerous eateries/restaurants in the Bugis Street Shopping Complex next to the Hotel. The Bugis Street Junction also has a Kinokuniya book shop, which has plenty of English novels/literature. The Intercontinental is quite central. it is close to Raffles City ( 10 minute walk), where you can indulge in western labels and Raffles, for a Singapore Sling. The Singapore Art Museum is nearby. Taxis are very reasonable and a quick and efficient way to travel. Singapore has lost a lot of its Oriental Spirit. It is like Dubai on speed. If you enjoy shopping and high rise buildings, you will enjoy Singapore. If you are a culture vulture who enjoys the real flavour of the Orient, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience & Definitely worth it...”
Reviews.Author: SGPGuy
Reviews.Content: Earlier booked a King Deluxe Rm for SGD196++; two nites under the IHG Great Asia Sale. Checked in just now and paid promotional price SGD90++ and upgrade to Club Rm+Lounge F&B Access. Room 1002 is awesome, I love the bathtub and the view. We are waiting anxiously to enjoy the majestic fireworks during our Singapore's National Day Parade.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quite nice, but......”
Reviews.Author: Microstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Am a 'priority' customer and booked a 'Club' room. Room was adequate and superficially quite clean. Closer inspection revealed dried urine around toilet hinged and loose bath handle fixings - with a rusty fastener and dirt visible. NOT what I expect from a hotel in this price range. Internet access in-room is not included, not even in Club rooms and costs a hefty $30+tax a day. Hotels in this price range need to learn that internet access is an essential for both business and leisure travellers these days and include it in the room rates. I've stayed in much cheaper hotel with included internet access. On arrival the room has ONE bottle of 'free' mineral water - a couple of additional bottles were available, but at a staggering $12+tax each!! This has to be some of the most expensive bottled water on Earth. The Club Lounge was pretty good, but I found the staff to be little cool and officious. When my card didn't work one day I was made to stand outside the Club Lounge by the door whilst the receptionist sorted it out - rather than be allowed to sit down in the entry area! Overall I would rate this as an acceptable hotel within the IHG group, but they do need to try a little harder in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but crazy F&B prices and other fees (i.e. Internet)”
Reviews.Author: MPS_PHL
Reviews.Content: I have spent a lot of time in the hotel. I lived here for hundreds of room nights over a two year period so I know it well. It is a nice hotel with great staff, however... I just left after 6 days at this Intercon. I have not been to the hotel in a year. The prices for F&B and other fees have been really crazy, totally out of alignment with other nice hotels in Singapore. A cheeseburger is $29++, a pizza over $30, local dishes are now over $30++, buffet breakfast is $42++ (I found this out when they argued with me that I didn't have breakfast included. Guest relations came to my room to see my confirmation e-mail after not calling me back for hour and I missed breakfast anyway!). Internet charges are $30 per day ($1/min up to 30 mins with $30 max). $1 per minute is really a dumb pricing plan. Although I have a long history with this hotel, I am not going to recommend it any more because of the price gauging. Someone should tell this hotel that there are many hotels in Singapore that are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ilkka
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent two-night stay at InterContinental Singapore in early July of 2009. We stayed in a premium room which was very comfortable and roomy. Club lounge was quite nice, food/drink selection was a bit limited though compared to other Asian lounges such as in Hong Kong, Bangkok or Bali. Service was efficient, but a bit cool. I can certainly recommend this hote!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: CookieBaby
Reviews.Content: Visited Singapore with hubby and son. The hotel staff were most accommodating! Bought some food that needed to be frozen. Hotel staff most readily offered to freeze the food item for us. Room was clean, amenites well stocked daily. Check-in was a breeze, front desk staff guided us to our rooms even though we arrived at the hotel early 10am. Late check-out was given too. Would recommend the Inter-Continental Hotel to all my friends for their wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: laflafs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a club room, and both my teenage daughter and I really loved this hotel. Quick check in on the club floor, and after dumping our luggage in the palatial room, we were in the club lounge within 10 mins of entering the hotel! After staying in the Ibis on the way to Europe, we quickly worked out that the Inter actually offers much better value.....for an extra S$60( booked on the Inter site), I drank my fill of Long Island Teas, munched on beautiful Camembert, and woke to a truly wonderful buffet breakfast.....thoroughly recommend this place...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden fees. Poor communication. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maddunr
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents at this hotel for their 40th wedding anniversary. Soon after booking through Orbitz, I called the hotel staff to let them know of their arrival and to ask if they could help make this trip memorable for my parents (both pensioners with limited access to cash). They hotel staff (there was a new person every time I sent an email or called) courteously obliged and "upgraded" them. However, when my parents got there, the frontdesk has no idea about the "upgrade". Turns out the lady who offered us the upgrade didn't work there any more! Then, they asked my parents for a "security deposit" of 600 SGD (100 SGD per day). This came as a surprise ( and embarrassment) to my parents who, as mentioned, were retirees with a small travel budget, who were on a trip that was a "gift" to them by me. There was no mention of this when booking the ticket - on Orbitz or on the Intercontinental website. Finally, the hotel staff dropped the deposit to 300 SGD and gave my parents their originally booked room (not the upgrade they had promised). After I called (from the US) and asked them about this confusion, they apologized and "re-upgraded" my parents to some business class thingy. Yeah, my 70 year-old retired parents were dying to use their new business meeting rooms!! Despite all this, my parents have good words for the hotel staff and were very impressed with the cleanliness and quality of the housekeeping staff. Oh, by the way, we are still trying to recover the 300 SGD security deposit that the hotel claims they've released (it's been a month since my parents' return). They're blaming my parents' bank. This begs the question - for a 5-star hotel that charges handsomely for room rates, why even bother collecting a deposit?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Place”
Reviews.Author: doug_co
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a decent affordable hotel in Singapore was a challenge, so we decided to opt for a recommended brand name, and the InterContinental didn't disappoint. Getting there from the Airport couldnt be easier its about a 5 min walk from the Bugis station and from the hotel it was easy to get to Singapore sights on foot, i.e. Little India, Malay Quarter etc. Rooms were decent size, the beds and linen super comfy... so its a good place to recover from jetlag. Although not the cheapest hotel, I would stay here again, but only for short stays, small pool, so limited hanging out there. Service friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good ambience”
Reviews.Author: VPDesu
Reviews.Content: This is located at a very convenient place, well connected... Since it is attached to a Mall, it provides good shopping opportunities even if you are on a business trip and one hasnt planned to do shopping. Service is good and though not out of the way, it keeps upto one's expectations. The room is pretty comfortable with good beds. It's also got a lovely lounge restaurant, made sense to me to meet up with some clients...had a good ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: renmark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favourites, I have the oportunity to travel regularly and I must say not many hotels stay on my mind like this one and all that it has to offer, first class and well worth a look at, I would suggest the Club well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: Welshman_Abroad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first visit to Singapore en route to Australasia as part of an anniversary celebration. I am a Platinum Ambassador member so chose the Intercontinental and booked a Club floor room. On arrival at the lobby we were graciously greeted by a member of staff who chaperoned us to the Club floor reception for check-in. Once there we were offered a drink and the checking – in process was a breeze, as we left the receptionist wished my wife and I a happy stay and a happy anniversary. In our room was a beautiful bouquet of flowers for my wife and the customary fruit and water for my Ambassador status. After a short while I received an apologetic phone call from the Club floor receptionist who had not offered us our Ambassador room upgrade entitlement. Our room was more than adequate and we had already started unpacking so I declined. However, I appreciated the honesty, many hotels, I’m sure, would have let the opportunity go and not have made the offer. The hotel was immaculate, the Club floor was amongst the best I’ve ever had access to, food was beautifully presented and the service was exemplary. The gym was very well equipped and spacious and the pool deck was clean with a pool you could actually swim in. Breakfast in the Club lounge was plentiful, of a very high quality and we were greeted each morning as guests and not numbers. In the evening we made use of the free cocktails and the food was so plentiful that we didn’t need to go out for dinner. This is another huge plus as dining and drink can be very expensive in this city. As we hadn’t visited Singapore previously we didn’t know really what to expect or what was nearby. Within a few hundred yards we found Raffles Hotel and a short walk further brought us to the river and the Raffles landing point. The Merlion fountain is also very close by but a short cab ride is required to catch the monorail or cable car to Sentosa Island. Someone once described Singapore as a sterile Hong Kong, true it is immaculately manicured and well kept, but it has a distinct charm that cosmopolitan Hong Kong doesn’t have. It’s compact and easily walkable, although the heat and humidity will restrict most to walk too far. As for the Intercontinental, it was possibly one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at (and I stay at enough), I would certainly stay again and would recommend it as a high quality, good value base in Singapore. We left wishing we could have stayed longer and looking for an opportunity to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: ckotadia
Reviews.Content: centrally located above bugis and close to imp places for tourists... very classy and elegant... good rooms and decent staff...

Reviews.Title: “Time flew by!”
Reviews.Author: svcindia
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel a few years ago and since we had a very comfortable stay then, we chose to stay here this time too. As expected, we had a comfortable and relaxed stay here. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. We woke up just on time to make it down to the coffee shop for a sumptuous breakfast. Relaxed in our room till noon and went to the nearby shops for a couple of hours. Back at the hotel, we would go to the pool in the late evening after which we went to the nearby restaurants for our dinner. Both restaurants and shops were just a short walk away, and so was the MRT. Our one week stay there, was very comfortable and interesting, and we sure look forward to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wotta location !”
Reviews.Author: gmunish
Reviews.Content: Located right in the middle of a busy shopping area, the Intercontinental surprises you with the levels of efficiency and courtesy extended by the staff. The gym is pretty well equipped and the swimming pool quite decent for a regular traveller to get their daily fill of exercise. The queen sized beds are the most comfortable, with the special cushions ensuring that you get more than a good nights sleep. Though I'm not extra finnicky on the room size, the toilet and the bath area really do justice to the reputation of the hotel. In-room dining choices are plentiful and for a little extra money, the 24*7 wi-fi service and the complimentary breakfast and bar usage make sure that the value for money proposition gets further strengthened. From the front office to the room service to the bell desk, a customer feels like a king in the various touch points within the hotel. Proximity to the CBD also makes it a great value proposition for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: deepsapphyr
Reviews.Content: this was my 3rd visit at this hotel, after a not so good 1st one, where we got changed rooms twice, all too noisy, they gave us a free upgrade to a clubroom, which was excellent, pillow menu, huge bathrooms, beautiful decorated. location is quite okay, next to bugis shopping area, i dont take my breakfast in the hotel but right outside there are plenty of options. to get the best rate, book when you arrive in singapore airport at hotel reservations desk I have managed to always not pay more than 200 SGD

Reviews.Title: “More Praise for an excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UK_Yankee_fan
Reviews.Content: Off on my first trip to Australia I though I would break the Journey with a couple of nights in Singapore - again a first time trip. Arrived on a Friday PM but was told it was a public holiday so the quick taxi ride from the Airport was exceptionaly fast. From arrival the service was excellent - as with other guests I was offerred the up sell of Club Access for Sin$80 - but as only staying a short time decided to decline. Was provided with a "Deluxe" room on the 10th floor with a King Bed. This is probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel that did not cost the earth (c.£100 per night including breakfast and 4pm check out). The Bathroom was exceptional with separate shower and bath. Other recent posters have talked about the excellent location which I can only endorse. I was not there to go shopping so did not miss the "Orchard Road" experience but the link to the MRT would have made travel here very easy. Also the shopping around Bugis (both international stores and local markets at Bugis Street) was enough for a jet lagged tourist. The only complaint - the cost of the high speed internet in the room - although this is not unique in the hotels I have stayed at outside the USA.

Reviews.Title: “A Contrarian View”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggontour
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews for the Intercon there have clearly been a lot of happy clients recently. My overall experience was a little different. I used to stay at this property quite a lot, and always liked the Shophouse rooms in particular. I've considered over the years the property to often be overlooked when people have booked accomodation in Singapore and have, through this forum, recommended that people consider the Intercontinental. With a week to spend in Singapore, and some excellent web rates through Intercontinental Hotels it was time to retest my impressions of the property. The hotel makes a good first impression although as in the past the public room layout always seems a little odd to me. In the past I've noticed that I've used less of the hotel facilities (bars, eating places) than I do in other Singapore hotels (Oriental, Ritz Carlton, Regent, Fullerton) and I'd guess it's because they're rather less obvious and I'd argue rather undersold by the hotel. My original booking for a shophouse room was extended by one day on the day before my arrival. However when I arrived I was told that the Shophouse rooms, although some were available, were undergoing construction work and therefore would be noisy; I could have one - but I certainly wasn't encouraged to take one. Instead I was offered a move to a Deluxe room (that's a downgrade from the Shophouse) and instead was offered Club access for SGD 80 per day. I coughed and pointed out that this was not a very compelling deal. I'd asked about Club access when I'd made my original booking and had been quoted that rate; what was the offset for the downgrade? The price was lowered to SGD 50 a day, and quickly to SGD 40 a day. I agreed, although on reflection - and checking the room rates, this wasn't a great decision on my part. I see that other people recommend the upsell to the Club. I found the Club very busy and the afternoon tea having been seemingly descended on by locusts and little space even in the afternoon. I did speak to the Duty Manager and ask them how many upsells they'd made and he agreed that the Club was busy, but should improve during the week as the overall hotel occupancy was so low (around 25% he suggested). It did improve over the week a little, but on at least one morning I found myself waiting for a breakfast table and the Club was generally busy. It certainly did not feel exclusive. Personally I think that the hotel, in reaching for revenue is selling the Club access a little too widely and rather destroying the concept. Overall the hotel rooms are very pleasant, and the beds in particular excellent. It did seem that staffing was thin, and the room would often not be made up until mid afternoon, and did on more than one occassion need my prompting. Beyond the front desk staff the english language skills weren't strong (unusual in Singapore) which led to more than one protracted conversation with the laundry staff. My recollection of the hotel was of better service and staff; again I suspect that staffing levels may have been reduced given poor occupancy but that's just a guess. I found the front desk excellent, but had issues with the Concierge Desk. Again I had a conversation with the Duty Manager, and he clearly showed interest and did follow up. One benefit to the traveller of the Singapore economic issues is that taxis are more plentiful now and the hotel had a good supply on hand. Easy access to taxis is important and difficult at some other Singapore hotels (The Fullerton!). The location of the hotel is quite good and the MRT not too far, although it's a little longer walk than a first view of a map would suggest, and certainly better than many other hotels. Overall I still would recommend the hotel, although I did miss the Shophouse room and the extra space it provides over the Deluxe. In terms of standards against other major Singapore properties I'd suggrest it's near the top of the second tier (e.g. Hilton, Hyatt) but a long way short of the more upscale (and expensive) propoerties like the Oriental or the Ritz. If you can get a good deal here I'd book it, but I'd think carefully about that Club upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best business hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Adesitraveller
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore often and have stayed at the InterContinental several times. With the exception of the front desk who always attempt to give me a room with twin beds rather than a single king bed as booked, the stay has always been excellent. The rooms are decent sized, clean and comfortable. There is a good pillow menu and the only irritation is the card you need place on the bed asking them to change the linen. Bathrooms are spacious and the water pressure is fairly good. Some rooms do have clogged sinks. Food options are limited and are so so, but there are a lot of options nearby. The breakfast buffet is fairly heavy on choice. What really puts this hotel on top of my list is the quality of service (with the exception of the front desk). The concierage, the restaurant/lounnge staff, room service etc is excellent and always delivered with a big smile. Even a late night request for hot chocolate is attended to immediately and delivered with a warm smile. Now if only they could retrain the front desk....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: FaHCSIA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights after a two week stay in Malaysia and got a good deal on the internet. Booked a club room which gave us access to the club lounge which was quiet and relaxing. The check-in was conducted in the club lounge and we were then shown to our room on the 12th floor. The room was spotlessly clean and looked over the shopping mall. They have a pillow menu so if you are not happy with the pillows on the bed you can choose another type and they will send it to your room.The location is great as you can get on the MRT located right next to the hotel and travel to the airport, good if you have suitcases to carry. The breakfast in the club lounge is great as are the cocktails and canapes. The service from all the staff in the club lounge is friendly and personal especially from Jane the duty manager. I was so impressed with the hotel I joined the Intercontinental Ambassodor Club. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Generally OK”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: Located 10 mins walk from the Convention Centre/Suntec City (head straight down Middle Road and the pedestrian bridge over Nicoll Highway). Arab Street area is around 10mins walk, 20mins walk will get you to the river, and 35mins walk to Chinatown and 25mins in the opposite direction to Little India. So not that bad a location, if you don't mind the walking. Taxi fares are reasonable if you don't want to walk (and watch the weather as rain is common in the afternoon). I was upgraded to a shop house room. Whilst nice (with the historic touch), they are in dire need of a bit of TLC. Plaster and paintwork are showing a lack of attention, and not quite what I expect out of an InterContinental property. The shop house rooms are also a bit of a walk from the lobby, and parts of it are not wheelchair (or baby stroller) accessible, if that is a factor for you. Best to clarify when you check-in. The housekeeping staff are courteous (but for some reason very miserly with bathing soap - I had to ask on two occasions for bathing soap). The front door staff/porters are friendly and helpful. Some of the concierge and front desk staff are a bit indifferent. The Club Lounge is nice, and well laid out with a lot of Perankan woodwork furniture. Nice ambience. The lounge staff are a bit of a hit and miss. Some are very good, some have probably lost the plot on what their job is. The snacks area during the designated times are usually poorly looked after, so you may need to ask them to bring out more if the plates are empty (rather than the staff reacting themselves to empty plates). Bugis junction and Bugis street are right next door, as is a newly opened shopping centre (as of April 2009). Shopping and eating options in most directions. Suntec city and its shopping area are a short walk away for a range of options, as well as Arab Street and the Raffles City Shopping Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: MikkiUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 night at this hotel with our son. The room was nice and the bed was comfy and soft. My husband and son liked the tub very much although I thought it was too high for me to get into. The room was nice and clean and I liked the energy saving feature they had. You needed to put your room card into the slot by the door for the electricity to turn on. So if you are not in your room the electricity is off which I though was so cool. The hotel lobby is beautiful and clean. Taxi service is quick and the concierge was very helpful. Located close to lots of shops, internet cafe couple of blocks down, Mcdonalds. It is connected to a mall which makes it so convenient to get some shopping done and some food although I noticed Singapore has lots of bakeries or pastry stores which is ironic because I heard pastries are expensive there so go figure. I like the clean room, comfy bed and nice bathroom. Least thing that I like is that they had nowhere for me to plug anything in the bathroom, none which I though was odd. They had a weird plug for a shaver but none for hairdryer or hair flat iron. The power is 220V and I needed a converter to get all my electrical hair items to work. No laundry facilities in the hotel and the laundry service cost a fortune. Singapore does not have laundrymats so be prepared to either pay big bucks for the laundry service or go home with your dirty laundry which I did. I was not prepared to pay $4 a shirt for laundry. BTW Singapore dollar is almost the same value as the US $.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance in the bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: cluntks
Reviews.Content: Top notch and excellent quality/price as managed to get a promotional deal of around 200 S$/night incl. breakfast. Arrived at 7AM and got an early check-in without additional charges and with a smile. Every member of staff, and I do mean EVERY, you come across in this hotel has a discreet smile for you - eerie but pleasant surprise. Hotel has a clean, crisp and elegant feel to it once you step foot through one of the numerous entrances (i.e. one going directly into a shopping mall, a main entrance facing the front desk, etc). Pleasant smell to it too. The room - standard deluxe with twin bed (single bed big enough to hold two average sized people). In excellent condition, furniture in top condition, very clean (no dust, floor spotless, bathroom too...), aircon filter clean (for people with sensitive noses). Big bathroom with shower and bath, excellent condition. No complimentary water but extensive choice of tea, coffee... you can safely drink tap water in Singapore. Perfect insonorisation, heard nothing of outside street and neighbouring rooms. Last but not least, amazing beds. Choice of pillows, great mattress and duvet. Staff was also great... turn down service, room clean up, etc. I don't usually say this, but highly enjoyed breakfast. The buffet is a good size. Not too big to make you drowsy and not too small to make you wonder why you would pay 30$ for it. Furthermore, excellent quality. Otherwise there are a lot of options outside the hotel for breakfast. Used the Internet in the room and in the business center. Price for a 24h connection and business center quite steep, like in any corporate hotel. Also keep in mind that Singapore has a lot of wireless spots (mc donalds, starbucks, shopping malls, etc) if you don't want to stay trapped in your room with your laptop. Btw, this hotel isn't in the most reknowned part of Singapore, i.e. Orchard Rd the shopping strand, but might as well. Location is very convenient and there are two metro stations easily reached by foot (2 mins or one about 8 mins). Lots of things to see around Bugis. Just ask the concierge if you're a bit lost. In conclusion, top notch staff, peaceful hotel atmosphere and good rooms. One of the best experiences in Singapore. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I LIKE IT..”
Reviews.Author: EveSingapore
Reviews.Content: I have stay in this hotel last weekend. From the moment we pulled up in the taxi / car, the staff at this hotel treated us like royalty. Every single one of them was friendly, polite - incredible service. The room is elegant. The bathroom is huge. Don't have anything more to say, you are paying for all of it. Over all it awesome. Will want to stay here again soon....

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance.”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie77
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only spent one night here en route from Phuket to London. You walk into an oasis of calm, speedy check in and whisked up to our room on the 12th floor. Very lovely and spacious. Traditional in design but with all modern touches. We were looking towards the Marina area and could just about glimpse the sea. Very well located at Bugis Junction and an internal door with access. Helpful concierge and lovely young men who seemed at every corner to help. We had breakfast included and whilst very nice was not spectacular. Stunning cafes etc with beautiful art works. We would not hesitate to stay here again. Our only criticism was the lack of a top sheet on the bed, the duvet was just too much for us. However they do offer a pillow menu with a huge variety to choose from. There was no complimentary bottled water but actually is is safe to drink tap water in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Club upgrade is worth it”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Nice property! Got "upsold" the club access at check-in and it was worth it, great breakfast and free unlimited internet access in the ;ounge. Very nice and helpful staff in the Club Lounge Area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RagazzaDelVino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about one week at approximately $200/ni. Guest services was top notch! Room was clean, decorated nicely, spacious bathroom w/ separate tub and shower (great toilettries - Elemis!) Location couldn't have been better with Bugis MRT AND shopping mall right there. Loved that the Bugis Junction had a small grocery store in the basement level - we got lots of snacks and drinks there! Loved the complimentary pillow menu/service. Professional babysitting service was fantastic at $10/hr ($15/hr after 11pm+$20 transportation). Felt no worries whatsoever when babysitter arrived; so glad husband and I were able to have a date night out in town! Pool was great w/ fresh towels always available. Fitness room was ok; machines weren't being wiped down after each use and there was nothing there (spray bottle, towels) to do it yourself. Other than that, highly recommend for families w/ children! Would go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business stays”
Reviews.Author: amit_199
Reviews.Content: Very nice property.really liked stayinghere.felt very home like. nice breakfast & excellent location to move across the city Rooms are nice and so are the people

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jbearKent
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay. Good accommodation and fantastic service from all staff. The hotel is also in a great location, very central with many great places to eat nearby. Lovely pool area up on 4th floor, peace and calm away from bustle of city streets below.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jaguar08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Singapore for one night on 18 January 2009. This turned out to be one of the best hotel stays I have had!! Check-in was exceptional. Fast, efficient and most importantly friendly. The check-in staff have small talk down to a fine art, with the ability to make the guest feel, well, at home. From reception I was escorted to my room by a customer relations officer who introduced me to many of the hotels facilities on the way. Customer service second to none. The room itself was very comfortable. Size-wise one of the largest single rooms (L-shaped) I have stayed in with dining table and a comfortable lounge area. Spotlessly clean with welcome fruit and the usual letter from management. My favourite feature remains the "pillow menu" from which I selected the lavender-infused pillows :) I should also mention that sound-proofing between rooms and between the room and passage was excellent. Bathroom was well equipped with Elemis products, which were replenished after my shower on arrival. The hotel itself is located at an indoor-outdoor (covered) shopping complex and was close to the subway - a couple of stops from Orchard Road. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Singapore and will stay here again myself whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Review from a travel professional”
Reviews.Author: MartinK72
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore for 3 nights. We were hesitating to book this hotel because of its location. On previous trips we had always stayed at hotels near Orchard Road. But I can assure you, after staying at this hotel, it is a better location to be! There is a small shopping mall with a large food court and an MRT station just next to the hotel. The backdoor of the hotel opens directly into the shopping arcade which means that even if it rains you can get food or do some shopping without getting wet. We had booked a standard room at the 7-day advance rate without breakfast. The difference between the room only and breakfast rate was nearly USD 100.00 so that we decided to get breakfast locally in the morning.
