But as a surprise the hotel offered us an upgrade package on arrival (USD 55.00 per room per night) which gave us a room on the Club floor with access to the Club lounge, which offers a full breakfast buffet in the morning (very good selection) and drinks and snacks throughout the day. The package also includes free internet (via cable) in the room and wireless internet in the lounge. My favourite hotel in Singapore always used to be the Grand Hyatt Hotel, but I would certainly go back to the Intercontinental again. The price difference between the two hotels is usually around USD 200.00 per night, which is definitely not worth paying! If you are able to get the Intercontinental at the same rate as us with the upgrade, it’s fantastic value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coasttraveller
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the Intercontinental during our 5 day stay. Our room was overlooking the Bugis Junction and was top quality and very spacious. The service was outstanding and the concierge were very helpful in giving directions. The pool was excellent and towels were laid out daily. The location was very good with easy access to the MRT just a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Prestigious Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TunbridgeWellsTrevor
Reviews.Content: Rooms are excellent and of the highest quality. The service is extremely attentive. The pool is open air and first class. The gym is a little small for such a large hotel. I had access to the executive lounge. This is well worth doing as it includes breakfast in this exclusive lounge and there is top quality snacks and free drinks in the early evening. Drinks are expensive in Singapore and so this is well worth the modesst extra charge for the upgrade. The hotel joins the Bugis Junction Mall which has mostly teen orientated shops. It is also a main metro station. Across the road are some great local and other Asian restaurants. Cheap and very good. You will get a good inexpensive meal there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LondonDj
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in the taxi, the staff at this hotel treated us like royalty. Every single one of them was friendly, polite - incredible service. We had a club room which was huge - huge bed, huge bathroom, fantastic view. The club lounge was fantastic -a nice quiet place to take a few minute rest before heading back out. The location makes it easy to walk everywhere, but public transport is on the doorstep if needed. The room and the public areas were all spotless and well maintained. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Kriselda
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night, but more would have been welcome. High level of service and very attentive staff. It was the friendliness of staff and willingness to help that left a big impression. Next to Bugis shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: MtbLamb
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for two nights in late February, the room was lovely and very large and aside from having to move from a smoking room to a non-smoking room (as per our booking request) everything was in order. The bathroom is large and the shower is great (the bathroom has both a bath, a separate shower and lots of bench space). There were plenty of food options within the hotel with many more in the shopping centre right next to the hotel. The hotel food is of very good quality and presentation but typically pricey, for light meals or snacks go to 'Aromas' which sells coffee, muffins, pastries, bread etc and they have lots of deals which work out very cost effective. The train system can be accessed from the shopping centre next door and the hotel is very convenient to the freeway system making transport to the airport or Sentosa very easy. The only real negative is that service varied from great to average with this lack of consistency a minor detraction from our otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: luckyme58
Reviews.Content: Heading says it all, we were lucky to spend 4 nights at this hotel in a club room. The service was terrific and all at a great rate. I received a quote direct from the hotel which was better than anything online. When we arrived everything was terriffic from our luggage being delivered to the room without asking our name to our check in at the club lounge, then once we had a drink they took us to a room, and what a bed. Towels changed 3 tiimes a day, great food in the lounge all the staff were great, only down side is the drinks in the Victoria bar were a bit expensive, but I think that goes for all hotels in Singapore. Would deffinately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “First class accomodation and customer service.”
Reviews.Author: KC95
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the Uk at 07.00am Singapore time tired and a little weary. The staff on the reception were pleasant and efficient and within 10 minutes we were escorted to our room which was a bonus at that time of day. We had booked a Shophouse room which was well appointed and very spacious and comfortable. It had everything we needed for our stay. The only slight downside was that the tiles in the bathroom were a little tired and detracted from the overall ambience of the room. This was a minor point and one that didn't trouble us to much. The hotel itself was well placed and right on top of Bugis junction shopping mall which made access to the MRT a breeze. This made navigating around the city simple. The breakfast at the hotel was excellent with a huge choice to eat and excellent service. there could simply be no complaints on that score. We did not eat in the hotel or enjoy drinks there as we wanted to experience the city and to be fair the hotel is not the best cost effective option for food and drink. If I was returning to Singapore I would have no hesitation in returning to the Intercontinental and I would be happy to recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “My best Intercotinental hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kasukabe0302
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Intercotinental Singapore for 1nights on 1st of this month. It was wonderful and memorable stay for me! I reserved a shophouse suite room on Priority Club Rewards(PCR) website. As I'm ambassdor member of PCR, the room I stayed was upgraded to ambassdor suite room. It was very big (129㎡）and clean. King size bed was really comfortable. It looked out of Merlion and skyscraper in Sigapore. It was very nice view. Club lounge was renovatied last year. It is located on 2nd floor. It was very big . It's maybe more than three times club lounge of Intercontinental hotel in Japan. Two computers(English version) were equipped at club lounge. Location is very good. I went to Long Bar at Ruffles hotel. It was cloth to Intercotinental. Hotel is connected with MRT Bugis station directly. What made me impressed was helpful staff. When I went sightseeing,they gave a good advise. Especially ,chef concierge Al and Anita,staff at club lounge took good care of me. My return flight to Japan was very late. I was at a loss what to do after checking out the hotel. Anita suggested me I go shopping cloth to hotel and enjoy tea time and evening cocktail though I had already checked out. That was good help for me. I 've stayed at several Intercotinental hotels , for example,New york ,Boston, Toronto ,Hong kong ,Japan. Singapore I like the best . I'm looking forward to staying again! .

Reviews.Title: “Regular if I have the choice”
Reviews.Author: pelachi
Reviews.Content: I sometimes get a choice of hotels when I go to Singapore and my first pick is always the Intercontinental because of my priority club privileges. The location is very convenient for everything (but then again Singapore is not so big so everything is convenient really....). There is an "old style colonial" feel to the hotel and the rooms. The standard rooms are quite spacious but recently I have been staying in the "shop-house" rooms which are very big but off in that they are within a shopping mall so you see into the shopping mall and the people shopping can see you. Also, the shop house rooms are somewhat far away to walk with luggage particularly due to some stairs. The food is excellent but overpriced. The location is very convenient for shopping, dining and various other entertainment (sim lim is 10 minutes walk, raffles and chijmes is 5 minutes away, food court and movie theatre in the shopping mall etc etc). The rooms are great but the value is relative. I have paid more when staying near the convention centre for an equally good room and I have paid less when staying further away from the hub-bub in a similarly good room.

Reviews.Title: “great service, gorgeous new club lounge”
Reviews.Author: travelg
Reviews.Content: Had a stay here over Christmas and thoroughly enjoyed myself. The new club lounge on the second floor is one of the largest and nicest of the Intercontinentals I have stayed at recently. As an Ambassador member, I booked a club room and got upgraded to a suite and no problem was too small. Food was excellent and the location and proximity to restaurants and MRT was great. recommended

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor”
Reviews.Author: Donna1963
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 3 nights over Chinese New Year - on our way back to Australia from Phuket. The decor was beautiful - especially the ceilings. The staff were excellent and could not do enough for us. The location was good - close to shops and MRT. The pool was lovely and everywhere was very clean. Our package included buffet breakfasts and there was a great range of lovely foods. The only problem we had here was that our tea/coffee order was taken as soon as we were seated, however it didn't usually arrive until well after we had finished eating. I think this needs to arrive much earlier. Other than that - it was always a truly lovely breakfast in this restaurant. There were two bottles of water in our room on arrival - thank goodness the kids didn't open either of them before I checked - because they were $12.00 each!!! This is ludicrous. The other ridiculously over-priced part of this hotel was down in the Lounge Bar. We stopped in one night on our way back to our room. We almost fainted when we saw the price list but due to a lost camera during the day - I really needed a glass of wine!! We ordered 1 Rum & Coke, 1 glass of wine, 1 orange juice & 2 iced chocolates for the pricely sum of $94.50. I chose the cheapest Sav Blanc on the menu which I think was $23.00 per glass - the waitress came back with the bad news that they had none of that particular choice left so the next cheapest Sav Blanc was $26 per glass!! I gritted my teeth and ordered it. You would expect to receive a full glass for this price - but no - it was only approx one third full. No wonder this area was almost empty every time we went past. The beds were the most comfortable any of us had ever slept on.

Reviews.Title: “Shophouse room - a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Pochi
Reviews.Content: We, a family of three including our 2-year-old daughter, had a long-weekend-get-away in Singapore to do some shopping, to have some nice meals and also to visit a couple of friends. Having been to Singapore dozens of times, I have tried a number of different hotels and have had good, as well as not-so-good, experience. In short, I was happy that we chose Intercontinental this time. Firstly, the location is perfect. Shops, shops and shops - plus lots of restaurants of various tastes are around the hotel. MRT is a few minute walk. Breakfast was delicious, with a large choices to pick up. Also, the staff were nice and warm. Our daughter got a fever and we needed to take her to a doctor and the front desk quickly guided us to go to the nearby Ruffles Hospital. The shophouse room is elegantly decorated. As our daughter was not feeling well, we spent quite some time in the room, which was not bad thanks to the comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: shildon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. Our flight arrived very early in the morning, and we were given our room - a wonderful room - as soon as we arrived at the hotel. The person checking us in was wonderful, as were all the staff with whom we dealt. Everyone was very helpful, including with table preferences for breakfast, assistance with directions and assistance with our departure. The breakfasts were excellent with much variety and a different selection each day. The fitness facilities are ample and also excellent. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Presidential Life”
Reviews.Author: TheRoamingBrit
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We booked one night at the Intercontinental Singapore to stay in one of their Shop-House Suites, complete with Executive Club Benefits. Upon arrival at the beautiful and newly refurbished Club Lounge, we were warmly greeted by two extremely polite staff members, who swiftly checked us in. We were informed that we had received a room upgrade compliments of the hotel, and we were now in a ‘much larger suite’. After being escorted to the top floor of the hotel, large double doors greeted us with a small sign reading ‘Presidential Suite’. In disbelief, the doors were opened, and sure enough we were there, staying in the one and only, Presidential Suite. Decked with traditional fabrics, and a mix of Chinese and Western furniture and antiques, this really was luxury at its best, complete with large sitting room, a huge four poster bed, an enormous spa bath and our very own personal sauna. With an exceptional room, faultless service, and wonderful afternoon tea, evening cocktails, and breakfast all served in the Club Lounge, this really was a stay to remember; a late check-out to 6.00pm really was the ‘icing non the cake’…

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: travellerp3
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Singapore was brilliant. The delightful staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel itself is luxurious without being over-the-top opulent. Very relaxing surroundings and a convenient location with Clarke Quay 10 minutes walk away, and a MRT station just next door. The buffet breakfast is a must, and there is a lovely outdoor heated pool. Looking forward to coming back to the Intercon!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the InterContinental when in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: alohatripper
Reviews.Content: Jan. 17-18, 2009 After disembarking from our cruise ship, we wanted to see more of Singapore. We chose the InterContinental based upon TripAdvisor reviews and the high-value promotional going on now. We paid about $160 US for a Shop house double that included a sumptuous breakfast and a 20% discount off property dining. The public and private areas are grand and meticulously maintained. The concierage and front desk personel are very helpful and genuinely friendly. They seemed very well informed. We departed early on the second day. The hotel provided complimentary room service in lieu of the breakfast buffet. Other touches included slippers, bathrobes, turndown service, a tub and a shower, and high-end toiletries. We couldn't be happier staying there all day, but this being Singapore, we were gone most of the day. It was so satisfying knowing that we'd be returning each day to the InterContinental. Adjacent is the Bugis Street and Station area where you can shop and eat, or depart on the MRT to the Night Safari or Jurong Bird Park. Taxis that queue in front were almost as inexpensive, especially for two. We'd return to the InterContinental again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TNKirk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days recently. Good location (very convenient to Bugis station metro stop, good shopping near by). Everything you would expect from an Intercontinental hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jer21xxxx
Reviews.Content: For under CAD 200 per night, this was good value for a Singapore 5 star. The location is very good. Walking distance to many attractions and attached to a (rather bland) shopping mall and subway station. Doorman and bellhop service was very good although the reception desk agent was obviously unwell or troubled that day. The room was pleasant and attractively furnished although wear and tear was starting to become noticeable. The marble-clad bathroom was nice and well-stocked. Didn't even open the mini-bar. Thought about having breakfast at the hotel until I saw the eye-watering prices for their standard buffet. Upon check-out, I left my cell phone in my hotel room. I had already gotten into my taxi when I told the bellhop and he raced to go get it. I had my phone back in my hands in mere moments.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service; Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: bilbelseb
Reviews.Content: Our extended family (3 kids, 5 adults) stayed for three nights from 9 January at the Intercontinental. Because I had "special needs" (interconnecting room, wheel chair, late check out and handicapped room) I contacted the hotel directly to book our stay. The first impression of dealing with the IC proved to be correct: they provide excellent, prompt service and aim to please. Not only did I receive confirmation of my special needs, I also had a price that was better than offered on their own website (average SGD 205 per room per night including fantastic buffet breakfast and tax for all eight of us). Another example of service: my children had somehow broken a wheel on our suitcase. When their engineer couldn't fix it, they found someone in Singapore who could, and they had it fixed within four hours and for a reasonable charge. I also remember queuing to check out: the minute someone saw me waiting (even though I wasn't in a hurry) they immediately went behind the counter and dealt with my checking out. I really admire that focus on service. Rooms were very nice: flat panel tv, very quiet (even the a/c was not that noisy), good sized bathroom, and the most comfortable bed I can ever recall sleeping in. The fitness area was not huge but perfectly adequate. We actually thought the pool was fine - just what our three kids needed after a morning's walk through nearby Arab Street. To me the best part of the hotel is its location - 10 minutes to the National Museum and Arab Street area (a real quiet jewel in Singapore), less to Raffles, good shopping and food right there (with a Chinese and Indian temple close by for the culture hungry). I contrasted this with some of the other hotels in the Marina area, which looked like they were on busy roads with little atmosphere around them. Sure, you still have to taxi to Chinatown and the Quays, but the Bugis area just has a real "city" buzz with an elegant hotel right in the middle of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: aimantakkisah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on the 7th of Jan 2009 for 2 nites. Took the taxi from Changi Airpot which cost about SGD22. The hotel is situated near the Bugis MRT STation which is connected to the hotel near the Bugis Shopping Centre. You could find many eateries near the hotel. It is 10 minutes walk to Arab Street and 10 minutes to CIty Hall in the other direction. The room was clean and decorated in a peranakan style. The laundry and other service provided was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Regin Lagaac, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: reginlagaac
Reviews.Content: One of the very best hotels in Singapore, walking distance from Suntec Shopping Mall and nearby by Bus Station, wide range of restaurant accross the area. My room is amazing, computerised and with wide screen plasma TV (although I'm not using because I'm out all the time, sound protected room, you can't hear anything from outside, breakfast is yummy with wide range of food selection from Asian to English etc... Bar is good, staffs are very friendly and fluent in English. When I will come back in Singapore... I will stay again in this Hotel. I'll be home to Philippines soon today and waiting for my flight. Regin Lagaac, Cambridge University nhs Trust, UK Contact me: Regin Lagaac, Clinical Nurse Specialist, Cambridge University Hospital, UK rlagaac@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen by reference to our travel agent, the Qantas Holiday brochure, Tripadvisor, location and cost. We stayed here (2 couples, 2 adult children and grandmother – in 3 rooms [2 doubles; one connecting with the triple room]) for 8 nights after Boxing Day, including New Year’s Eve 2008/09. The location was pretty good, considering you can’t be close to everything. We were right at Bugis Street and a huge shopping mall was connected to the hotel (including a massive food court and an MRT station). Raffles, the Marina Bay area (including the New Year’s Eve festivities and fireworks), Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, some of the historic sights (Raffles landing site, Parliament House, Supreme Court, Victoria Theatre, City Hall, St Andrew’s Cathedral, the Singapore Cricket Club, Fort Canning, etc), many shopping malls (eg, Funan the I.T. Mall and Suntec City Mall) and the Equinox Bar on the 70th floor (or so) of the Swissotel were all within walking distance. The underground MRT is easy to navigate, and with a station on our doorstep, places like Chinatown, Newton Circus, Little India and Orchard Road were also within easy reach. Having previously only stayed on Orchard Road, I was a little reticent staying this far away from that area, but it was no difficulty whatsoever. The rooms were large and well appointed, as the photographs will attest, with a large comfortable bed, flat screen TV, fridge and minibar, desk and internet connection (cable and wireless), safe, coffee/tea and a large bathroom with bath and separate shower. Room service was quick to bring ice, and the lifts were amongst the fastest to arrive. We used the gym (bikes, cross trainers, treadmill, free weights and machines) regularly, as well as the pool and hot and cold spas. Overall, it was pretty expensive, but Singapore seems to be generally so and we had a package for 7, so I really can’t comment on value for money. However, the accommodation was really very good. I’d stay here again as a couple or group/family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but I expected more personal touch”
Reviews.Author: tambalyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel as a stop-over on my trip to Siem Reap. The Intercontinental hotel is definitely a great hotel. It is very well located, close to a mall and an MRT station (Bugis). It is also a short walk to the Esplanade area or even to the Arab district and Little India. I cannot faul the hotel for anything about its features and amenities. Big room, soft bed and pillows, big bathroom, flatscreen tv. I was a bit turned off though by the fact that they didn't provide complimentary water for their coffee-making facilities. One bottle was 12SGD! :) A small detail as it may seem (and the fact that water from the tap is safe to drink in Singapore), I think that would have been an extra most appreciated by the guests. The hotel breakfast was good, with a wide variety of choices. While I had some little problems with my booking thru Asiatravel, I got a prompt reply from the hotel when I emailed them direct and I didn't have problems with checking-in. In general, the hotel is great, the staff is good, but I had expected a little extra from the staff service. I noticed the stark difference from the very warm welcome I got from Swissotel Merchant Court on my stay coming back from Siem Reap. It seemed that I really was welcome and the interaction with the staff seemed more sincere instead of just standard procedures. Nevertheless, I still highly recommend Inter Continental Hotel and would even stay there again primarily because of its great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the Intercontinental the service is everything and more that you would expect from a hotel of this standard. Every member of staff we encountered during our stay was a credit to the hotel,we were greeted on every occasion we saw a staff member with a smile and polite greeting. This hotel really has a wow factor, loads of marble and ornate furnishings through the entire hotel. Our room was beautifly presented and large with a very comfortable bed and a good size flat screen tv, the bathroom was very clean and spacious with a full size bath and seperate shower probably one of the best we came across on this trip. Overall we were made to feel very welcome in this hotel and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Internet Access Too Expensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hamill67
Reviews.Content: I concur with most of the complimentary reviews about the IC. Excellent service from an extremely polite staff. Great value for a 4 star hotel. That said, I do believe the internet is far too pricey and they do not have wireless in the rooms. I would not mind paying 50 cents a minute if it were wireless but from a ethernet cable?

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 5 star, everything you expect from INTERCONTINENTAL, but no more”
Reviews.Author: BEEPfromPARIS
Reviews.Content: At 335 SGD room only (directly from their website), all inclusive, weekend rate, The INTERCONTINENTAL Singapore delivered everything we expected. But at this friendly rate, expect no, ABSOLUTELY NONE, extras, not even internet connection (30 SGD++ per 24h), nor breakfast. This said, if you don’t need to be connected 24/7 to the web, bring your own laptop, and SINGTEL is available for free everywhere outside. Also, have your breakfast, at anytime of the day or night, of any kind, at half price, anywhere on this island where eating is a religion. We liked : 1 – LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. So conveniently situated almost above the BUGIS MRT station, which is direct to/from CHANGI airport. The INTERCONTINENTAL has one side of its lobby open to BUGIS Junction, where thousands of shops can be found. It is Sunday everyday as it draws waves of crowds from morning till night. On the North Bridge rd side of the hotel, look for LANG SEAH st, where you’ll find street vendors serving inexpensive and water mothering exotic dishes. 2 – Luxurious, newly refurbished and pleasantly large (30-35 ?), the “basic” room we had highly deserved the name of INTERCONTINENAL. Double bathroom with tub and shower. Extra comfortable bed with soft linen. 3 – Enormous safe that can fit 2 17’ laptops and all your electronic stuffs. Never seen so far such a vast safe. We did not like : - The lovely lobby is in fact vast bar, so you are kindly asked to order, something, if you want to sink into one of the sofas. Otherwise, the waitresses will invite you to wait in front of the reception desk, where you’ll find a few uncomfortable chairs. TIPS 1 – SINGTEL gives away free wifi connection, at almost all outlets throughout the island, so bring your own laptop, sit down, and surf. To take advantage of this service, you must sign in before, so take a few moments to have all informations (passport number, name, address, mobile phone…). On the bad side, it looks like INTERCONTINENTAL had made everything possible to prevent us from connecting into SINGTEL, from our room. 2 – Taxis: There is an abrupt surcharge of 35% from the meter, on weekdays during rush hours (0700 to 0930 mon fri – 1700 to 2000 mon sat).

Reviews.Title: “Made our vacation”
Reviews.Author: wwtravelerRochester
Reviews.Content: An Oasis in Singapore. We arrived after midnight with a regular room reservation. The reception desk suggested we upgrade to the club floor. Because we were tired and were going to have breakfast in the hotel anyway we agreed. It turned out this was the best money we ever spent. The club floor room was beautiful with a great view of Singapore. It had a separate shower and bath, great towels and bathrobes and the most comfortable bed. The club floor lounge was gorgeous. The breakfast was very good. The added benefits of having afternoon tea and early drink time made the lounge a great benefit. One night we over indulged with the great food at the cocktail hour and decided to miss dinner. The managers of the lounge made sure they knew our names and made sure we were always welcome. So while Singapore is a great City State, the hotel made the vacation special. We look forward to coming back next year

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel. An excellent choice for families.”
Reviews.Author: AsiaLou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and really enjoyed our time here. We have stayed in 9 hotels in Singapore over the last 2 years (4* and above) and this was easily the nicest. Good pool too. (Great, big sun lounger beds! Which we would have used had there been sun!) The staff were helpful and friendly, the room was spacious, comfortable and tastefully decorated (great bathroom too!) The breakfast was amazing- a huge selection of fruit, cheeses, cold meats, bread, pastries and freshly prepared hot food. The location was excellent really close to shops and the MRT (although the hotel was peaceful) The weekend we were there it poured with rain but we were able to shop and travel from the hotel without getting wet because of the mall directly outside- even included a good food-court too. This was brilliant with children in tow - not too much walking! What really made this hotel for us though were the lovely public areas - and children's films available to 'rent' in the guest rooms! It is rare to find such nice lounge areas (especially attractive just now with all the Christmas decorations) which are really conducive to sitting socialising over a drink. We will definitely be back here- soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “I love Inter Continental Hotel services”
Reviews.Author: foreda
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good. The services are almost excellent. The reception staff are sometimes a little cold but always ready to help you. Business center had good breakfast but some of the hotel guest are snob there and if you are not a business traveler it can bother you. There are some special clients which are be behaved better than you, there. Anyway the rooms are nice. Shop house and tower rooms are nice and most important there is a high quality isolation so you are in the center but you do not hear the noise. The bathroom SPA products are very nice. The business center work very well near the reception. Nice swimming pool after the hot of Singapore. The breakfast in room is poor and very expensive. The Inter Continental of Bali is better but this hotel in generally nice and there is serenity after the crowded and hot Singapore, you can relax when you make stop over. There is a mall just next or almost inside the hotel where you can find everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Inter Continental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: robert270
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Singapore Inter Continental on Dec. 1, 2008. There are two types of room you can book, either a tower room or a shop house room. I prefer the tower room. I have stayed at this property 4 times already, and each time I am very satisfied with the quality or the service, staff, and the room. Everything is 5 star, clean, and well kept up. The Tower rooms have been updated in the last 2 years with new flat panel TV's, Carpet and furnishings. Try to get a corner room if possible. Nice layout. The Shop house rooms I find to be a bit noise, because they are closer to the street. I did visit the club lounge which was just re-opend 6 months ago after an extensive renovation. I just went to look at it, because I did not pay extra for access. The Club is Beautiful! It is not cheap to stay in the club, but definitely worth the splurge if you are so inclined. I Paid 220 Singapore Dollars per night ( Leisure weekend rate) which came with a lovely buffet breakfast each morning. The Breakfast is 5 star. Great food, and great professional service. You can drink all the fresh Cappucino you want included in price. Many Many dishes to chose from at the buffet table. I highly recommend this hotel. The Location is fantastic. It is in the center of Singapore, and a short ( $3.00 US Dollar) cab ride to the orchard road shopping area. Although there is plenty of good sight seeing and shopping right outside your door. The staff is extremely responsive to all guests needs. The Lobby area is beautiful white marble throughout, with high high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows. They have a piano playing at night during cocktail hour and high tea. The hotel is extremely well kept, and extremely clean. Beds are very comfortable with huge down pillows. Great Mattress, Flat Panel LCD and I Pod docking.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.....there is much better for the same price in Singapore..”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel and the rooms are old and small. I would not recommend this hotel. There is better in Singapore. Advice: Book a room at the Marina Mandarin. The rooms are larger, have a balcony and closer to the city (better views too). See my review for Marina Mandarin. Downfall: Food, service, rooms.... the stay was ordinary. Food esp. was bad. Dan

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kimonio
Reviews.Content: The Inter Continental was my home for a week. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Firstly, the location of this hotel was ideal. It was opposite Bugis Markets and within a mall. There was an MRT station about 200m away (airconditioned and undercover walk-way). I caught the MRT whenever I could - even to the airport. It was very convenient. I never ate any meals in the hotel as I wanted to try all the local food. My breakfasts every morning were at the Kaya Toast restaurant on the way to Bugis station. If I ran late for dinner, I grabbed something from one of the outlets in the mall. There was a grocery store, department store and even a movie theatre within the precicnt. There was also an FX dealer near the movie theatre which exchanged money without transaction fees. Therefore, this hotel was extremely convenient and central to anything that I may want or need. My room was immaculate. Not much of a view, but I guess I can't have it all. Whoever cleaned my room, even lined my shoes and belongings in order (maybe even used a ruler to ensure things were perfect). It seemed that they had a staff member everywhere you looked, to greet you and answer any questions you may have. Their concierge was most patient at explaining things to me and making bookings for me. My trip in Singapore was hassle-free because of their help.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I chose the Intercontinental for a last-minute 2-day trip to Singapore in early November, and I'm very glad I did. I've stayed in some of Singapore's top hotels, including Raffles, Ritz-Carlton, and Mandarin Oriental; and I was a bit concerned that the Intercon would suffer in comparison. Happily, it did not. The only minor sour note occured when I was checking in and I asked the clerk about the 4 p.m. late checkout ("subject to availability") mentioned as part of the weekend rate I'd booked. The clerk said there was nothing in the "system" about this, and a second staffer, who'd come to take me up to my room, reiterated the "availability" line (of which I was already aware) and said she'd let me know later. I politely but firmly asked her to check and let me know before heading up to my room, as my return flight was not until after midnight on my checkout day. She quickly confirmed the late checkout availability, and all went very well from that point on. Hotel: The Intercon is a 13-year-old midrise located in Bugis very near Raffles and a short walk or taxi ride to most of the city's attractions and interesting neighborhoods. All the public areas are attractive and spotless, and the hotel's decor is very smart if rather generic. The Intercon eschews the grandeur of the Ritz-Carlton and Oriental and is more reminiscent of the simple luxury of the Four Seasons. Room: I had a standard ("Deluxe") room on the 6th floor, and while I thought that that might be a bit lacking, I was again pleasantly surprised. While not huge, at about 35 sq. meters, my room was just right: very comfortable, spotless, and more understated luxury -- in short, the Intercontinental mien at its best. The large bathroom was done in marble, with a big, separate tub and walk-in shower. The room had a large, triple bay window; and the view of the surrouding buildings in Bugis was quite nice. The bed was very comfortable, as one expects in Intercons. The hotel had even provided a small bowl of complimentary fruit and a bottle of Evian. The only drawback to the room was the internet service: wired (no wifi, at least from the hotel) broadband with adequate speed but an annoying feature: having to reopen the startup pay-as-you-go page with each new session, even after paying for a 24-hour block of time. Nor was this cheap: SGD 30 (about US$ 21) for the 24 hours. But the Intercon's not alone in charging high ratees for internet access. I'm hopeful that five-star chains will follow the Peninsula's lead in providing complimentary internet service in all rooms. But this was a minor quibble, and overall, I was very satisfied with my "basic" Intercon room. My rate of SGD 220 included breakfast and the aforementioned late checkout, and it was actually cheaper than the cheapest room-only rate at the time I booked. Staff and service: With the small exception of my initial checkin query, all of the Intercon's staff were very pleasant, friendly, and helpful. The concierge recommended an excellent seafood-speciality Chinese restaurant (Jumbo) on the waterfront for chili crab; out of this world, and I highly recommend it. The staff at Olive Tree, where I took breakfast, were equally helpful; and the food there was excellent, with a wide choice of fresh western and Asian dishes. Bottom line: I'd recommend the Intercon to anyone visiting Singapore. It's a true five-star (maybe even plus) hotel that, at least at promotional or weekend rates, is a real value compared to more famous Singapore properties that may or may not warrant their higher prices. The Intercon feels smaller than it is (I think it has close to 500 rooms), and the staff make guests feel welcome and special. Well done, Intercontinental Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Samba52
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this wonderful hotel. As I was arriving very early morning after a long flight from Germany, I found my room to be ready at arrival. There was no extra charge for this service. The rooms are spaceous and the bathroom spotlessly clean. There was no noise to disturb my sleep. I found all crew very friendly and ready to help at all times. I can really recommend this property and will definetely come back again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 1 night at the Intercontinental Singapore and I couldn't fault them. Upon entering the hotel you are immediately uplifted by the smell of fresh lemongrass which wafts through the air. Check in was smooth received an upgrade to a Premier Room (although it was a smoking room, they did provide an air purifier for the room). The room was large with views over the Bugis area. The king size bed was very comfortable and there were nice Elemis products in the bathroom. The hotel is connected to the Bugis Junction shopping mall, providing easy access to the Bugis MRT which is just underneath, no more than a few minutes walk to the hotel. Taxis to and from the airport cost around SGD $25. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the City Centre, Raffles City and Little India. Chinatown is only a few stops away on the MRT. Breakfast at the Olive Tree Restaurant consisted of your standard hotel buffet. All tastes, full English, continental or Asian breakfasts catered for. And service was friendly and efficient. I do however agree with the other reviews on the relatively steep pricing on items within the hotel, such 12 dollars for a bottle of water, where just around the corner there's a 24 hour store selling bottled water for far less. Overall, I had an extremely enjoyable stay at the Intercontinental Singapore and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Steeply uphill after horrible check-in”
Reviews.Author: Dutchie42
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Intercontinental Singapore for three nights in October while on a business trip. I had booked the room through my travel agent at work but was paying for it myself since it was a private extension of my business trip. The receptionist was exceptionally rude and would not believe that I had booked through my work (they have a discounted rate), she insisted that I had booked over the internet. She did not honor my request for a king bed but the room was nice and there was a good size bathtub so I wasn't totally unhappy. All in all, I got the room for a good price but it wasn't a very nice welcome at the Intercontinental. The concierge was very helpful in pointing me and my colleagues where to go and getting us cabs. The pool was small but refreshing, and even though I have to agree with previous reviewers that there wasn't a towel that didn't have loose threads hanging from it, they were very soft and large. Breakfast was included in the stay, the staff was very friendly and accomodating and there was a wide variety of food. The hotel is centrally located and is connected to a shopping center and the Bugis MRT stop.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel :o)”
Reviews.Author: crazyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Oct 08 and had a fabulous stay. We were upgraded to a Shophouse Suite, which had a balcony overlooking the shopping mall on Bugis, and was a delightful room. A charming hotel, with friendly and attentive staff, I couldn't fault our stay. Would definitely return here again, and would have no hesitation in recommending this superb hotel. Close to great shopping, and a very short walk from a Singapore Sling (v expensive but had to be done!) in Raffles :o)

Reviews.Title: “friendly, efficient, recommended”
Reviews.Author: irishdancer65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September, 2008 for 3 nights. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore. The location was great - it is attached to a mall and underneath is the subway which was very easy to get around. We took the train to the Harbour to go across by cable car to Sentosa. The food in the hotel was excellent. The rooms are impeccablly clean, the bed was THE most comfy bed I have slept in but most of all the staff here are so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old-Style comfort and convenient for shopping.”
Reviews.Author: OldVillain
Reviews.Content: You are given a great impression as your taxi pulls into the quiet courtyard off the busy Middle Road in Singapore. The hotel is very ‘Old Colonial’ in look and feel, similar to Raffles, with the white walls and shuttered windows. Inside, it’s very relaxing, quiet and spacious, again with that Far Eastern Colonial touch. The rooms are comfortable and in keeping with the rest of the building. The bathroom and shower room are particularly spacious. Apart from the toiletries, there is nothing for free here. A 500ml bottle of water, normally complementary in all the hotels that I've stayed in of this standard (and one that costs SNG$ 260/night) are offered up at SNG$12. Cheeky I say. There is nothing ‘reassuring’ about items costing way-more than you could get just around the corner in one of the many excellent shops, restaurants and bars. In fact, don’t eat in. The food is very good and the service fine too, but the cost is way over the top. SNG$14 for 330ml of Kirin Beer (that’s about £5.80 or US$10.50). The MRT underground system is just a short walk away in the arcade shopping area attached to the hotel, which will get you into the centre of the city for around SNG$2 (SNG$1 being the refundable deposit on the plastic travel card/ticket). It’s a nice hotel but given the choice, I’d pay the extra £25 (SNG$60, US$45) a night and stay in a The Mandarin Oriental and experience another world altogether!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wintera
Reviews.Content: There is a bit of history for me and this hotel. Working for a consulting company, I used to stay there for 3-4 month. The hotel was new then and had great staff. People have not been looking for tips, but were friendly and helpful. I also used to live in Singapore for a year or so. I went back earlier this year and then for a weekend in August again. Living in Singapore before, I never got used to the Orchard Road location. I always liked Bugis. You can walk to Raffles Place, Chimes, Suntec City, Sim Lim Square, Bugis market, and the build in shopping center Bugis Junction with Cinema is lest touristy then other places. So I always felt good just staying there. Unfortunately, the rooms did not follow with all the upgrades. Although they are still nice. The staff is more generic or superficial in their dealings. Friendly, but following the process. The first trip this year, I talked to the new GM (From Korea) and he himself told me, he had the same feeling and this is one of his focus areas to create a better team spirit, which the client can feel. If you are looking for a great 5 star experiences, the Mandarin Oriental or The Fullerton are better for the rooms, etc. - although personally, I am not a big fan of the location. So I guess, for me going there its more the walk down memory lane ;-) Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the Bugis Junction which is quite handy for some local cuisines. The room is good and the club floor lounge is very nice. Overall it would have been better if there is free internet access in the room as well. The hotel is within the expectation of the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Remember to put the door light on”
Reviews.Author: Bicholisto
Reviews.Content: A self-consciously upmarket hotel in one of Singapore´s innumerable shopping centres (Bugis) close to the metro and not too far to walk to the centre. There are lots of staff to tend to your every need (one time we counted 7 staff waiting in the lobby, just them and us): if all this tending gets too much, then remember to press the button to turn on the red light outside your room door, and you will not be disturbed. The room (on a high floor) was excellent, and a haven from the crush outside. The prepaid weekend rate on the hotel website is probably the best deal. We were kindly allowed to check-in a little early (most welcome after a long flight), and check out late for no extra charge (although we had to sign on to their Priority Club, so I guess I´ll be receiving more junk mail for ever). They tried to sell us a deal involving breakfast and cocktails, but we preferred to explore the local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: Having booked two rooms for two nights we were pleased with the efficient and personalised pre-arrival emails but on the ground there were several poor features of this stay. First the reception clerk was very cold, unwelcoming, slow and seemed more concerned at trying to sell me up to the next class of room (Club Level). Secondly, the rooms were ok but showing signs of wear (desks, room items such as trays, wardrobes) and incompletely kitted out with amenities. Thirdly the pool area was slightly scruffy and it was hard to find a pool towel that was not torn.I was most surprised. Finally, being off-season there was no pool bar but a telephone service..the problem was the phone worked once then went dead. So the negatives out of the way, the location is good and main lounge area has a sense of gravitas. The breakfasts were fine. I will not be going back. Verdict: Must do better!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn2008
Reviews.Content: Took my time deciding on where to stay and it was worth it. It is situated in a prime location by Bugis Street, Raffles is not too far away, the DHL balloon gave fab views of hotel. I travelled with my two sons aged 8 and 5 and my 17 year old daughter and was advised to stay in the premier rooms. It was an excellent size for us, spotless and the benefit of L'occitane toiletries. Believe me it isn't fun travelling with the kids but the hotel made up for all that! The pool was spotless and quiet, and the staff were fantastic. Will be visiting again when in Singapore. Breakfast was fine a variety of tastes, the kids loved it. The lounge is spacious and welcoming, singapore slings and nibbles yum. Reception were very accomodating, taking no time to arrange extra towels and toiletries and an extra bed. We had extended check out time as we were being picked up late afternoon at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: LnandP
Reviews.Content: Great location, charm, comfort and staff. Haven't tried the restaurants as we ate out, even for breakfast, but the drinks in the tasteful lobby were really good. The IPod connection could not work properly in our room, and the spa was just OK, but our expectations were high considering the other amenities. We had a very pleasant stay, and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Comfort”
Reviews.Author: grayza84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Work conference for 3 days. Great service, and the most comfortable bed's i have ever slept on. Great location. Restraurant is a little expensive, try the coffee shop down the road for breakfast, much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Cleveland_KIds
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed five days at this hotel while touring the city. Our room was on the same floor as the Club Lounge and we often used this room for 'chill out' time while enjoying breakfasts and afternoon tea with a limited view. The room was well furnished and clean while the king size bed was an absolute treat. The service staff were very prompt as we would sometimes leave the room and return after only a short time to find the room had already been tidied. I would recomend that you bring a copy of your booking agreement. We had booked a good deal on the hotel web site before we came over but when we arrived, we were quoted a higher price as the standard rate. The concierge handled the matter very professionally (while taking a copy of our paperwork to the manager for verification) and we were soon assigned to a room. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was positioned nearby to shops and the Bugis Street Train Station. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A class act in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: MakinanDan
Reviews.Content: Although the Intercon is now getting on to 13 years old, it continues to be one of the prime hotels in the area. With its excellent location next to Bugis Junction and its great range of services, this is one of the area's best properties. Treat yourself to the club floor and let Saliporn and Peter pamper you. Can't say enough good about this hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: SsazW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights. We reached Singapore at 6 am and called the hotel from the airport & was told that they do have an available room so we were able to check in early that morning. The check in was quick & easy & the staff were very friendly & helpful. The shop house room was spacious and clean. The bed was just right. We didn't use the swimming pool or the gym & didn't eat at any of the restaurants there. There are simply too many food outlet around the hotel for authentic local food at a much lower price. The location of the hotel is excellent, it is just next to shopping centre & MRT station. Overall it was a great stay at Intercontinental & the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff just beyond my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: jenmb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and it was absolutely brilliant. The staff are fantastic - very friendly and incredibly efficient, the rooms (shophouse) were immaculate and beautifully decorated, the hotel is in an excellent location - almost walkable distance to the quays, the pool was relaxing and quiet. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Afordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: shkazi
Reviews.Content: The hotel will fall short of expectations for those who are used to Ritz and Four Season styled luxuries of this world. For others, including us (husband, wife & our 18 month old son), this is a perfect choice. Why? Because it is affordable luxury at its best. Here is a sumary of our 4 night experience at the IC: Bookings: Got an excellent rate through Asia Best Hotel website. Reconfirmed the booking status with the hotel directly through e-mail. Since we had a child, couple of extra services were needed (especially for bottle sterlization). Hotel reply was positive. Made couple of routine requests to the hotel directly through e-mail. We were informed that at the time of check-in hotel staff will try to fullfill these requests. The hotel replied to our queries promptly, even though we did not book our room direclty with the them. Check-in & check-out: It was quite efficient. At check-in I was asked to produce the booking voucher sent to me by the Asia Best Hotel. All our requests were granted. Got a king bed at a higher floor. Even an early check-in was granted (we were there before 1 pm). Reception staff were friendly and smiling. Some of the hotel reviews mention a bad check-in experience. To avoid such an experience I have this habbit of exchanging some e-mails direclty with the hotel, even if I have used hotel’s own website. It solves lots of problems. A bad experience can ruin the holidays. Check-out was even more smooth. Lift: Yes it is an issue. Hotel check-in staff don’t drop any hint on how to us the elevators. Basically when in the lift look for a slot to insert your room key (it is located beneath the floor numbers). Take out the room key from the slot and press the floor button. This basically is a security feature to restrict the movement of Non-hotel guests . Hotel & Rooms: It is a lovely hotel. The aroma of Lemon Grass circulates in the main areas on the hotel. Rooms are impressive. Fairly large at 33 sqm. Nicely decorated. King size bed is very comfortable. Rooms are sound proof. Plasma or LCD TV is in the room. Airconditioing system is very good. Guests can increase or decrease the temperature settings to their comfort. Bathroom is luxurious with a sperate tub and a shower closet. Water pressure in the shower closet is nice. Breakfast: We had breakfast in the hotel only once. Why? Because we overslept the other days. In nutshell it was delicious and with plennty of options. Not to be missed. We did not have dinner or lunch at the hotel Staff: I think where this hotel falls short of Ritz & Four Seasons is the lack of personalized touch. But otherwise the staff was always helpful. They would sterlize the feeding bottles for our baby, however, they would not take down the complete instructions first. Twice we had to re-send the bottles back. Due to excesive shopping we needed a carton. Hotel arranged two within a few hours. Given the size our luggae, hotel also called a mini-van to take us to the airport. Taxi: At times there was a small queue at the hotel for Taxis. But the wait was tolerable. Never more than a few minutes. AT other places Taxi is an issue. We had to wait for 20 minutes at shopping malls for example. Easy way out is to call the cab. They charge a few dollars more. Location: As a tourist, I loved the location. Close to everything. There is a 24 hours small store across the hotel. Covered shoppoing mall adjacent to the hotel is very nice. The one across this mall is good as well. I would suggest to check out these two places before heading for the orchid road. For lunch try the resturant in the covered shoppng mall (I think it is call Terra). Excellent deal (Singapore $ 12). Loved the thai seafood noddles.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of singapore”
Reviews.Author: kaikai60
Reviews.Content: Another intercontinental brand. Smack bang in the centre of Singapore. Right next to Bugis Junction mall and underground metro, this hotel boasts a vast array of fun and travelling opporutnities. A-grade service and amazing spacous rooms. Bathrooms are huge as well. Very close to the airport and traffic wise, you seem to be against the flow of traffic always. I have probably stayed here 4 times already. Even though Orchard road boasts numerous other well known establishments, I still keep coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: TravellersHobart
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here on our return from Indonesia and were very impressed. We had booked a standard room but my daughter had emailed the hotel telling them about an illness I have, the operations and treatment I have recently have had and which will start again very soon so they had upgraded us to a club room, gave us a fruit basket and flowers. It is lovely to have someone give something to you when things are pretty low in your life. The room was lovely and the club lounge was a little oasis away from the noise and heat of Singapore. We had breakfast there each morning and cocktails each evening. The service was superb whenever we were there, attention to detail was amazing. The one little quirk was that I was asked to wear closed in shoes rather than (what I thought were) my classy sandals. These shoes were not strappy and very dressy. Whilst I was being asked to wear closed in shoes men we allowed in dagged jogging/tennis shoes - strange. The location of the hotel was great - 2 minute undercover walk to MRT and the Bugis Street shopping. Big department store next door, movie theatres and 3 stories of food court close by. Other reviewers have said that the rooms were a bit dated but I disagree - our room was in excellent condition, bathroom was luxurious and all the public areas were great. Overall a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate disregard for their own environmental policy”
Reviews.Author: Embino
Reviews.Content: As you would expect from an Intercontinental, the hotel is immaculate, well located and the staff are extremely helpful. I find no fault with anything in that regard - however in direct contravention of at least 2 of its own green policies, the hotel serves Shark Fin Soup in one of its restaurants. I left a letter for the manager expressing my distress at this, and have heard nothing back - I would expect better from them. I won't stay here again unless this item is removed from the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Would recomend for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Rambler_Timca
Reviews.Content: I red reviews about the hotel before I made reseravation and was little bit confused with some comments about arrogant staff. It was my only concern. In fact I was absoluttely pleased with hotel itself and hotel staff. I stayed in Club room and did not regret it. I had a lot of personal attention and it was not annoing at all. Breackfast was really good. I did not use the hotel restorante every day as in Bugis ares you will find a lot of options to have a meal. Room was clean, business center was exellent. I would recomend every buciness traveler to use the hotel. I really like the area - Bugis. You can not beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank1937
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Intercontinental from March 14 to March 20, 2008. It was our first trip to Singapore on a package deal to Singapore and Hong Kong. The hotel is lovely - truly a first class experience. The staff was bright, experienced and helpful. Our room was large and comfortable with luxurious towels, linen and dressing gowns. The breakfast buffet was a delight with a choice of freshly cooked eggs, sausages and bacon, fresh fruit and juices and much more. The staff arranged our visit to the zoo - a must see in Singapore - are were very helpful in suggesting things to see and do. We highly recommend the Intercontinental and it will be our choice on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Slippery1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Singapore in February 2008 and we stayed at the InterContinental Hotel, 80 Middle Road. I booked the hotel for three nights via the IC Hotel’s website back in April 2007, with a room rate of approximately SGD 303.00 per night and including breakfast for up to two adults. Anyone who has travelled frequently will know that breakfast in a five star hotel can cost between £15 and £20 per person, so to have this included in the room charge seemed more than good value. Booking through the hotel’s website meant that I had a confirmed reservation at an excellent price and I didn’t have to pay for the room until I had completed my stay. After our stay I checked my credit card statement whilst continuing our travels and I was more than pleased to find that the total cost for my stay at the InterContinental was £332.24, equating to slightly over £110 per night for a wonderful room and a sumptuous breakfast. The hotel is ideally located and not too far from Raffles Hotel as well as a subway station. We each purchased a ‘3-Day Singapore Tourist Pass’ that allows three days’ free use on the metro system and is excellent value for money and allows visitors to take advantage of the excellent rail links and low-cost travel around Singapore. I have visited Singapore twice before and on both occasions have stayed at the Pan Pacific Hotel and the only reason I didn’t choose it this time around was because it was more costly than the InterContinental. However, we decided to visit it whilst we were there to see if it had changed - and unfortunately for my taste it had! The interior and layout had been changed to an ultra-modern style with extremely bright colours, which probably impresses guests staying there for the first time - but it is not to my taste. Therefore I’m extremely pleased I chose the InterContinental and would most certainly recommend it to any first-time traveller to Singapore, I would also recommend it to any traveller returning to Singapore who has been disappointed with their accommodation on previous visits. I can not praise the hotel personnel highly enough as they are always friendly, professional and courteous in all their actions. At breakfast all of the staff in the restaurant was extremely attentive to the guest’s requirements. You only needed to get up from your table for a short while to get something from the excellent buffet selection, and you would find that any dirty plates and cutlery would be removed and clean cutlery placed on the table, in addition to finding your napkin neatly folded again. One didn’t need to look around for staff when a tea or coffee refill was required as someone was always at hand to offer a refill. The hotel rooms are well appointed and as I have already indicated the breakfast is a joy to feast on and there is a wide variety of food to cater for Europeans and Asians. I never took advantage of the swimming pool, however, I did walk around all the facilities with my wife and everything looked in pristine condition. I hope I have another opportunity to visit Singapore and the InterContinental Hotel will by first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Multi-Plug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here briefly during business trip. Fantastic room, large, well lit, huge bed, amazing bathroom and lots of facilities. All totally spotless. Staff were professional rather than friendly and welcoming. Check in/out was quick and efficient without any hanging around. Good location. Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “no flip flops please”
Reviews.Author: FuninNormandy
Reviews.Content: Well if you are a business traveller and if you like to be in a very uptight, overpriced, overgroomed and really- nothing -special type of places along with the attitude of the staff that THINKS they are special, than this is the place for you Again, for a business hotel, this is an appropriate venue. Howevef if you are looking for charm, elegance, nice staff and attention to detail avoid this hotel! and flipflops? Heaven forbid! I had just had a pedicure and attempted to come into the snob lobby for a coffee at 2pm and was told I could not stay there as I had sandals on...I wonder what they do with the indiens who are often in sarong and sandals at this fine establishment! -I booked this as a last stop to a very long and harmonious voyage thoughout Thailand where the people are nice, and the hotels I chose were well appointed with very accomodating and professional staff. I stayed in a five star hotel and no one mentioned my inappropriate dress' so maybe that was why this was so much of a shock when I hit Singapore and this particular hotel. and for fine tuning: if you are lucky enough to be in the club lounge, no problem with internet however if you are just a Priority Club member as I am (geez what does t h a t mean)?? I had the honour of paying 6 singapore dollars plus taxes for each FIFTEEN MINUTES of internet use in the hotel...again coming from Thailand in a five star where this was free I thought this was a little pricey! Finally, as a Priority Club member, I was honoured with a very nice pamphlet on the desk in my room showing all kinds of local exotic fruit....and I had two very hard non ripe PEARS offered as my welcome gift! So much for lichis, mangos and the like. This little detail I found very silly and just plain stupid for a five star hotel The worst was when I checked out and the front office staff did not even ask how my stay was, but when I kindly mentioned he just smirked. When I said this was peculiar for a four star hotel he said 'oh no we are five star' to which I responded that made it even worse! Drinks or service at poolside? Five star service, call on the phone and wait In room robes? Yes they are there if you dont mind em grey and wrinked Best things about this hotel: -The very nice concierge and the fact that I was able to have an early check in -Leaving knowing I paid absolutely nothing as I was able to use my free miles The worst: -The extreme snob attitude (dont stay here unless you are on business meeting your customers saddled in Gucci or Versace shoes) If you do get stuck -Enjoy the size proximity and cleanliness of the room (well other than the bandaid wraps I found on the floor) and Go to the toastbox (just next door) for breakfast and really good coffee! try raffles or the mandarin

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Inconsistent Service!”
Reviews.Author: VH-RMM
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the InterContinental Singapore on our way to / from Bali in January and again in February 2008. My parents have stayed here before and as they reccommended the Intercon, we made our bookings. Making the Reservation should have given me some warning about the service. It took over 72 hours to get the confirmations, only after I had to email them and then call them directly in Singapore from work in Sydney - not a good start. Once I received the reservations, my parents booking details were not provided, so after more emails and another phone call, these were sent. However, the rate per night was the by far the best offered to me. And as it was my parents wedding anniversary during the return trip, chocolate strawberries and a half bottle of sparkling wine was offered to them and will be in their room as a surprise in their room - a nice touch. Service upon arrival was very efficent and courteous. We were met by a porter who promptly collected all of our luggage and then was met by the guest relations manager who escorted us to our rooms. Check in took place in the room and we were also were given complimentary 1400 check out. (My high floor preference and smoking room were not in my booking, even though I had an email to advise it was. I was advised that this would be corrected, and preferences were now noted) The Hotel itself was gorgeous, and as it has been built around the old Singapore Shophouses, the colonial theme with Asian touches were very evident. Off Reception is the beautiful Lounge - a lovely place the have a cheeky bevvie in elegant surroundings and the prices were not too expensive at all (compared to some Australian 5 star hotels). The deluxe room itself was spotless and nicely appointed, and a nice size - not too small. We especially liked the bathroom and the Elemis products provided, the shower, where you can adjust the water temprature was devine! A sojourn to the Pool area was nice - but no attendants were anywhere to be seen. A question posed to the Concierge in regards to where the good local restaurants were proved too difficult for him, and he advised us "Two blocks that way" and pointed his thumb in the direction he was talking about. And FYI - Bugis street is just around the corner along with Albert Mall and dozens of hawker stalls and local restaurants - with amazing prices! And awesome food! The hotel location is good, only 15 min cab ride from Changi Airport (SGD$25.00 including taxes - not bad at all) but only SGD$2.50 on the MRT from Changi Airport Terminal 3- bargain! The InterContinental is located at Bugis Junction - and the MRT station (Bugis Junction) is a 5 min walk away. So, transport is never far away. The next night we ate at the hotels signature Chinese restaurant - Man Fu Yuan - and they provided the best Chinese meal we've ever had. Black Chicken Soup followed by Peking Duck (the duck was gorgeous with just a wisp of duck fat) and then BBQ Suckling Pig - amazing. The service was OK, not bad but not what I was expecting from a restaurant of this calibre. A few drinks at the Lounge was a lovely way to round out the evening. Check out 2 days later was simple, and off to Bali we headed. Fast forward to 10 days later, and were at the Intercontinental again. What a contrast from the first stay. No porter met us, and we waited in the line at Reception for 10 mins, only to be met by a very unfriendly staff member, who advised me that my room preferences were not in the system and there was nothing she can do (after a 5 second check). After checking in, I happened to catch the eye of the duty manager, who advised we could be moved and our preferences were accommodated. My parents half bottle of sparkling wine was not in their room, and as this was already a pre - arranged surprise, I went to enquire at Reception if this is still OK to do. I was demanded to give the lady on duty to give a copy of the email for proof, and she photocopied it and advised "we will fix it." By the way, the half bottle of sparkling wine turned out to be a full bottle of cheap Australian White Wine. Good for drain cleaner. The room service we soon ordered was fantastic and arrived very quickly - try the Club Sandwich or the Hainan Chicken Rice! Yum!!!!! (A little pricey, though!) Check out the next day was simple and straightforward, but again, the staff at Reception gave average service. No "How was your stay or Would you stay with us again." Overall verdict - Nice hotel in a great location with great Food & Beverage outlets (desperately wanted to eat at Ko, the Japanese restaurant - will save that for next time), let down by the indifferent attitude of some of the front desk staff and restaurant staff. Very inconsistent service. Tip - 5 min walk around the corner is a traditional Singapore breakfast restaurant - Toast Box. They serve toast, traditional toast and Teh Terik (tea with condensed milk - fabulous!) and noodles and laksas. Extrodinary value - and the locals go there as well!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Blimus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental during my first visit to Singapore on a business trip back in Nov 2006. This is a really nice hotel, classic design with a fantastic decor throughout. The room I was in was large, well decorated with a nice on-suite bathroom - it had all the conveniences I needed. The location is nice - not far from a metro station and with quite a few restaurants near by. The resturant in the hotel was really nice, they serve a great breakfast selection and the mediterranean food I had one evening was good too. The staff at the hotel were really good.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 8travellin
Reviews.Content: Dont travel in new year time As we did, the aim was to eat out and shop as much as we could and nothing was open, well not nothing about 10% of singapore was open. It was a waste of time, as for the hotel, they had no record of our arrival, it took 4 women and about 45 mins to sort out the error. Everyone at the hotel pointed us in the direction to go and shop yet no one could tell us it was all closed so we wasted money on taxis going to a close place. The breakfast was shocking, disorganized, for such a high standard hotel i was shocked with the wait to get in, the emptyness of food and staff, and when you got some food from the buffet it was average. Tables were left unattended, Maybe they had staff off too, hence the disarray. When we go back to singapore it will not be in new year time nor at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Chose iit quickly for business trip. But great location excellent city plenty to see. Hotel clean and good value for money with great food and wide range of choice. As there is in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JG_16
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3 night stay at this hotel on business. Good location; less than 30 mins from the airport by cab, 5 mins in a cab from Bar Quay, maybe a few mins more to Clarke Quay. Great level of service from all staff. Was upgraded to a great suite with views of the shopping mall. Club Lounge is comfortable. Only had chance for a quick swim...pool is good but maybe pool area is a little on the small side if you are there for a while. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jet Lag recovery and then some”
Reviews.Author: KCF_Sydney
Reviews.Content: To break up our trip from London to Sydney with small child we included a 3-day luxury stop in Singapore here. The room was simple, perfunctionary and faultless for our purposes. We prepayed around 1000 Aussie for 3 nights, and were slightly miffed to have to hotel unsuccessfully attempt to charge extra for an extra bed for our son, despite accepting our money for a 3 person room. That annoyance aside the staff were friendly and helpful. All the toiletries were L'occitane which seemed a good reflection of the hotel's class. Good pool (too deep for a small child who can hardly swim, so it wore him out !!). We didn't eat there due to our need one day to pay off our mortgage.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: new-to-far-east
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Christmas and loved the hotel. It is an oasis of calm in this busy place. Very convenient for Burgis village. The rooms were a lovely size and the service excellent. Do a deal to include breakfast if you can, we did and were able to thoroughly enjoy the amazing buffet breakfast with everything you can think of, and then some. My only "gripe" was that the water in the bedroom was SIN$12 a bottle, so if you like your water then buy some at the supermarket in the basement of Burgis Village attached. The pool is not very exciting but it is somewhere to layback for an hour or so before setting off again. The rooms were very quiet, I am very sensitive to noise and I did not hear a sound. I commend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: wales_UKSarah
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we wanted a lux start to our trip and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very grand with a large reception, lounge, bar & fab staff. The doorman & staff gave us excellent information regarding trip & where the best places to eat were. Raffles is 5 mins away by foot, Orchard street is a 10-15mins walk. We got taxie everywhere as they were so cheap. We visited the Zoo, sentosa Island resort and spend several hours shopping!!! Our hotel room was large & very comfortable, with all the small touches you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The swimming pool was outside and looked very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mextravelerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at Intercontinental Singapore Hotel. Fantastic Service, Nice and big units but the gem of the hotel is the Italian Restaurant. We ate breakfast every day, hard to miss that nice buffet and one night we went for dinner. What a Italian food, so good, i felt like i was in Italy, and we have been many times in Italy. We will stay there next time, No doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: beachlly
Reviews.Content: Our colleagues recommended that we stay at the Intercontinental rather than Raffles, were we usually stay. This was a mistake. The rooms were not very nice, it smelled of smoke and the internet connection was unreliable and dropped every 10 mins. Not acceptable for a biz hotel in Singapore. Even though our company has a good relationship with the Intercontinental, they were unaccommodating and even difficult. Our reservation needed to be extended by 1 night and we were repeatedly told that this was impossible. I checked again at 10pm the night prior to check out and confirmed that no rooms were available. Understandable with short notice, we reserved a room at Raffles. But, upon checking out the in the morning (luggage in hand and on our way to Raffles for 1 night) we were told that our reservation was extended and we would be charged for canceling. It was quite a hassle. Needless to say, we checked out and move to Raffles for one night. I wish we had stayed there to begin with. I will not make that mistake twice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nydet
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and because I booked the room online I got a fair price (140EUR/night). I arrived again to the hotel on my way back to Sweden a week later and booked a room 3 days in advance. This time it was three times the price with a much smaller room and no view altough I am a member in Priority club. This time it was not worth it. The room my first trip was very nice, clean and avarage size. Not to small and not big. Service was everywhere. Almost too much cameras and staff watching all the time. The Japanese restaurant on the hotel was fabulous! I ate there two times and was not dissapointed. As for the chineese restaurant, it was a disaster. It took ages before we could order. When we ordered we wanted a small dish from the menu. We were asked if we wanted rice with that and said fried rice. Then it took ages again before the waitress explained that they misplaced our order. When we got our food we got a third dish with rice and vegetables, not fried rice to go with our food. She then claimed that they don't serve fried rice at that chineese restaurant. The food was not good and the price way too high. Service was unacceptable and we had to pay for an expensive side dish we did not want! Both thumbs DOWN!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DaviesCheshire
