Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel, real luxury, cannot fault this hotel at all. Staff were so friendly and helpful nothing is too much trouble. I wanted soem laundry doing and within minutes of me calling they collected and returned within a couple of hours great service. Would definately recommend this hotel and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingKiwi44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Transit Hotel in Singapore Airport on the way from New Zealand to London last year, but it was too noisy and uncomfortable, even for one night, so for the return trip we stayed at the Intercontinental instead. It was definitely the right decision. It didn't cost much more than the airport hotel, because it was one of the Singapore Stopover promotion hotels at the time, and the standard was *so* much higher. The complimentary shuttle to the hotel was problem free, and we were upgraded at check-in to a lovely, huge, room, with a wonderful bathroom, and beautiful windows overlooking a courtyard. However, the courtyard turned out to be connected to the bar area, and it was Chinese New Year! When I realised it was going to be too noisy, I contacted the front desk, and they immediately had us moved to a completely quiet room. It wasn't a problem at all. The new room was a bit smaller, but still very comfortable, with soft beds and pillows - things I definitely value after a long flight! The hotel is connected to a mall, which is handy because there's a small supermarket in the mall, so we could stock up on munchies for the day. I would definitely stay here again next time we go through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Central and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: gcrefs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IC hotel for a week in 2007 - October. The rooms and service are of excellent standard. The location is central to all attractions and shopping in Singapore. For those wishing to relax their is a great pool area with lounges and umbrellas to keep you out of the midday sun. Food in the hotel is expensive - however, the hotel is adjacent to the Bugis centre that hosts a number of great dining alternatives at very reasonable prices. Sketches and Fish on the Go were great. Ifyou want something on the run Maccas is available for a quick fix. I have attached some photos from our twin share superior room. One bed was a queen and the other a king sized single - still with ample room for other furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: NQOzzies
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children (aged 3 & 5) stayed here for 4 nights in August. I agree with previous reviews that the hotel is an excellent location. We were upgraded to a junior suite on a club floor. The positive of this was the size of the room was excellent. The downside was the floor we were on was a smoking floor. Being non-smokers the smell particularly in the evenings was unpleasant. I agree with a previous review that room service could have been better. Coffee and milk was rarely left in our room. Our telephone wouldn't work and despite several requests to fix, no one came. The doormen provided excellent service and were very friendly. We would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a great area for getting around”
Reviews.Author: woblynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Intercontinental for 2 nights (9-11 Sept) following a visit to Malaysia in an excellent hotel (Rasa Sayang, Penang). Upon arrival, we informed reception that we had booked a club room and were advised to wait until someone could show us to the room as we would be checked in in the room itself. A lady came to collect us and took us to the room. I asked if we could possibly have a late check out due to a late night/early morning flight and she said we could only have this if we became an a Priority Club member (which we were) then she said no, you need to be an Ambassador and this would cost us so much per year. We declined this option. We were then advised we would have to pay an additional half day room rate to keep the room until 6pm (I had requested 8pm) which due to our late flight, we accepted but she would not budge on the 8pm despite our paying an additional half day rate. It was 7.50pm when we checked in and I mentioned we had just missed the cocktail hour in the club lounge and was there any chance of getting a drink but she said no the lounge had finished. No niceties here, so we gave up and were just glad to get rid of her. Not the best start. We wandered to the lounge after and the ladies in there were exceptionally friendly and advised us that breakfast served in the club lounge was not hot (just a few pieces of hot bacon only) and the remainder of it was just continental. The advice was to eat at the main hotel buffet restaurant which had a huge selection and was free to club room guests. We can recommend this to anyone who stays at the hotel as the choice is excellent, lots of cold meats/fruit/pastries/juice and also a hot selection of dim sum, noodles, rice, bacon, potatoes, fish, beef, omelettes made to order. Basically, you will not need lunch if you have a decent breakfast there. We had drinks in the lounge from 5-7.30pm which included sparkling wine and the usual spirits but I will say the selection of canapes was very poor - just a couple of items but mainly "chips and dips" with cookies available too. You can have tea/coffee/juice at any time of the day with cookies. The room itself overlooked the pool area at the front of the hotel and had a king bed, with workdesk, chairs, table and a flat screen TV. There wasn't really a vanity unit and the hairdryer was in a unit between the bedroom area, in a corridor by the wardrobe, making it difficult for 2 people to pass when the other was drying their hair. The bathroom was fine, with a single sink, separate shower, a large space age toilet and separate bath. The best thing about the hotel is that it adjoins a small shopping area at Bugis junction and is easily accessible to lots of places, including a short walk to Raffles Hotel and the Swissotel Stamford which was great as we dined at Equinox there (top floor restaurant) which had fantastic views of the quay area. It's a shame that the lady checking us was so indifferent to us at the beginning of our stay, it tainted our view of the hotel somewhat, but we did feel that tourists were more frowned upon in the club lounge than their business guests, despite having paid the same room rates. On the whole, the stay was okay but it's certainly not somewhere we would go back to again and I think next time, we'll try the Shangri La Valley Wing as we feel that the service levels for tourists will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good, come back”
Reviews.Author: vixbkk
Reviews.Content: Very Good hotel, Had high expectation but it exceeded. Rooms are large and clean colonial style. Pool is quite nice but crowded in late afternoon with kids. Restaurant and lounge is exquisite. Another complain is a substandard fitness gym room. bugis Junction has great food, good open mall and local eateries in the back street. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimonbel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great!! We stayed in the victorian style room with my husband and it was very nice. Housekeeping made our bed in the morning and also got it ready for us to go to bed. I think they must have known when we were not in the room. They did not bother us at all. We booked our room with the hotel website and I thought we got a pretty good deal for S$225/night and it came with a great breakfast. Downstairs had a shopping center and the MRT which I thought was very convenient. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: sambucada
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a shophouse,super sized room with a real ambience.The bathroom and fittings were a bit jaded but the whole room had character.Door men were excellent in hailing taxis. Breakfast was very good although overpriced. We really enjoyed our stay here the place was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: happy_voyager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the IC this August for 4 nights. Despite warnings from other fellow travellers, we booked the IC due to its reputation and our previous pleasant experience with IC in other cities. We booked in the last minute and took the only type of room that was available -- the club room (at SGD 350++). While our entire stay was overall pleasant, we felt the IC Singapore did not quite live up to its world-wide reputation. The exterior the hotel looked nice and gave an old colonial image. The lobby lounge where we had our breakfast everyday was grand and impressive looking. The daily breakfast was good with lots of selections. The Japanese restaurant was good although a bit pricy. We didn't use the pool as it looked so-so and always crowed. As to the other facilities, we were pretty surprised to find that there was only a sauna and a tiny jacuzzi, and no steam room. There was a small gym. Our room included free usage of the facilities but we didn't use any of them. As to our room, we have to say we were kind of disappointed when we saw our "club room" on the club floor. It was just an ordinary room, nothing special. There was some kind of smell in the room due to old age, and the walls were so thin we could hear the people next door getting up in the middle of the night using the bathroom and also in the morning taking a shower, along with their conversation. The exterior wall of the bathtub didn't close up properly and we could see the inside. We also had to call twice to request for our complimentary water bottles. The next day morning we went to the club lounge to have breakfast before heading out. It is always hot in Singapore so we were wearing shorts. We were refused entrance by a snobby employee who informed, loudly in front of other guests, "I'm afraid there is a dress code in this lounge." We were not at any point informed of this and felt completely humiliated. We chose to have breakfast in the lobby lounge for the following mornings. After 3 nights in the smelly club room, we moved to an ordinary room on a regular floor (at SGD 220++), and were shocked to find that it looked exactly the same as the "club room" we previously stayed at!! Plus, it smelled much better. We should've moved earlier! We felt deceived. We couldn't understand why we paid SGD 130 more per night for the "club room." The only difference we could come up with was that club room guests can go to the lobby lounge to have a drink every day. We are not sure this is worth an extra SGD 130 per day. Of all the five-stars hotels we stayed with around the world, the IC Singapore is probbaly the most unaccommodating and the most inflexible. There must be better hotels in the same price range. We stayed at Raffles the Plaza on our last trip and were quite satisfied. Next time we go to Singapore, we will try the Fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrKitty
Reviews.Content: As one would expect of a 5* luxury hotel, the InterCon is a fantastic hotel in a great location. The breakfast was vast, with Chinese, Japanese and Western options available. The coffee was actually fantastic here! Rooms are very well appointed, comfortable and quiet. We had some issues with the taxi queue, as the two concierges didnt quite communicate with each other where the line was. Expect very efficient staff, but not overly friendly, as is the luxury way. The house keeping staff were excellent and very friendly, polite and thanked us for visiting Singapore, not just the hotel! Pool is lovely. For the rates we could secure on their website, you cannot beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kamikazetrips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the ICH Singapore at least half a dozen times over the past year and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. ICH's location on Bugis Junction is simply unbeatable - with great access to shops, malls, and markets as well as the metro. Service is highly reliable. Rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. Most importantly, it is really good value for the money. We haven't spent time in the pool but it looks quite nice. As for food options, who needs to dine at the hotel when all options around Bugis? Try the underground foodcourt at the mall outside the hotel. It is cheap and selection abounds. ICH has become our hotel of choice whenever we stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but.....”
Reviews.Author: dgtravelbug
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. The rooms are very comfortable, the lobby and the lounge area is very spacious and opulent, and the pool area is nice though a little small. Bugis Junction shopping mall adjoins the hotel and just a block away are the Bugis St markets which are bustling day and night. Just a few blocks to the north is the Arab quarter where I spent a fabulous morning shopping. It also has some interesting dining options (we dined at an atmospheric Arabic restuarant one night). We generally do not stay in 5 star hotels so the InterContinental was a bit of a splurge. The only thing that let down our stay were a couple of annoying service issues. We arrived at the hotel after 8pm at night. We had no problem with the check in (although it would have been nice to have been told whether or not breakfast was included and where it was). However it took over half an hour for our bags to be delivered up to our room, and only then because I rang up to remind them. We really wanted to get changed and have a shower, but instead we had to sit around waiting for our luggage to arrive. The next day we were out all morning. When we returned to the hotel at 1:30pm our room had still not been made up. We went back out again and returned at 4:30pm to find the maid only just starting to clean our room then. We were hot and tired and wanted to change into our swimmers to go to the pool, but instead we found ourselves sitting in the lobby for half an hour waiting for housekeeping to finish cleaning the room. The breakfast buffet is very nice but ridiculously expensive (after taxes $84 for 2 breakfasts???). Just as well it was included in our package or we would have gone outside to a cafe. The InterContinental is a very impressive hotel for a special occasion or a splurge, but for a general Singapore stopover I think there are better value hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: hotchr
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended from my best friend who lives in Singapore. I figured he couldn't be wrong and he wasn't. Upon arrival I humbly asked if it was possible for an upgrade (despite having no status with their membership program and booking the most inexpensive basic room) turns out they upgraded me to a "shop house" room that overlooked the interior mall courtyard area. Very nice surprise, esp. the shutters on the windows! Quite colonial. Room was very spacious, and the location of this hotel was sublime...just steps away from the Bugis MRT stop as so many have noted. Of course you walk through a mall to get there and back, but this is Singapore...shopping is a national pastime! Also if you need any sundries a 7-11 is just right down the road less than a 3 minute walk. The only negative is how much of a walk there is in this hotel. It can be quite confusing like you're going though a maze and don't know where you're going until you've gone through 2 or 3 sets of double doors so just be ready for this. All in all a great hotel and for the price would def. consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: Great hotal, booked club rooms and wow, fantastic rooms, staff and the club lounge with breakfast, afternoon/evening cocktails, amazing. Rooms were really big for a city hotel and plush. A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “shophouse room was lovely”
Reviews.Author: JKD
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews of properties teeming with reviews, but after my first stay here, this hotel has jumped to #2 (tied with the Yokohama Grand InterContinental) of my all time favorites. This hotel was recommended by my husband; I've stayed in the Hilton, Sheraton, Swisshotel and numerous others in Singapore. What I liked about the IC (and particularly the shophouse room), was the feeling of something with a little bit of history, while not lacking in modernity. The lobby was a nice size - not overwhelming with high ceilings or overly crowded and busy. It felt welcoming. The shophouse room was comfortable with chairs, small table as well as desk and chair. The room is tastefully decorated according to the InterContinental standard. Flat screen TV makes the room feel airier. The bathroom amenities were nice; there is a bathtub and separate shower stall with glass door. Hot water was plentiful and the shower head worked great. Bathrobes are provided. The bed itself was very comfortable - not too hard and not too soft. The pillows were fluffy enough without giving me a neck ache. The only complaint is that the daily refreshing of the room was erratic. Upon arrival, fruit and mineral water were provided. The second day, nothing. But, provided again on the third and fourth day. Similar situation with the newspaper - first and second day, The Straits Times; third day, nothing, and I departed too early on the final day for paper delivery (they were just being delivered to the bellman as I was leaving). The odd thing about a wake up call is that you get one 5 minutes in advance from a machine; the second call (on time) is from a person. Bugis Junction is attached to the hotel. There is a largish Cold Storage supermarket (larger than some of the other locations in Singaporean malls); this one has a deli and hot foods to go. As Singapore is well connected by MRT throughout the shopping / hotel areas, this hotel is convenient to just about everything. Service is not as good as my #1 favorite, ICC BKK, but adequate. I didn't have time to check out the gym, as I took a couple of long walks to Chinatown to do some great shopping for souvenirs (probably a bit better than Orchard Road shopping due to the concentration and close proximity of all of the vendors).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lcd75
Reviews.Content: Arrived morning time in Singapore but the staff were so friendly and had no bother checking us in early. The hotel was immaculately clean. The rooms were luxurious and the attention to detail made this hotel very high-quality. Had a buffet breakfast in the hotel, great choice and the quality was excellent. Staff were so attentive and could not do enough to help. Singapore is a great place to visit and our stay here made it special!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: peacex
Reviews.Content: Singaporean staying in a Singapore hotel for a weekend getaway purpose in late March 2007. Just for relaxation. Pool was nice. Jucuzzi & Gym was nice for a workout. Rooms were huge and clean! Beds were very comfortable and nice pillows. Toilet huge as well with bath tub and standing shower. Flat screen tv with many cable tv channels. Location is very good just at Bugis Junction. Bugis street shopping is just 1 road away. Bugis Junction shopping center is just "downstairs". Extremely enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spookie007
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel at a lovely location. Just walk out the "back door" and you'll be at the shopping heaven - with a supermarket, pharmacy, restaurants, and a departmental store all nearby. Walk a little further and you can also find an MRT station. Food is excellent - Try to get your stay with breakfast as they offer a simple and lovely breakfast buffet. They go for quality, rather than just quantity which many other hotels do. Staff are all friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean (which is really important to me). Also stayed there once during christmas season. Hotel was tastefully decorated with christmas decor which puts the hotel guest in a happy and festive mood. This hotel is a little pricey, but if you can afford this, I would recommend that you try this place. I've stayed there 3 times and each stay was wonderful. Also had a training/conference there. Facilities are good for such events too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Honeymooners
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December as part of our honeymoon. We loved the Intercontinental. Shophouse room was spacious and comfortable. Check-in was excellent. Rained the whole time we were in Singapore, but Intercontinental made it a great 3 days. If travelling with Singapore Airlines en route to somewhere else, check out the Singapore Stopover Deals. Really good rates in all stars of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, shame about the check in”
Reviews.Author: NZBird
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel via the Singapore Stopover brochure and after reading up about it on the internet. The hotel has a great first impression, the men at the door are friendly and the hotel is clean. However, we travel quite a bit and I can honestly say that I have never experienced a check-in like we did at the Intercontinental! The lady behind the desk greated us with a strained smile and then said that "you want a kingsize bed in a non smoking room" we replied "yes that is what we booked". She then told us that there were no rooms available and we could ever go into a smoking room or have two single beds in a non smoking room. I informed her that that was not ideal and we had booked a kingsize bed in a non smoking room. She continued to look at us as if we were to except what she was telling us but we did not. After she spent another 5 minutes searching the computer she then told us that she had a room available!!! To me that was absurbed and I felt like they were trying to put us in a cheaper room so they could either put someone who was more distinguised in there or someone who would pay more money. Anyhow our room was beautiful, everything was so new and tidy. They had free grapes and bottles of water on arrival, a comfortable bed, new TV with good channels and everything else you would expect. The hotel itself was in a brilliant location, so central with a mall outside one of the entrance's. The check-out was the opposite to our check-in and very easy, the man behind the counter was friendly. Overall would we come back to this hotel again, NO. I have stayed in Singapore before and we last stayed in a 4-star hotel which was much more enjoyable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “On top of the shops!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is on top of the Bugis shops in Singapore - which are one of the local must-do experiences, in my opinion. The hotel itself is very clean, well designed and well staffed. My room was large and had good views - on the North side. The hotel outdoor pool is great - but could do with a few extra lounges (rather than double beds!) for the guests who congregate here. If you are acclimatised to the Singapore heat and humidity, the Intercontinental is only a short walk to Raffles, the colonial buildings and museums, the Suntec exhibition centre, the theatres, the river and the CBD. In other words, the location is excellent! I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scot5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in this hotel travelling back from New Zealand to UK. loved the Hotel and all the staff were very helpful. it is well situated for walking to explore the city. the rooms are of a high standard. the only complaint i had was we had prebooked a roll away bed. we arrived late and it was not prepared we had to call twice to get it. they resolved the problem by not charging for it. if you are leaving later in the day the cost of a room to change is expensive, but the toilets in the lobby are large enough to accomodate quick changes of clothing. overall a good advertisment for the high standard given by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this hotel and it may have been our last. While we have always been very pleased with the lovely, serene atmosphere of the place and the convenience of its setting, right above the Bugis MRT stop, we have never been very impressed by the quality of check-in. This time check-in was so unprofessionally rude and slow for a five star hotel that I wrote a note to the management. After a 24 hour journey we were kept half an hour at the desk (there were no other people checking in) while the receptionist occasionally glared at us and tapped furiously on the computer. No explanation, no apologies. Five months earlier we had requested a rollaway for our four year old son on the hotel website, and sent an additional email (to which we never received a reply). The rollaway wasn't in the room, and despite the reluctant acknowledgement of the receptionist that we had requested one it wasn't there two hours later either. We had to make a special phonecall to make it clear that our young child needed to go to bed. It's a real pity that reception is so abysmal because the other staff bend over backwards to please and the overall facilities are great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: mshaus
Reviews.Content: Booked my stay through asiabest. I was very much looking foward to my stay at Intercontinental after reading all the reviews here but I hate to say that I was very disappointed with their service. When we arrived, my husband was greeted by the bellhop. I felt invisible. Check in was efficient although I was told that the only room they had was a twin room and that it was an upgrade. I did ask if there was any possibility that they would move us to a different room with at least a queen and I was told that they would look into it. The room was right at the far end of the hotel. It was quite run down and had sort off a musty smell. It was a spacious room and I could see it being nice 10 yrs ago. The bathroom was not well kept. The shower stall was horrific. There were mould caked in between the grout and the soap dish. Both of us slept on one twin bed for 4 nights. No one called about moving us to a different room. I am not a very demanding person and so I just let this slide. The last straw was when one of the managers left me a note while I was out requesting me to contact him. Apparently, I had stained one of their towels and they were going to charge me for it. Steve, I believe, even brought the towel to my room to show me the stain just in case I deny the atrocious act. It was a slight pink stain from my hair dye (manic panic). Not that I dyed my hair there, it happens when I wash my hair with hot water. I just can't believe the audacity of the staff. Not very 5 star I would say. I had no problems paying for the towel, I did not even argue with Steve about it, but my husband stepped in and ask them if they had tried washing it yet? It was a white towel and I believe you usually bleach them to keep them white? At this point Steve looked flustered. Why, it never occured to him to try that.. He quickly mentioned that they would try washing it and if the stain disappears I will not be charged. (S$50) Steve called around 10pm, cordially informing me that I will not be charged as the stain was removable, like as if he did me a great big favour. After that incident, Steve remembered my name and greeted me at the lobby. Not the way I wanted to be remembered. The staff at Intercontinental Singapore have a long way to go in terms of providing a 5 star service. I stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 nights after 4 days at Intercontinental, and service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JewlzReadingUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental whilst travelling from the UK to New Zealand. It was the perfect place for a 2 night stopover. Firstly, we arrived early (before 10 am) exhausted and dreading that we would not have access to a room. We needn't have worried! Even though we are a family of 5, booked into 2 rooms, we were able to move in straightaway. The 2 rooms were interconnecting, which is great when you have children. The bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the bathroom was HUGE.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: RJRAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just returned from a 5 week vacation including the last 3 days in Singapore. We made our reservation on the Hotel web site and paid around $S330 per night including taxes etc. The hotel is well located and is convenient to the Bugis MRT (underground access) and the grocery store below. All staff are very friendly and helpful but there are a couple of things that for a modern '5' Star hotel should be better. We were located in the older section on the lower floors. Room size was good, as was the bathroom but things are getting 'tired' and need some freshening up. Breakfast is the usual 'buffet' but it really was no better than a '3' Star hotel in terms of variety, imagination or 'something special'. Had to use the business centre briefly for internet access and was surprised to learn this is available at a cost (small but my experience is that this is usually free). Walking through the lobby indicated that porterage was often stretched .......... our experience particularly on checkout and later when returning to collect our luggage to go to the airport. A similar experience was found when we were seeking some pretty basic tourist information from the Concierge. One evening around 8:30pm we waited in the hotel taxi queue for about 45mins. Locals around us (and behind us in the queue) began making telephone bookings and were then leaving well before us. The porters did little to explain options or arrange an improved service .......... there are over 22,000 taxis in Singapore. For similar monies (slightly higher or lower) I suspect there may be some better options right now in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Rooms, Meals and All Class”
Reviews.Author: Perthfamily
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, as we love the Bugis area. The staff are excellent. The meals are delicious. We stayed a week after a relaxing holidays in the Maldives and when we arrived we were shown to our corner suite and adjoining room. I couldn't fault this hotel. We are a family with four young (well travelled and well behaved) children and this hotel was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Return Often”
Reviews.Author: annenorman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Singapore from December 26, 2006 through January 1, 2007. Overall, we rate it an exceptional facility. The team is extraordinary. The facilities are quite good, and the hotel is superbly situated in this wonderful city/state. Singapore is a shoppers haven. Mindful of this tradition, it is important that a visitor select a hotel that is situated conveniently to all major shopping areas -- the elite ones and those that cater to non-designer retailers. The Intercontinental Singapore suits all needs. It is walking distance to "Arab Street," an area where vendors sell silk, wool and other fabrics by the meter. These merchants also peddle other clothing items and specialty pursuits. One also can walk to Little India, where many items are sold by local vendors and the food is exceptionally good and reasonable. A shopper also can walk down the street to the Raffles Hotel, and its continguous mall, for more upscale pursuits. Finally, an inexpensive cab ride will take you to retail heav\en -- the Orchard Road and Scotts Road. We offer this observation at the outset because we noted the relatively remote location of other five-star hotels in Singapore. We also noted, by extreme contrast, the location of the Hyatt and the Marriott right in the middle of the heavy commercial foot and vehicular traffic. This hotel, and its location, offered a unique and convenient balance. We start with commentary about the positive aspects of this hotel. As noted by others, the breakfast buffet was exceptional. Freshly squeezed jiuces, wonderful breads and cereals, an array of fresh fruits, specially prepared items, and other nicely presented food items made for an outstanding experience. Everything was presented wonderfully. The staff -- the team -- was attentive, charming and committed to customer service. We especially liked Kelly, who was a charming, efficient and attentive waitress. The dining room was bright, clean and cheerful. It was neat, and inspired a sense that the team was dedicated to maintenance of a clean and healthy dining environment. The room was clean and well appointed. The best part was the predictable arrival of the housekeeper. She arrived to make the bed during the day and arranged it for the evening about the same time. Given recent experiences in the US, this is something that we should appreciate. After all, there is nothing worse than returning to a room only to discover that it has not been cleaned and made before mid-afternoon. We always found our room made and arranged when we returned during the afternoon. We also were able to predict the arrival of the housekeeper in the evening to turn the bed and otherwise arrange the setting. This may seem petty but it is a very nice feature in these times. The hotel staff -- the desk team, the concierage, the bar , the bell men, door persons were kind, attentive and determined to make your stay a fine experience. We cannot offer a single less-than-positive comment about them. Actually, they were at time quite entertaining. and attuned to your needs and preferences. The only negative comment I can offer is the price of the drinks at the hotel bar. They were twice the price of nearby facilities. Once I discovered this reality, I went elsewhere by foot or with dinner. Obviously, this is treated as a profit center. The hotel outdoor pool and fitness facilities are basic. Nothing exceptional here. They are available if you need them, but clearly no one associated with the hotel virews them as critical or esential features. The hotel offers spa and massage services. Take your time before making a commitment. There are plenty of spa and massage facilities thourghout Singapore that cost a fraction of the cost offered by the hotel team. Some are literally seconds away from the hotel property by foot. Singapore is a great city. It is extrremely clean and safe. Everything is convenient. The people -- the residents -- are delightful and friendly. Most things are reasonbably priced. Shopping is a cultural event. The zoo is a special event. If you stay at this hotel, take advantage of the package that includes the breakfast buffet. Walk down the street to Purvis Street -- minutes away -- for lunch or dinner at some nice (and clea) places. Survey the shops at the Raffles Hotel (an old guard British facility) for convenience. (The original Singapore Sling at the Long Bar is a tourist trap.) Do your real shiopping, however, on Orchard Road or Scotts Road. Be patient: survey first before you spend a dime. Be Job-like: bargain and br prepared to walk away in the local retail electronics and jewelry establishments. Outside the hotel, eat like a local. We found an Indian restaurant at the Albert Court Hotel (another old guard British spot) that served outstanding food for reasonable prices. Probe, explore and examine Little India, Chinatown, Arab Street and other ethnic retail areas for bargains and for good food. (The Apollo Banana Leaf restaurant is worth a visit -- once.) Don't worry about clothing in most of Singapore. Most upscale places permit entrance while casually dressed. Given the warm temperatures, this is quite understandable. Tailors are everywhere. We found a good one at 14 Scotts Road -- Intrend Fashions (Master Tailors). They promptly tailored our items from photographs we selected from magazines. The Takashimaya Mall belies Short Hills, The Somerset Collection and other upscale malls in the US. And, it is a short cab ride from the Intercontinental. It is worth a visit. In closing, I already plan to return to the Intercontinental Singapore. It truly is a world class hotel facility that serves the public through an experienced and focused team. We suggest that you go to this hotel once, and return often.

Reviews.Title: “Special Trip”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_M_Charlton
Reviews.Content: I returned for the second time to this great hotel, this time for my Mum's 60th Birthday trip. As usual, the customer service was impeccable. I have a Platinum Royal Ambassador Status with Six Continents Hotels and the staff were outstanding. We booked a limo pick up at the airport and our driver was waiting for us on arrival. As we appraoched the hotel, the guest manager met us at the door and took us straight to our upgraded rooms with no fuss. Albert the concierge deserevs a special mention as he had arranged flowers and champagne for my mum as well as making all of our bookings for dibber and travel we asked for. The Gym was great, breakfasts are superb and the attention to detail is great. Tremendous service, wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: D-holidayLover
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, upon i arrived by taxi someone open the door for me, help me with the luggages and straight-away show me to the reception to check-in, the room is nice, clean and tidy. Service was fine, staff is friendly and always show me with a smile. Just the problem during my stay is need to wait very long for the taxi, other then that everything is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Friendly_K
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for five nights recently on business. I have got a very good impression of the hotel breakfast buffet restaurant. The waitress putting on smile greeting me every morning at the entrance of the Olive Tree restaurant. The chefs and waiters were friendly and pleasant. Fresh juice was great. Lady concierge was reliable and thoughtful. Front desk ladies were efficient. Housekeeping staff were attentitive. Only one downside was the front desk forgot to ask if a non-smoking room needed and the hotel allows people to smoke in the corridors and do not have enough ventilation, therefore, the corridor stank of smoke which permeated into my room. Without luck, people in the next room were celebrating birthday, a crowd of people inside and outside their room were producing heavy smoke and annoying noise all night. As an extremely tired light sleeper, I was in bed around 11:00. I thought the noisy crowd would finished their party in a short time so I did not make a compliant. However, I did not expect I had to stand the noise until 3:30 in the morning and the smoke permeated into my room was strong enough to choke me under my quilt. Fortunately the front desk switched me to a non-smoking room the next morning after my whole night torture.

Reviews.Title: “Take a break at Hotel Intercontinental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LightWeaver
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a break from work and stayed at the Hotel Intercontinental, Singapore from 11 - 12 Nov 06. I chose the hotel because it had an old-world charm to it. The check-in was smooth though mechanical. The front counter staff didn't seem to like to smile. I requested for a king, non-smoking deluxe room on a high floor and was allocated one on the 13th storey. The room was clean and adequately sized. The plus points of the room were: 1. The furniture and lamps had oriental designs which was unique compared to the standard chain-hotel rooms. 2. The LCD TV gave the room a modern look. I think the hotel upgraded the TVs recently. 3. The air-conditioning. Hotel Intercon is one of the few hotels that had a working thermostat which shows the desired and actual room temperatures. The most impressive item in the room is the toiletries. The hotel provides shower gel, soap, conditioner and shampoo supplied by L'OCCITANE en Provence, which provided a refreshing shower and bath. A peculiar point about the room: Most hotels have this energy saving gadget that requires guests to slot their key cards in to activate the room's power supply. Hotel Intercon has this plastic card that's permanently affixed to the gadget by a chain. The guest is requested to take the card out of the slot when leaving the room. I am not sure if the guests really do remember to remove the card, esp if the card is not their room key. The initiative to save energy might not be effective in this case. On the other hand, perhaps too many guests lock themselves out of the room when they leave their keycard in the energy saving gadget, which could be the reason for such an arrangement. The room service was prompt when I requested for an additional towel though I was amused to be given 6 new sets of towels when the room service staff turned up at my door. I tried the gym on the 3rd floor. It was adequately equipped and well serviced. The lockers in the gym's change rooms required guests to bring along their personal locks. The first time I used the gym, I forgot to bring a lock. The gym trainer suggested that I could leave my clothing at a corner of the gym and do my workout. I thought it was a weird suggestion but I did it anyways since I did not have any valuables with me. The gym had a jacuzzi. The jacuzzi was ok though a bit small. Could fit max 4 persons. The jacuzzi usage for males and females are split into different time periods i.e. at any one time, either males OR females are permited to use the jacuzzi, not both. For future guests, do check the timings for gents and ladies cause you won't want to be changed out to use the jacuzzi and realise that it's not the right time. The swimming pool on the 4th floor is equipped with a cold spa pool at the side. The lockers in the change room (a different room from the 3rd floor gym's) requires you to bring along a lock as well. Strangely, there was a sign in the change room indicating that locks were available upon request at the gym. Since I used the pool after the gym, I didn't bother to verify whether this was true. The bottomline is to make sure you bring along a lock before you use the change rooms. Food wise, breakfast is served at the Olive Tree. The breakfast buffet had a good spread of food. I liked the bacon, sausages, omelette and chocolate muffins. One problem that I had was with the signage that indicated the type of food at the buffet table. There were insufficient and confusing signages so one had to guess what was served. One sign read "Peanut butter, butter, jam, ..." and there were 6 saucers below the sign. You have to guess what's in each saucer and link it back to one of the items listed on the sign. Nevertheless, the breakfast was delicious so a room plus breakfast package at the hotel would be a good choice. Finally, the checkout was smooth. This time, a different front counter staff served me and was much more friendlier. She asked about my stay and recommended their restaurants for future patronage. Overall, my stay at the Hotel Intercon has achieved my objective to rejuvenate over the weekend. I would recommend it to tourists and locals alike. Would stay at the Hotel Intercon because of the room and the food served.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: KLreviewer
Reviews.Content: Wether you have freshly flown in, or like me just transferred from an atrocious hotel namely The Garden, currently rightly ranked #75 in tripadvisor, your in for a real comfy treat at this hotel! At first, my expextations were not top, as it was the few hotels on the first page under $200, let alone it was #3! Well, be surprised! A pleasant one! Upon entering the front lobby, porters were quick enough to help with the luggage & from then on you dont have to lift a finger. Check in was was no problem although the room was only ready in 1-2 hours, fair enough, it was 11am. Just perfect, we left the bags there & got onto shopping & lunch. Returning at 3pm with aching feet, grabbed the room cards, & voila! Luxurious! Immediately you would know the price is worth it. We got the standard room, but was big enough (38sm), huge comfy bed, large work desk & unbelievable bathroom. Enough for 2 to take a shower & bubble bath, separately! To top it off, there was a beasutiful big flat sceen tv! Need I say more? Well definitely deserves the a try! No regrets!

Reviews.Title: “Going for Glamour”
Reviews.Author: Elderlytraveller
Reviews.Content: A really stunning hotel, beautifully maintained. I love the way the floor rugs are fitted into the floor, so that you don't trip over them. This is where I go for a "splurge", and I book a shop-house room which has all the lovely antique fittings. My husband loved the big spacious desk. Close enough to Bugis Junction and the Seiyu Department Store with its fabulous basement foodhall (great if you like Japanese food at reasonable prices), but also quite central for the historic, colonial district. It is within walking distance of the old churches and Raffles hotel, and close to the Kampong Glam and the Mosque area. There are many cheaper hotels, but this is the place for glamour!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HH20255
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights and I have to say everything was perfect. Service was outstanding and will def. book that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry&Pat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a Far East tour. We booked the hotel Intercontinental in Singapore for 3 nights and it was a great hotel. The location was 4 mins from the Bugis MTR station - so very handy for getting about. The hotel room was like a small suite - 6' bed, writing cabinet, easy chairs and a coffee table with lots of space in the room. Separate shower and bath, toilet, sink etc. There was a safe in the room. Service and friendliness of staff was excellent + fixtures and fittings were all of a high standard. The hotel links onto a small Mall and across the road is more of a local market area. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel As 1st time visitors to Singapore we found the MTR very easy and cheap to use and get about.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaleem
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in Singapore and I was amazed with the Hotel. The hotel is in middle of a shopping centre. All the essentials are just a few minutes walk away. There is even a ceinema theatre too. The rooms are very classic and the wood work in the rooms gives it a very unique ambiance. I highly recommend this hotel for family and buisness visits. Although i had a few technical issues with my access room card. I had to change my card almost everyday I return to the hotel. Its a lovely Hotel and I would love to stay again in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be coming back”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_Mike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had researched via TripAdvisor as well as my wife having stayed at Intercon Singapore many times for business although hadn't been back to Singapore for 7 years. Overall, our experience was close to excellent, and I will get back to that. The one weak point was the check in. We had booked via Intercon website which , as promised, had given best rate we could find. We arrived in Singapore and stayed with a friend for a couple of days and during this time we walked up to the Intercon one day and just decided to check we were booked in okay for our stay starting in a couple of days. The reception girl had one of those blank faces no matter what you said and how much you smiled and she appeared pretty young. She couldn't find our booking so went to another than another before finally finding it. We rang again on the morning of check in and found we were missing again. This time I decided to speak to reception on Club Incontinental floors where we were staying and I got a much smarter, older, more helpful staff member who said she would ring back. She did, problem solved, there had been a typo with our surname and a new system introduced at the same time so double trouble. There was even a letter apologising re any check in problems due to system change when we did get into our room on the day. Having said that, the rest of our stay was a dream come true. Every staff member always had a smile for us, the taxi doormen and door lady were always friendly, efficient and happy to offer advice on other matters as well as the helpful concierges near front desk. Club Incontinental lounge with great breakfast, all day coffee/tea and soft drinks and 5.30pm to 7.30pm free beer, wine, champagne and canapes was an absolute must, even if we were going out for dinner later. Also had desk in one of the two connected lounge rooms to check mail etc via broadband connection so we didn't bother with taking our laptop or internet cafes. Pool was great while acknowledging previously mentioned problem from other reviews of no sun until mid morning because of position of main hotel building. Room was great, king size bed, fresh local fruits and 2 x mineral/spring waters every day and l'occitane toiletries, very nice. Big bath, temp setting controlled shower and largish bathroom plus bathrobes, slippers made for a nice stay. The staff in the Club Lounge were especially nice and we let the hotel know in feedback forms when we left. We planned to stay 5 nights and added one more before we flew home. No real complaints only compliments for a great stay at one of Singapore's older hotels, (1995), that still carries it with class, style and lots of staff smiles.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: nantyffin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Intercontinental several times over the past few years & can highly recommend this gem of a hotel. The standards of accomodation, service & food are always well ahead of the pack. The attention to detail given by the friendly staff is quite remarkable. Whenever a trip to Singapore is on the cards, I always make sure that the Intercontintal has accomodation available.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: surajaydb
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 young kids and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights recently. Our stay got off to a great start when the hotel upgraded us to a peranakan wing room, which was huge with 2 queen-size beds, a big bathroom and tastefully decorated. I would strongly recommend the peranakan wing rooms for a different experience, particularly since they are accessible by a discreet walkway through the Bugis Junction mall which is intertwined (to an extent) with the hotel. Breakfast was great, and the public areas of the hotel were beautifully decorated and maintained. Breakfast for children under 6 was free, which was unusual and greatly appreciated. Now for the downside. The airconditioning in our room did not work properly the first night, and we had to switch rooms at midnight to get a good night's sleep. The problem was however solved the next day. Nevertheless, other maintenance problems surfaced during our stay eg the room was not cleaned after the aircon repair work, a handle on the cabinet was missing, the bulb for the stand lamp was fused, and some corridor doors could use a coat of paint. Having said all that the hotel is good value for money, and I would definitely stay there again. If only more attention was paid to maintenance, the hotel could go shoulder-to-shoulder with the big boys ...

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Hotels Just keep Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: Having spent the summer in Australia, I was due to fly directly back from Brisbane to Norway, but decided at the last minute to stop in Singapore. I have stayed in so many hotels in Singapore over the years that I have lost count! My last stay was at the Oriental and I was more than pleased. This time I booked "last minute" and there didn't seem to be too much available, but being a memeber of Priority Club, I decided to give the Intercontinental a go. WOW! Just as good as the Oriental, and for my liking, a fine location. The hotel is situated in Bugis, about 5 mintues walk from Raffles Hotel and major shopping centres. Orchard Road is 15 minutes walk in the opposite direction, and the Boat Quay (prepare to be slightly "hassled" by throwers-in)/ Robertson Quay (nearly finished, impressive, slightly more expensive) restaurant areas took me around 20 minutes to walk to. Singapore is renowned for being conducive to those who like eating and whichever direction you go from the hotel, there is a plethora of diverse eateries. The hotel itself was spick and span, the staff welcoming (I managed to book a room with one bed instead of two beds, but they changed my reservation on the spot within seconds), and the facilities great. The rooms are large (especially if you are used to European hotel rooms!), the furnishings seemed new, the bathrooms large with a good range of cosmetics and a deep soaker tub, and the rooms have flat screen TVs. I'm going back to Singapore in April 2007, and I feel that I am spoiled for choice as far as hotels are concerned, but the Intercontinental is definately worth the price you pay, and I will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: KL5500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the staff are very friendly, but there were 3 mistakes made with my trip. I had Mr. Jo on my booking form - even though they could see I was a married lady, and my passport had Joan on it - they did not change it. I was given a smoking room when I had booked a non smoking and I was not warned at check in that they were full. The club floor was good and breakfast was very nice. I returned to my room on the last evening to discover that a letter had been left in. I had hoped it was to address my complaints about the smoking room and the error with my name. No it was a fax relating to a tender that some other guest in the hotel had asked to be sent. I hand it in to the club loung and the staff did not apologise for their mistake in leaving sensitive information in the wrong guest room. They just said "Oh thank you" My colleague who was also at the hotel encountered errors with her name - although her booking was in her name - they changed the name to her boyfriends name and started to refer to her as her boyfriends sirname and Mrs too. Two men also arrived at her room mid afternoon 2 days before she was due to check out asking why she had not vacated her room! The hotel will need to tighten up on these things it does not create a good image.

Reviews.Title: “You get gold for the price of silver....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short two night stay at the superb Singapore Intercontinental. Whislt we were the there, the local media had news on the fact that the hotel could be sold but the staff said that Intercontonental will still run it. We had a club room which gave us access to the lounge on the 11th floor. The club lounge staff were fantastic and even remembered the drinks that you like. The room itself was great and I loved the Philps LCD TV in the room. Pity I spent so little time in the hotel as with 48 hours in the Lion City, there is a lot to do. Shopping is a local favourite pastime and the busy Bugis mall is adjacent to the hotel. Entrance is from the hotel lobby. The hotel is situated in town, close to Raffles, Suntec and the Esplanade. It's a short taxi ride to orchard Road and if you want tog et away from the hectic Orchard Rd area, then this hotel is a must. The pool is nice but it's the quality of accommodation, location, service and excellent price that makes this hotel the best in Singapore. Raj, the concierge was amazing, and the front office staff were also more than helpful. Once again, I have to mention the rooms - they were big, comfortable and bright. The bed was to die for, the bathroom fantastic and did I menion that LCD TV?

Reviews.Title: “5* for only $160”
Reviews.Author: Clerkenwell
Reviews.Content: We booked here on the advice on trip advisor and for the price. It is an excellent hotel for the money. Starting with the assistant helping you out of the cab and taking your luggage and then onto the assistant who registers you in your own room, having escorted you there. The lounge bar is glorious with the exorbitant prices that, unfortunately, I expect from a five star hotel. We didn't have time for the pool but, it looked good from our bedroom. The location is perfect for Bugis Street and only a five minute walk to Raffles and Raffles City. The only two slight reservations are the charges for internet access S$0.25 per minute and the long wait for taxis in the early evening. The latter is a problem of the city, the former is just a con on the hotel's part. Many other locations offer this service for free so the Itercontinenral Group need to review their policies. We didn't let this dampen our stay and ww would gladly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: theWill
Reviews.Content: was there just recently and really enjoyed the ic singapore. it was in a great location and a nice walk to everything. the staff, namely the bell, could be a bit friendlier and the rooms could use a bit of an update but besides that it was a very nice hotel, especially the bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Intercontinental, full of character and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Dreaming_of_Elysium
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights on our outward journey to Austrailia and found it a delightfull place to stay. We arrived at about 9 am and were quickly checked in and shown to our room immediately with no extra charge (much appreciated after a 14 hour journey from England). The hotel feels very homely because the foyer is not huge and impersonal, and it never felt busy at any time during our stay. The staff were friendly and efficient and always had a smile and a hello for us. The feel of the hotel is old world charm with lots of wood , flowers and antiques, and felt luxourious without being intimidating or too glitzy. Our room on the 15th floor had a great view towards the Marina and over the roof tops of Raffles and was charming and well appointed, with really comfortable large twin beds with space in between and all around. The bathroom was marble with a great mirror and separate shower cubicle. Breakfast was very good in a light filled atriium , a lovely way to start the day. Pool area is a little small and is shaded by the building untill about 11.30am so no sunbathing in the morning which was a problem on the days we were there as it was only sunny until the daily heavy showers about 3pm. Only gripe... late checkout as promised in the luxury weekend deal we had was not , as we thought ,automatically included, we had to wait untill the day of departure to have it confirmed , and only got till 2pm when we begged ( Raffles plaza gave us till 3pm on an ordinary week nite without quibble or charge, immediately on check in). But all in a great comfortable hotel with the added attraction of a lively shopping area attached and colourfull Bugis St market just across the road for a less sanitised shoppping experience if you want it. Would stay again if I could get the same advance room rate, which was very cheap at £72.00 a night booked direct through the Intercontinental web site.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - good base”
Reviews.Author: RJK69
Reviews.Content: Check-in handled well - allocated 5th floor rooms. Connecting doors not opened due to spring closure - soon rectified by 2 door stops though. Little view from room, just the roof of adjacent shopping centre. Comfortable beds, seperate step in shower cubicle, very well appointed. Small pool & kids pool - only 18 sun beds but usually some available. Good location with small shopping centre/ good food court & MRT linked to hotel. Thought the restaurants were expensive compared to the local outlets. Staff friendly & helpful although failed to advise an attraction was closed when ordering a cab for us. Definately recommended though.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night (1 April), following the recommendations from the Trip Advisor forums. I had an early flight from Mumbai and I got to the hotel at 7:30 AM. I was expecting to use their left luggage service until I could check in, but they gave me a room that early, which was fantastic. They apologised because it had 2 single beds instead of one, but they were big enough. The room was spacious, clean and looked great, just like the hotel as a whole. Their gym is open 24 hours a day, which is something I've never seen anywhere else. As a footnote, I pre-paid the room, and discovered that for some reason they had charged 6 nights instead of one. But I told them and they immediately debited my card. I paid 95 Euro, which I think is a reasonable price for such a hotel. I really enjoyed my stay in Singapore, and I'll certainly return to this hotel as soon as I have a chance to come back to this beautiful city/country.

Reviews.Title: “didnt stay”
Reviews.Author: RichardB100
Reviews.Content: Booked a room wanted to check in at 9am and check out at 9pm the next. They wanted to charge me three nights for the privelage! Three other hotels in singapore charge 1/2 night extra including, fullerton and pan pacific which I booked. Greedy hotel and little regard for regular customer.
